content:
I happened to walk into this coffeeshop and noticed this stall in the extreme left corner.

From their menu, I decided to have lontong as it has been a long while since I last ate.

I was expecting the usual bland lontong, but was pleasantly surprised by their lontong.

The rice cake was nice and firm enough without it being too soft and lumpy.  The piece of tofu was fried nicely, soft inside but firm on the outside.

The lontong gravy was also very flavorful, and when mixed with their sambal, it turned out to be a very good combination.

Overall this would be amongst the top 3 lontongs that I have eaten in SG.

Definitely worth trying their other dishes the next time I am in this coffee shop.

Truly an iconic stall in the west. Be sure to get your breakfast here.

Nasi sambal goreng was really nice. Serunding and sambal were sweet but that’s ok.

Today i bougth 2 pkt chicken frm jurong west st 91 its was so saltish tat we cannot even eat it.
End we throw the both pkts.
Plssss taste before serving customer in future.
We are not get it fr free.
$9 is also a hard money fr us.
Plsssss take note ya.
Tried their kway teow grg, lontong kering, nasi grg kampong, all so nice! My fav malay stall in jurong west so far! Highly recommended!
Good and authentic Malay dishes. The sambal goreng is really nice.
Ordered chicken rice the other day from this stall and it was subpar, portion was small and for $4 I expected to be a little bit more filled. Hence the rating
I tried their Nasi Sambal Goreng from Foodpanda and it was really good! Sambal was more on the spicy side but i can tahan spicy so !!! Will try their other food in future!

Bought curry chicken with rice for takeaway, it’s tasty and good. Reminds me of childhood. But it’s too spicy, I wish they would tone down the spice. Quick and efficient order taking and service. Their other dishes also look delicious. $6.50 is a bit high for coffeeshop standard but the quality is there. Adequate portions. Will come back and try other dishes.

First time trying their zi char and I would say that service and food are both relatively above average.

There are a few order takers so you will never be neglected, unless there’s a huge crowd who wants their order taken at the same time.

Upon ordering, the food came out in less than 10 minutes. This amazed me as I expected to wait for about 10-15 minutes.

Food is well seasoned and relatively fresh, given that they are always very crowded every night and opens till quite late at night for the supper crowd. The food is tasty even though it is halal.

A lot of seatings and turnaround is fast, so don’t have to worry there’s no seats.

Plus, the tables are clean compared to a lot of coffee shops.

Will definitely come back again to try their seafood fried rice as I saw a few who came to packet seafood fried rice.

Seldom being there, unless we do visiting, the place was clean, well managed, there's a lady to check all your entry. The foods was good and the service was excellent, more choice, the price was reasonable too. Hope to be there again soon. The stall is inside Teh Tarik Eating House at blk 456 Jurong West. Thanks
Food was nice and good. Nice serving portion. Good spread. They have sets. Staff was friendly.

Order fried bee hoon without taugeh but still put taugeh & order sambal fried rice & nasi goreng kampung didn't mention never put vege but came very with vege.
Nasi goreng kampung taste like normal fried rice.
Trying for the first time, should say that I was really impress by the taste and quality of food. Will definetly go back in future.
Quick and friendly service. Food quality is great...

Ordered salted egg crab on Nov 8 at past 10pm thru Foodpanda @ $50+ for a piece. The crab was depressing, I hardly ate any crab meat.  meat was mushy and solid, not firm and springy.  Meat was sticking to the shell, the main shell itself had nothing.  When your eatery/restaurant has "seafood" on it, pls live up to it!  The food that came is just $5 worth or less for the salted egg gravy which was so so.  I was scammed!
Did not order any food from them but I've ordered in the past and food is not too bad either. Their service quite fast. Not bad.
Wide variety of Muslim halal food choices here, all reasonably priced.

Bad experience ordering from foodpanda with this restaurant. Suppose to arrive at 1115 but waited until 12 am with no update from restaurants itself or foodpanda Last and never gonna order from them again

Fast service and taste of food served is consistently good. Special mention for Thai honey chicken wings, kuayteow goreng, salted egg dishes and the chyesim soup with salted egg.
Friendly staff, esp Sally and Xi Ren

Their crab very fresh! The chinese aunty taking order very friendly too!

So far, all the food we ordered all fantastic!

Highly recommended.

The food was delicious especially from the cfud stall , seating arrangement sufficient , clean and well ventilated dining space
Only the drinks prices were overpriced compared to other eating outlets

Food is good but the price?
Hefty and expensive.For someone who is making business here,getting twice of the price that they are able to get compared to when they are making business in their own country is fair enough but when prices ranging from $5+ onwards just for a meal,it is quite pricey I would say.
I find the portion is big if you eat there compare to packet..price reasonable.
Had been coming here for quite a few times. Service here here is good . food taste great and the staff is friendly.
Their hor fun was awesome. Both me & wifey love it very much. Service was extremely fast & well packed.
Nobody eat cockles without sambal kicap. Instruction not followed. Order date: 21/03/2021. Time: 14:12. Receipt no. v8qe-8dl9. Amount: $48.19. Thumbs down for this...👎
Bought $13 sweet and sour chicken through foodpanda, and the amount given worth less than $5. If i knew i rather buy the rice set that they give more chicken.

Portion is big, food is nice.

Value for money
Good food, clean place. Table service available

I LOVE THEIR CHILLI CRAB!!!

Delicious food!!!! Keep wanting more and more.

Recommended place to eat with your family.. Price is acceptable for delicious food.
Be careful and double check of what you order either having there or take away. Good luck
Okok price increases but taste wise is ok.
Very testy food
Good affordable price
My always favourite eating places with family
Tom yam fried rice super👍n other's menu too
Hor  fun  my choice, never miss
Very nice 👌
This restaurant is located in a halal coffeeshop
Good price for big portions.
A varieties of halal food available.
Wide variety of food here
Malay cuisines with taste food
Seafood always the best..
Some staffs are very rude at this branch
Love the food here.
Good food
Best of west
Not bad....
Worthy
Expensive drinks
Nice food...
Not much customers on weekdays MD and some of the stalls are closed.

(Translated by Google) Eat more

(Original)
Makan lagi

Good selection of stalls from dessert, soup, rice and noodle dishes, rojak, popiah, etc.

Plenty of tables and quite clean.

Tried the popiah and it's alright, the green bean/sago soup and ice kachang are pretty good.

This is not a review of all the stalls in general, but one specific dessert stall here.   For $1.80, the portion is not only small, the bowl used is so shallow - totally not worth the price.  All water & not much barley nor bean curd skin.  If not for the ‘ok’ taste, I would give it a one star.  Not worth another visit / patronage.

A very healthy choice of Yong Tau Fong here.  Soup is not overly salty but sufficiently savory to the taste bug. 👍🏻👍🏻

My second visit with 3 pax. We tried out the char pot rice, KL Hokkien mee and last the oyster omelette. The best I liked is the oyster    omelette. Each bite of it comes with a flavorful taste. The stall selling both the oyster omelette and pork noodle. So do expect some waiting time.
Nice but abit salty and oily. Price abit expensive too. Only 5 pcs with noodle costs $7 per bowl.

The Penang-style charkoayteow is recommended here. Altho fried five plates each time, the koayteow has sufficient 'heat', 2 prawns and egg for a tasty treat. Only missing the cockles and Chinese sausage for an authentic Penang rendition. However, the place lacks sufficient seats so may have to stand around while a diner finishes.

Asked for extra pork lard for my wanton noodle, the stall assistant proceed to give me a 10min lecture of how expensive pork lard is and I have to pay extra $0.50, which is a very small amount as $0.50 cannot even buy bread nowadays.

Attached photo of a Ba Chor Mee I bought elsewhere with extra pork lard, no extra charges required.

Seems like Malaysia boleh not boleh already
Penang Fried kuay teow is the dry type with no heavy dark sauce. A little bit of spicy taste though seller says no Chilli. No cockles too. Replaced with prawns.

The most terrible char kuey tiaw I have ever eaten. Tasteless, dry, soggy, worst than any neighbourhood hawker centre. Totally different from the first day of opening of Malaysia boleh. Please close down if you cant maintain it well, somemore charge for sgd6.80 for this. Please DON'T say it's Penang char kuey tiaw, it's an insult to Penang people.

The chendol here increaeed to $2.50 but still is much better than most others.
Like the carrot cake with bean sprouts and a bit of lard crisp, may need to wait for 10mins if they are doing fried prawn noodles...
The taste of the mee rebus is competent, there is not much ingredients. Ok for $3.50...
Tried the ipoh yong tau foo - not bad curry was thick and flavourful but a but pricy for ytf...
Teenager remarked that the ice kang at $2.50 was more worthwhile than chendol... heehee

Mixed review for this one. 🤔
.
Taste wise, i think #AhPoonTraditionalBakZhang serves delicious #BakZhang (aka #RiceDumpling). The taste is great and savoury, and the ingredients are well cooked. I tried the one with #SaltedEggYolk and its yummy.
.
Unfortunately towards the end, i found a big piece of partially melted plastic in my rice dumpling. 🤢 I mean, this kind of things happens, especially when it is handmade. Hence i discreetly bring it to the aunty and inform her of the foreign object in my food.
.
To my disappointment, neither did i get a replacement/refund (not expecting it btw), nor did i receive any apology. The seller is quick to justify why this kind of things happen. 🤷🏻‍♂️🤦🏻‍♂️
.
#StanzFoodHunts #JurongPoint @jurongpoint #MalaysiaBoleh @malaysiaboleh_sg @malaysiabolehsg #ChineseCuisine #HawkerCuisine #肉粽

The best place to get Malaysian food in Singapore. Although it is not super tasty but the taste is there. If you are having homesick and miss Malaysian food, this is the place where temporarily fix your craving. I tried char kuey teow and rojak. Both were not bad. Have to queue for ckt but not long. The other day I had mee siam too ($3.50). Ckt costs at $4.50 for small and Rojak is $3.50 for small. Be prepared to hunt for seats because always crowded as usual and just be patient to look around and wait for the seats. Usually people will leave once they finished their meals.

Lots of delicious food.

Fried carrot cake is ok.
Lontong is great.
Chilli Ban Mian deproved.

Penang Char Kway Teow($4.50)😋
Kway Teow were cooked using pork lard oil to cook as I had some crunchy pork lard bits while eating. Big portion of eggs and bean sprout used. With few sauce & seasoning, the aromatic tastisfying Kway Teow with a mild spicy kick served with 2 big fresh deshell tender prawn is ready to be eaten.

A place packed with Malaysia hawker flair. Fried guo tiao is always the hot favorite with a long queue. I like the Penang prawn noodles, curry chicken noodles, bak kut teh, pig trotters claypot, claypot rice, duck rice, pig organs guo tiao and the nasi lemak stall’s chicken wing. There’s also an interesting dried version of ban mian that’s spicy.

The light snack or dessert, such as chendol, popiah and steamed bun is tasty too.

The place is also kept very clean with the highly efficient aunties who are clearing the tables.

IG: sgfood13

good food as cheap as hawker centre, tried most of the food stalls here and all are pretty good and worth the try! the longan drink at the entrance really quenches the thirst and one of my fav here would be the chaykeowtiao and hokkienmee!

Wow, incredibly rude cashier guy at wanton mee stall. Quite uncough and not sure what's got into him to display such attitude to customers. Food wise, definitely not worth the time and money. Noodle is dry and way undercooked, very tough and has powdery feel to it. The char siew is dry and tasteless. The guy cooking it wore glove in 1 hand, and he picks up ingredients using the ungloved hand, which is kinda disgusting.

All the stalls are now open though some delicacies like the popiah was nowhere to be found during this pandemic.. this eating spot in Jurong Point have food stalls featuring the famous dishes from the popular locations in Malaysia like Penang and Ipoh.
Nice penang prawn noodle, teh o peng in retro metal mug & traditional apam snacks
If you’re craving for some really good nasi lemak, come down to this place. Well worth the $4.50
Nice food of Malaysia although not all stall is open but most of them still selling. Food is better than Malaysia chiak.
This review is only meant for the KL Hokkien Mee and Waton Noodle. Super lousy attitude and bad service from the 2 Uncle. Avoid if you can. Really will spoil your appetite....

Wide range of Malaysian food from popular tourist spots. Food taste okay and slightly resemble Malaysia's. For those craving for Malaysian food, can try it here. Try to avoid peak hours such as lunch or dinner hours because it's similar to foodcourt and your have to "chop" your own seats. 😂
Tried the fry oyster from the stall behind the drink bar, there are total two stalls. Not nice , the worst i ever tried! no fragrance of oyster just like fried  starchy eggs......

Super crowded on the weekend and difficult to find a seat but the kway chap is super worth it.

There were a lot more stalls I would love to try again, especially the chicken clay pot rice, the congee and some of the more traditional offerings.

Kway Chap and Braised Duck stall are both gone now.

Malaysia Hawker delights! Authentic Ipoh taste and Penang style delights! Love the hor fon prawn and chicken noodles. Love the unique Ipoh aroma white coffees. Love that relaxing spacious lounges well decorated for nostalgic Malaysia Kampong atmosphere and warm services. Freshly prepared healthy ingridients with tender loving caring skillful cooking and professional authentic skills. Get the taste when cannot go to Malaysia. Friendly cosy comfy ambience for romantic intimates groups students tourists & families.
There is a bakuteh stall near the chendol stall.  soo garlicky good.   The chendol is perfect dessert match
A authentic taste of Malaysian Food. Gotta be best Malaysia Boleh outlet in term of taste and variety. Not easy to find seat but its all worthwhile

My go-to place whenever I need a quick fix of Malaysia taste. The taste of the Char Kway Teow is consistent but they do not allow any customisation 😅

I would recommend the Nasi Lemak, Mee Hoon Kueh, Claypot Bak Kut Teh & Claypot Rice!

The Cendol is the best that I have tasted so far. Very fragrant gula melaka taste 😋
CKT looks nice but was pretty bland, generous with the beansprouts thou.

The best Malaysia Boleh In Singapore is in Jurong Point.  Upon entering, you can see how the rice dumplings is been wrapped as the rice dumplings festival is approaching.

The bak ku teh cum Claypot rice stand to have the longest queue.

Penang Chendol is 2 dollars and have standard here.
Nice place to find Malaysia food.

A regular recommended  老鼠粉said very similar to Malaysia taste.

Mee Hoon Kuey Stall
The super super bad experience in my life. The staff can't speak properly in both languages, mandarin and English. Just anyhow shouting, the diners all don't know the food is for who. Super super bad queues management. Not in system. The diners can anyhow take other person order. PLEASE TAKE NOTE train ur staff properly. Don't spoil Malaysia standard.

KL Wanton Mee: FAIL! Worst & Rudest Service of all stalls in Jurong Point Malaysia Boleh. Food isn’t really that fantastic, either. Nowhere compared to the original one in KL Malaysia.

Worst Service: Obnoxious stall holder (the thinner, bespectacled one) is EXTREMELY RUDE, damn bad attitude, laments LOUDLY (instead of apologising for not having enough small change) & even turns away customers & refusing to serve them whenever they pay using $50 note.

Hello who do you think you are to decide how customers should pay you??!!

Classic example of a damn proud, arrogant and UNEDUCATED Hawker. Food is also NOT THAT fantastic. A very bad name to the Malaysian hawkers I know of!

It is a place for malaysian to ease their heart when they miss home. I always here for its hokien prawn noodle or hokien mee for penang lang😄 No joke this hokien mee bested some stalls in penang. It used to serve with bak kut but maybe today im abit late, bak kut just gone...

ordered a foodpanda self-pick up order. when i arrived i ask the staff at the pickup area if the food is ready. he rudely told me just go and wait and dont ask? waited a good 20-30mins past the stipulated pickup time. when i asked him again he shouted at me to go ask the stall itself why is the food not ready?! attitude problem

This is the review of the shop that sells coffee. I ordered coffee. The person who took my order repeated the order to the cashier so as to let her know how much to charge me for it. However, instead of  giving me coffee, the person who took my order gave me tea. I went back to the stall holder to inform her she gave me the wrong order. Instead of apologising for her mistake, she insisted I ordered tea. She even interrogated me like a criminal if I tasted the tea. Unbelievably rude. I will not patronise this store ever again.

Usually come here only to eat the Mee Rebus and Longtong. But recently I found my favourite, Clay Pot chicken rice, been ordering the $8.50 (Big) to share with my wife. More ingredients then the $5.50 (Small) ones. Worth it?

The Char Kway Teow,  not even the 2nd best off all that I've try. Told the hawker more chilli, he don't even care. Just scoop from the wok he just fried and give it to me. 👎
Will try others stalls the next time and comment, 😄 hope I remember and not go straight to my favourite.

Was quite authentic on its opening. Over the years felt like the taste has been altered to suit local palate. The must eat would be the standalone chendol stall near the middle island (with fake trees), best chendol in Singapore.

First time try the coffee at the new drink stall 怡保白咖啡. I came ard 3 pm. The ice coffee is come with coffee jelly but coffee jelly is out of stock and there's no choice of coffee without coffee jelly. It will be better if there's the choice of ice coffee without coffee jelly.

Ordered Lor Bak for dinner via foodpanda. Not sure whether the insides of the ngor hiang (beancurd meat roll) is supposed to be wet or not. Found it slightly disconcerting but finished it because it doesn't taste spoilt or weird. Big mistake. Had tummyache for the entire night then started having diarrhear and nausea since morning. Safe to say that I won't be ordering anything from there that isn't freshly cooked to order from now on.

Great place for yummy, value for money food. 拉车面(rickshaw noodle) was really yummy at $2. Pork noodle has good portion of pork and liver, wanton noodle was delicious. Also love the bak ku teh here (herbal version), and the chilli ban mian. Would definitely be back to try other dishes.

Now bigger and better and with a wider range of authentic food from Malaysia. Price is also very reasonable for a food court and I must say it’s about the same price as eating at a coffee shop. Very popular so expect to wait a bit to secure a table for yourself and your dining partners. The bigger the group, the longer the wait. I always go for the char kway teow and steamed chicken. On weekdays, there a 50cents coffee or tea promotion. Best paired with the huge Amy Yip bun stuffed with chicken

Ordered for Char Kway Teow no chilli for takeaway. Store assistant handed me one prepacked on the counter.

I double checked for no chilli, but store assistant now say no such thing as no chilli. I just asked him not to add in chilli when cooking, he insist cannot don't add.

Ice kacang..
Small bowl but filling and nice..
Very nice taste..
Fun to sit there n eat..
Like an out of Singapore experience

Really delicious and cheap Malaysian food right here in Singapore. The KL hokkien Mee, Char Kway Teow and claypot are must-trys. If you are into rojak, give it a go as well. The ambience and decor makes you feel like you are in Malaysia. But expect long queues and you may have to stand around for a while before getting a seat.

This is like the most awesome food court ever, full of delicious, freshly cooked Malaysian delicacies. Large and airy, finding a seat is usually not a problem after a short wait especially after the recent expansion. My favourites here include the Penang Char Kuay Teow, their steamed chicken (buy half chicken to share for better value, at $12), and the Gohtong Jaya Zi char stall. The rest of the other stalls are good too but these few are the standouts!
The dry chilli ban mian is good. Flavourful sauce with thick, chewy noodles.
Great Malaysian hawker food options. Duck is yummy with kuay teow soup, ramen, char kuay teow, chendol, popiah
Nice food at an affordable price.

Tons of foods to choose from. Tried most of the food here and my favourites include char kway teow, prawn noodles and kway chap!

Nicer than some authentic malaysian food that i've had in different parts of malaysia.
Can't travel to Malaysia? This will do for now. For me, I had hard time deciding what to eat. Everything looked so good. Finally settled for penang kway teow. Had nice wokhei taste.

I'm regular here since they open but the food standard really drop, see how oily this 2 plates oyster egg, the one that selling soup noodles always never wear gloves. Their fingers always dip in the soup when they pass you the food. But all others stall remain quality and hygiene of foods.
Worst food ive ever eaten...
Awesome

Buta Kakuni Don($9.20)
Meat is flavourful and hard but still able to chew. Comes with rice, seaweed, ginger and half a marinated egg.

Unagi Chirashi Don($9.20)
Like the rice coral of the pearl sea blooms with the petal of silky smooth sweet Unagi tango with the pistil spicy tangy pickled radish.
A taste that bless the soul.😋

Ebiko Eel Roll($9.30)(8 pcs)😄
Traffic Light(Crabmeat, Tamago, Cucumber) sushi holding an umbrella of sliced Unagi while withstanding the heavy downpour of Mentaiko rain and hail of ebiko. What a storm of umaminess it cause to Traffic Light sushi-san.⛈️☔😋
The sushi is just above acceptable. It's not fresh since it's meant to be merely fast food. If you're looking for sushi near NTU, I recommend going to Jurong Point for Genki or Sushi-Go.

Below average food at expensive prices. The only good thing is shorter queue and higher chance of getting a seat. Male cashier is rude and customer service can be greatly improved. We pay to enjoy our food and not to be treated badly and be stared at.

On 23rd April, 2021 11.50 am, just suffered a very very rude service from the cashier. idk the name of him
He told me to got out of here and did not have meal here, just because he did not see my checkin????? Actually I had shown him several times.
Very mean and rude!
Horrendous service

Worst experience ever. I placed the order at 18:09 and now it is 18:58 and I finally get my food after times and times inquiries. It seems that my order was missing in McDonald’s system.
The funny thing is that the aunties at the counter just asked me to buy food at other stalls even though I had paid in McDonald’s. They said they were busy and no one tried to get my food ready. Then I requested to get refund and gave up the food. But they just refused and said how can I get a refund after I paid the money. (Totally wired logic)
Luckily, I am not in a hurry to do something today, and another auntie finally stood up, collected my food and beverage, and gave them to me (the food in my order is just ordinary ones, why took so long to prepare). But who wants to waste time on these tiny things, right?
Lesson: don’t order at McDonald’s in NTU if they already have a lot of orders to handle.

Scrambled Egg Burger with Sausage
Fluffly scrambled egg and yummy sausage patty.

Crispy "Hainanese Chicken" Burger
Taste like McSpicy non spicy version.
Okay lah. Try once can le.
Banana Pie is Fuyoh!
Crisscut fries is standard.

Quick eats. Open sitting.
Long queue always.
Busy area.

Last few days to get spicy McNuggets.
Will miss you.

Great place to hangout with friends, however it can be very pack during peak period especially during lunch hour. Best to avoid during this period, if not you can do mobile app via using mcdonald app.

During term time alot of students placing order. Note that when I tried to order using Grab, the shop was "closed". So thinking of picking up your order? Nah. I also realised that children's Happy Meal is not available here. 😐

This was really a very busy during day time. Since i webt there evening, therw was no queue at all. It was quire free, got my orders very quickly. You will have a very hufe dining area, so finding a seat will not be an issue.

Worst experience ever!!!!!!
We spend 7.4 for the laska burgers online
However, we waited for 40 mins!!!! Could you even believe it?? We were super disappointed in McDonalds in Singapore due o the awful service. We paid by Visa card and show the receipts, yet,  compensationMcDonald doesn’t believe it and insist that we are saying nonsense. They checked the records and say that there are no records!! We almost couldn’t receive our burgers because of their lack of understanding and bad service!!!!! They even looks like that they don’t believe in us at the end even if we show them the receipt of visa card(also the message) Surely, we deserves a compensation! How could Mc Donald’s waste our time and being so demanding and mean to us! Please apologize to us. We feel awful. This McDonald doesn’t even deserves a visit guys

McDonald's food with good standard, will keep up with outlets outside NTU and have the new menus. My only complaint is that it is always crowded during lunch time, but it shows it's popularity. Remember to ask for more chilli if you need.

Normal mcdonalds but subsidised prices as it is inside university campus. No dedicated seating as seating is open for mcdonalds, the subway, the long jhon silver's, the starbucks and the food court above

Nasi Lemak burger is back and the taste is good. McD is Super popular and there’s always a line so expect waiting time. The people behind the counter work hard and are happy to help. Having eaten here so many times, the error rate isn’t worth mentioning and their diligence is definitely appreciated.
1/6 ordering kisoks down during lunch period. No one manning the physical cashier.
Currently there is no dining in at NTU McDonald canteen. Due to covid-19
The app had a glitch this morning, but staff had good service recovery.
Unable to use the "deals" from the mcdonald app but overall serving speed was relatively quick.

Not that it was bad, but on Sat at 11:45am the ordering kiosks already switched to the lunch menu. For some strange reason we couldn’t find the Happy Meal as a selection, I’m not sure if it’s because it’s on NTU campus? The line moved relatively fast but it still took us 20-25 minutes to get our order as there were tons of people.
Served cold stale choco pie. Asked about it and they say they don't heat it up before serving or smth LOL
Fast friendly service. Standard McDonald's menu.
The French fries here are too dry and not crispy at all. But it's the only option students have here for for late night food.
Worst experience ever! Please do be nice to your customers!
You can get most of the local hawker foods reasonable price. Due to covid, only 2 pax per table, so there is waiting time . Waiting time per order and table est 20mins.

The line is simply always too long here. They have an efficient ordering and collecting system so things move. Avoid peak lunch hours. Staff is nice and keep things moving along as fast as possible. Have occasionally had bad food here though. Especially the fries which is a shame because McDonald’s fries are usually so good. And I believe prices are slightly lower because it’s an educational campus.
Clean and spacious. The kiosk machine was operating with a enough distance during this COVID sensitive time.
The fast food joint serves independant self-serving, order placing booths to customers. Food is as good like any other MacD outlets. Warm, fresh and crazily yummy.

Very fast service despite large number of customers yet the quality of the food is not at all compromised. I would even say this is the best McDonald's food I've ever had quality wise. Six ordering stands are available so service flows very smoothly. Fantastic experience
In a time where burger shops are getting ahead of themselves, trying to be gourmet and all, good old McDonald’s is the best. Honest for what it is. The taste of no pretence is most delicious
Do not order when lots of people is lining especially on Sunday. The front counter 's work slowly. Have to wait for a super long time.

As usual, as great as the brand already is....
• Very good taste of it's food as usual.
• The staff is very friendly.
• Cleanliness is well maintained.
• Situated in a food court kind of environment, in North Spine plaza, NTU.
• Does have self-ticketing machines to order whatever you want.
• Overall a great experience.

Waited my order for 10mins over the counter, my number was called but the crew have no idea where was my order. I ordered to eat in, but they packed it up. So i had to wait for then to find it and put it on the tray....   Had breakfast muffin and wrap each time and the egg has shell... Big breakfast was unavailable on the saturday and have limited options... bad
The standard McDonald's experience within the campus of NTU. Accessible and affordable for everyone.  Only downside is the huge crowds drg peak hours drg school time.
Fast and efficient service. You can order online and wait for your turn to pick up your order. Not many seats available due to safe distancing.
Hiding in NTU, great place to hang out with family during weekends as its always not crowded.
NTU student favourite food but also the most hated outlet because none of mcdonald deals are applicable to NTU outlet. -.-

The staff here keeps getting the orders wrong.
Not sure if they are under staffed or slow.
Some of the staff here are rude too.

The food is okay...it's McDonalds 😂

I have ordered from this McDonald's twice, and both times I was given the wrong food. First, I got a burger instead of McNuggets, and the the second time I was given chicken wings instead of a McChicken. Dissappointed. Just wanted some nugs...

The service staff here are very friendly and food is slightly cheaper than outside. Otherwise there is still a lunch crowd but surprisingly wait times are not unreasonable

Pretty good place
Located at north spine plaza those who visit there don't worry there's alot of food selling there.
Life-saver food shop for students as it opens late at night. Always crowded, sometime they serve the wrong order, make your to check before grabbing your to-go food.
Long queues during peak hours, but very efficient service. Standard McDonald's menu available.
It's mostly the only place in NTU open to eat till midnight and they use that as a leverage to serve NON-FRESH food, mostly buns. On a good side, staff is very nice.
It has the longest operating hours and it's still open at night and on weekends when all other eateries in NTU are closed.
It's MacDonald's, the same one everywhere. Qs can be a bit chaotic during mealtimes, otherwise it's all good. There is no air-conditioning but plenty of seats.
Very good
Would be great if McDonald's app deals are redeemable here
jus aany other macdonald but note that they dont allow the mcdonald app deals
Available at late night when other shops are closed. Prices are usually lower than other McDonald's outlets
bad service and taste. just near to my workplace.
Today's twisty fries and nuggets was excellent, very crispy. 10/10
Bloody 30mins for one apple pie, the brigade is inefficient inside the kitchen, the manager has no assertiveness over the members
Slightly cheaper and less choice compared to other McDonald's restaurants in Singapore and, sadly, the only option for a late dinner in NTU.
Good service and many tables to sit and have the meal.
Taste like regular mcdonald's, price is the same as non institutional outlets
Went to LJS NTU at 7:30 and after ordering, the cashier informed us that some of the things we ordered were sold out and they offered to give us some freebies to make up for it. Thanks abang!

1. Very slow service
2. Sometimes closes before the stated time
3. If ordering during non-peak hours, the food can be soggy and not fresh

Highly recommend to wait if you see not more than one person in the queue.

Standard fast food. Part of the Secret Society thats keeping LJS alive. Haha.
Yum yum.

Service kinda mixed up sometime
We know how it's always feel wonderful to be back to where we belong..  Your alma mater.. To see how much has changed over the last twenty years is just amazing..

I ordered dory,and they had problems finding it,I guess... It's been 15 minutes and counting... I see some people have waited 20 minutes...
I think they really need to review practices or they'll be out of business soon
Really nice staff! Food is prepared when asked, excellent service.
service is really slow here and sometimes i order the rice bowl it comes cool..
Very nice, wait 15 min havent get order
Nice..good service.. staff was very polite n friendly
The person say closing soon at 730 pm but it closes at 8 smlj
They pour drink first and wait for food. So I cannot get cool and fresh drinks
Best environment to enjoy the meal
The staff at the counter is very rude and poor service.
Very friendly staff with good service!
hire more ppl during exam weekends!!
I love having my lunch here. the atmosphere is chill and the windows are bright. What a Beautiful day~ Thank you Phillip for giving me this strength. See you again!

Ridiculously slow. Management too cheap to employ the necessary staff. It's one person at the cashier, one person cooking and one person wandering around. Have to wait half an hour for "fast food". Buy KFC and join behind a queue of 20 people waiting for their food.

Zingerito okok only lah. Not cheesy enough. Service still as slow as ever.

Standard KFC food. Food generally is ok but the waiting for your food to come need to take quite some time. Not sure are they lacking staff or what...
The meal I had anyway is so freaking full lol. Only thing to improve is service I guess.

The standard of food here is simply unacceptable. I’ve been here multiple times in the morning, each time with the ludicrous hope that it will be better than the previous time. The porridge is so watery it feels like you’re drinking salted rice water. There were literally only 1.5 pieces of chicken in my bowl, which itself was only 2/3 full. I have never had such an atrocious experience in other KFCs before - please close this outlet down as it is a disgrace to the brand name.
If you like your food served AN HOUR after your ordering. This is your first choice.
Come in 45mins  to 60 mins prior to your meal time. Order taking at counter slow, order peeping  is extremely slow as well.

I came here during lunch time... I tell you guys, the queue is darn long... There are only 2 workers working, 1 at counter, 1 inside the kitchen.. orders are moving at snail pace... 40 minutes to get to my order... They could only pack 1 order every 4 minutes... So please order online prior to coming down to save time.

Welcome to the WORST KFC outlet in Singapore! There is only one famous female staff that is serving and collecting payment at the same time. And you always have to wait for them to fry a new batch of chickens which takes 15 mins. The chickens are literally waiting for you to appear before they drown in the oil. There was once we waited for 45 mins for them to fry 3 batches of chickens. Mine came at the third batches. NTU KFC always doesn't have new menu like the others KFC. They do not have BBQ crunch chickens!
Also most of the GREAT promo codes that KFC offers doesn't include NTU KFC. And at night they only have chickens, no burgers. Good luck to the next batch of NTU students. Have fun camping in KFC for 1 hour!!!

It's crowded, seasonal items are often out of stock, long waiting time and sometimes the fries or the chicken are cold and soft. I'm not a big fan of fast food, but this KFC is surely not the best out there.
A great fast food option on campus. However some items are not available and there is no discounted price for students.

Ordered a BBQ pocket meal, and a zinger box with a choice of chicken for take-away.

First thing, the BBW pocket was missing, just the fries and drinks. The zinger box was fine, it had everything.

Second, the chicken i asked for was original, but the one in the box was crispy.

Third, the chicken and zinger burger was dry.

The staff were not focused at all on what they were doing. I had to remind them for the drinks that came with the meal and the box.

Anyone who wants to go should probably triple check their orders, especially for drinks and every item they ordered.

Their only saving grace was the kind uncle that gives out encouragement notes to the students.

Hits and misses here. Wait can be long during peak hours and they have a tendency to mess up are customised orders (even simple things like change of drinks). Clearing up the kfc cafe area will allow for more seating area. All these are made up for by the fantastic uncle who gives out sticky notes wishing students all the best for their study.

Always no stock of something, drink, ricebucket or original chicken

Bad and slow service, no answer phone calls

Comfortable air con seating area.

Outrageous extra charge for Diet Pepsi! Destroyers of public health

While the seating area is air-conditioned, the queues are usually very long during lunch and dinner. Service is often slow thanks to low number of staffs and a lack of self-ordering machines (Sometimes there is only 1 staff at the counter, who has to collect money and pick up the food/drink items all by himself/herself.) Items in this branch are often out of stock, and there is no indication of items running out. Hence it is annoying when I realise my desired item is out of stock after queuing for more than 15 minutes. (In McDonald's, out of stock items are indicated on the menu screen and blocked on the self-ordering machines.)

Update (07 Sep 2018): There are 2 self-ordering machines at the entrance now, but they only accept card payment. When I was there, nobody was using the self-ordering machines and there were more than 10 people queuing at the counter. I ordered through the self-ordering machine and surprisingly I received my food within 5 minutes, while the queue at the counter didn't seem to move at all. (There were only 2 poor staffs manning the counter and preparing the orders.)
They gave me the wrong order. Again. I guess Cheese Fries sounds alot like Bolognese Fries.

This post i am writing after experiencing it  after many times.Highly disappointing. food quality is so bad. Attached is the photo of  the packing  provided for takeaway... So finger licking good it is.
Doesn't stick to scheduled closing hours, items often unavailable. Otherwise standard KFC fare.

DON'T GO! I ORDERED FOOD AND IT TOOK MORE THAN AN HOUR TO COME.
SUPER SUPER BAD SERVICE, IGNORANT STAFF, RUDE BEHAVIOR.

A COMPLETE NO GO! BEWARE (Yeah you heard it right! BEWARE)
Questionable food quality in this particular branch towards the end of day. Comes free with explosive diarrhea on occasion. You're in it to win it
Not crowded. Nice place to enjoy the yummy KFC chicken 🐔
Really bad customer service taking more than an hour to serve. The NTU branch is the worst, I would suggest you to go somewhere!
Dont have many things despite having a menu. Staff kinda rude
Sooo slow😢 I am starving and have to wait for more than 30 mins.
Limited promotion but still the staff is very friendly
Missing order. Bad queue and order management. ☹️ Staff are nice though.
The worst KFC in the world! You wait a lot to eat bad food
Better off eating the food court upstairs or macs. Worst quality of service imaginable
Place is nice and there is pizza as well!
Campus price point. Approx $1 -$2 cheaper than the malls.
Almost always crowded but service and food is always good!
Such a good place to eat the meal.
Quick bite option. Usually not crowded.
Very nice ambient
Unhealthy food, don't crave too much.
so expensive despite being in campus.

(Translated by Google) Probably the junkiest KFC I've ever been to. Tell the clerk to pack, pay the 0.2 yuan plastic bag and then tell me that the beverage ca n’t be put in and I want to hold it in my hand or it will turn over. So what is the significance of my packing? The ordering machine is also broken. The production speed is also very slow, and even on weekends, there are many people waiting for meals. I have never seen KFC with such a poor service

(Original)
大概是我去过最垃圾的肯德基了。告诉店员打包，支付了0.2元塑料袋费用然后告诉我饮料不能装进去要自己拿在手上不然会翻，那我打包的意义在哪里呢？点餐的机器也是坏的。制作速度也很慢，哪怕是周末也有人多人等餐。真没见过服务这么差的肯德基
Nice Malay food stall selling rice and noodles, both fried and soup form.
Delicious but price on the high side. You have been warned...

Amazing stuff. The curry had such aromatic and deep flavours to it I can't say I've had anything like it before; and the lady's fingers were some of the tastiest I've ever had - very tender and flavorful. Of the bunch I'd say the otah is the least impressionable - quite flat and bland. My wife had the lotong and she's full of priase for it as well. The food is a little more pricey than average but I think it's certainly worth it. Highly recommended! 😋👍🏻

The portions were generous and the food is nice. The chili is absolutely tasty and goes so well with the rice. Personally, I prefer the sweeter curry as gravy over the rice. Only downside for me is the cracker is not as crunchy. Will definitely come back again.

Tasty nasi padang worth a try if u’re in the area. However prices have been creeping up like with many other places...

$6.90 for one meat two veg now. Additional 30cents for beef/seafood.

I'm nor sure abt recommended  tis  as had bad experience with the staff there who making the drink total Rude !!! As for  food bought Penang Kway Teow not sure  abt the specialty as looking at it jst normal  Kway Teow tho. Plus it's very pricey.

Tasty beef rendang.. 2 pax at $13.60. The beef is tough but is very flavourful! The Chili quail egg is not to my liking as it’s sweet. Other than that the food tasted appetising and won’t mind go back again..
Really delicious and too many great choices. Queue was long but we were lucky to get our seats. Would eat here again when Im around next time!

First time trying nasi Padang in this shop, tempted by the crowd. It’s always full house during lunch. I ordered 2 meats 1 veggie cost me $8.80. I had a slice of fish, squid and ladies fingers with ayam merah gravy and sambal belacan. The spiciness was mild for me. Overall food is average and their sets come with drink but I didn’t order the set with drinks. They also sell some kuih-muih but didn’t manage to try their kuih.
Had the beef rendang and enjoyed it. It's a smallish place and it's always crowded, so you have to queue up. But the food is worth it and affordable.

Today's 2 Nasi Lemak was terrible, barely elidable.  All the items that came with this dish have problems...

- there was almost an entire egg shell embedded in the scrambled eggs.
- the vegetable achar were basically raw with ZERO vinegar.
- the fried chicken wing was limp and basically tasteless ... and no, I do not have COVID.

You just lost a regular customer.
Place feel like the 70s..or Penang Malacca style..The Serving crews Ok except for 1 lady kind of high toned voice, kind of a bit impolite.

Over priced. Charged 6.40 sgd for one curry drumstick (no potatoes, would have to add money if asked for potatoes that were in the same food tray) and quail eggs (five of them).

No rice.
Tastes good but quite expensive. This is 5.80, but 5 stars still cos yummy chilli.
Decent home cooked style Malay meals at affordable prices.  It was fragrant and the dishes didn't taste complicated at all even though they were.
Food is good with many choices, the drinks are very pricey though (a normal cup of iced milk tea for $2.70...)

I personally like the chili squid, very spicy. The fragrance of nasi lemak rice add to the tasty meal together with veg. Laksa taste normal. They got wide variety of choice for side dish to eat with plain rice or nasi lemak rice.

Delicious food....had their nasi padang of sweet and sour fish with brjnjals and ladies fingers during 1st visit. 2nd visit was curry fish head combo...not quite to my liking but was ok, their prawn fritters was yummy and a must have. Affordable and compatible prices, will return to try their ayam merah....and of course the prawn fritters!

Got mee rebus satay, mee siam, 2 chicken wings and coffee for $17.70. Food is mediocre and pricey. The absolute downer is the workers allow people to cut queue. There was a lot of confusion about the queue and the workers allow their regulars/friends to cut queue. Even while I was eating, the queue confusion continued. For goodness sake, put up some poles, signs and lines to clear the confusion.
Delicious! Rendang quality flux slightly, meat at times rather tough.

Have always wanted to try this much touted stall and finally got a chance to. Gosh... Food is good but it sure is expensive! I can't believe I paid $11 for a plate of rice, beef rendang, chicken wing, and 2 vegs. One kailan and one cabbage. I honestly wasn't expecting this price tag when I was looking at the menu, as the nasi lemak cost an acceptable $6.50. My friend ordered that and added a fish, and it totaled up to $9.50 for his... $3 for sweet and sour fish slices? Totally not worth it.

But still, I thoroughly enjoyed the food.
It have decent dishes for the rice but their meat dishes are over priced. The atmosphere is like a typical food court with old fashion decorations.

Apr 2019. I loved the food here. We ordered Kailan, spinach, sambal fish and chicken curry.
Everything was so deliciously done and tasted home-cooked.
Other than the nice food, i saw a harmonious working culture here. The younger Malay staff could speak Mandarin and were respectful to an elderly Chinese auntie.
Lots of positive energy. 👍👍👍👍👍

Just had a plate of nice nasi padang with the red curry chicken drum stick (ayam merah), stir fried lady's finger and brinjal and a good dose of their freshly made sambal belachan. Yummy!

This eatery serves malay cuisine as well as halal certified chinese style cuisine. Very popular with our locals craving for some spicy food or chinese style halal food.

There is always a queue for the ready to order and eat items and a longer wait for speciality items like curry fish head, tau hu goreng, fried rice,  hor fun etc.

I just love their freshly made sambal belachan chilli (would be even more heavenly if they zest in the  limau purut peel). Their ayam merah is just so yummy, u gotta try to believe it! YUMMY!!!
Went for lunch, Nasi Padang is nice especially the curry gravy. Dont forget to buy Kueh Lopez is super soft and melts in your mouth.
Tasty and affordable. Need to wait for a while during peak period. Staff are all friendly.

Had it on a weekday for dinner at 530pm. The long beans was very very cold and had a slight sour taste, signs of the food being prepared and left there for a long time. Blatant disregard of food safety. Ordered Ayam Merah and what arrived was similar to curry chicken, both taste and appearance wise. Was told that this is their version of Ayam Merah......is this a joke? That is totally curry chicken. The other stir fried veggie tasted horrible too but at least it was slightly warm. Two plates cost us $13++

Was very very disappointed with the services of staff “Sira” an Indian lady. She was very rude to me and have no manners and respect .  I complained to her manager but instead of apologising to me , she defended  her staff.  I can’t tolerate such behaviour.  My lunch was served with anger and it was so toxic to eat the laksa I ordered.  I did not enjoy my meal at all.  I went back to the manager to get the No of the owner but she just pointed to me to a number and ask me to go take that down.  I could not find any number.  I want to get in the Owner Jordan to explain in detail.  Can Jordan please message me here
Food is alright . Long queue during lunch hour (weekend). They have order in menu beside normal nasi padang style but it open on 12pm onwarda only.

Good and tasty food served.
Value for money and lots of freshly fried vegetables in different style.
Only one point that to higjlight.....its always long queue especially lunch tim

Both horfun and hokkien mee are not under their "all time favorite", true, both definitely are almost tasteless although with lots of gravvy. Both definitely not reco.

Small area thus seating is limited with some seats being squeezy

10 august 2022 me and mother came here .tall Indian guy her reaction like laugh when my mother order tebu that means sugar cane it's that funnier.if he didn't understand.he can reply sorry I did understand.(fyi he can speak Malay  a bit ) very spoiler.hope you can teach your stuff to be more respectful ...
Always the curry fish head,  the taste of the gravy is so perfect though the fish head is  abit small but veg inside is generous 👌 💯
The staff is very unhelpful , unfriendly and impatient just wanted to ask very extra gravy and said no for better dining experience dine at red ginger at imm
First time trying and will be the last. Cashier is extremely rude. Have not come across such service for a long time in Singapore. Spoils my dinner.
Good standard has dropped a lot.  Indian lady cashier was rude and discriminatory. Bring your money elsewhere.
Limited time high tea set promotion during 3pm to 5pm is highly recommended. Laksa selling at 2.9 during this period
Good food. We had fisi head curry set, very tasty
Ordered black pepper chicken and vegetable. Taste was mediocre and a lil too pricey.

Bought 1 piece of Kueh Kaswi and One piece of ondeh ondeh..both the size of a 50 cent coin...was charged 0.80 each.  This was my first time buying the kueh from there and will for sure be my last time.  Way tooo Expensive. I can get a better deal elsewhere.
The food is very delicious, and I think with no artificial flavors. The price is also not too expensive.

The fish head curry is good, comes with tahu goreng.
They have nasi padang too.
Crowded during lunch hours.

We wished to bring your attention that with many years of patronage and good dinning experiences has gone to the drains.
Recently we had experienced ( many times) very rude counter staffs that were not trained in service sectors. This incidents have caused major upsets.
Hope that this bunch of jokers be replaced asap to avoid further degradation and damage to your good establishment.
Thanks
Danny Ng

The server lady was rude and hesitant when asked of the pricing about food ordered. During payment, the lady insisted that 3 dishes was order instead of 2. Hence, charging more for 2 takeaway meals. The food is nice but with such dishonest business conduct, we never go there again.
Mee soto is marvellous. 🍜Thick gravy & the spiciness level is just right. Add sambal kicap for extra ‘kick’. Service is quite fast😊👍
Nice various types of yummy malay halal food. Fast service.
Good food. Good price for a mall setting.

I am a fan of the kind of food served at this place. Couldn't find another place in this vacinity with these kinds of cuisines. The sitting area is nice, hygiene is 7 out of 10 for the kind of price they charge but the taste of the food is amazing. This place has noodles as well, but I haven't tasted them. I usually do rice with a few meat options. I usually make my own plate so the price usually fluctuates and the bill always is more than I expected. If you are looking for budget eating instead of making your own plate ask for set with a fix price where you get 1 meat + 2 veg + rice or similar combinations. I will definitely recommend eating at this place.

Restaurant selling good selection of Malay cuisine. Quite popular with shoppers and those working in or around the mall. Hence, it can be difficult to get a seat/table during meal times. Best to come early/before or after the lunch and dinner crowd. Serving portion is alright.

All good but not exceptional, good for a no-frills meal. Service is ok, food is not too bad, price is affordable but not cheap. Tried the 2 pax curry fish head set which came with tahu goreng and 2 rice for $19.90. The dishes took awhile to prep but came hot. The fish was only half, slightly small. Tahu goreng was done right and portion was good. The curry was good! However, it can be too spicy and sour for many. Order extra kang kong which was cold, but taste-wise is good. Overall i would say taste and variety is good but price, portion and service have some room for improvement.

Well it used to be quite Good with the traditional (Malay) food but after today it seems like  Standard dropped.  But the rendang is not bad failed was the curry chicken gravy got no taste. Still a popular eating ground at Jem.  Can try to see (individually) the taste . That's why I gave a 3 star. Hopefully they improve.  Surrounding you have a NTUC / Banks are conveniently located.  Still at this stage are Crowded.
Food was nice . 👍🏻

Reasonable price Muslim food eg mee siam, lotong, nasi lemak, etc. Fast moving queue as about 5 serving staff work efficiently as each staff serves each customer regardless one or five orders. Seri Muslim Food is located inside 399 Foodcourt.

Tasted mee rebus from this stall, probably one of the best in Singapore, stall is clean, food is nicely prepared and presented, price is reasonable too. 👍, I can’t wait to come back again and try other food from Seri !

One of the popular malay stalls with snaking queues on weekends which is a testament to how tasty the food is.
A stall serving malay style dishes which are nasi lemak,mee rebus,mee siam, lontong, mee soto which i believe are their best sellers. From my observation from patronizing the stall, most people will buy their nasi lemak as their sambal is delicious.
Although my favourite food and recommendation will be their mee goreng and mee rebus which will not disappoint.
Service is fast and efficient despite the snaking Q ,so be prepared to Q for a good 15-20 minutes.
Food is affordable between $3 to 4 per meal without additionals such as fishcake,chicken wing etc..

#SeriMuslimFood is definitely one of the better Malay food stalls in this area. A long queue is expected but thankfully waiting time is not very long as they have many people taking and preparing your order.
.
My favourite items from their menu are #MeeRebus and #Lontong. Standard menu items ranges from SGD$2.50 to SGD$3.00.
.
#StanzFoodHunts #TamanJurongShoppingCentre #MuslimCuisine
Foods are tasty but not so much to choose from as we came too early at 7:30am. Lontong servings size slightly smaller than others.

Their mee rebus has a nostalgic taste to it, reminded me of my childhood. It is competently prepared but it falls short of being outstanding. Very reasonably priced at $2.50.
The chicken wing is well seasoned with aromatic spices at $1.50.
Under rated Malay food stall. Long queue, fast serving. Good portion price ratio. Great tasting food with good variety. Nasi lemak must try, mee goreng when available.
One of the best mee rebus I’ve ever had. If not for the above average spiciness, I’d have another plate for sure. Be sure to add on the fried chicken wings for good measure!
Not so great even merged with boon lay nasi lemak ..food not cooked fully .
Consistently the best nasi lemak and mee goreng in Taman Jurong! And I'm comparing this to Latiffa Huri at Jurong West!
One of the best mee rebus I’ve ever had. If not for the above average spiciness, I’d have another plate for sure. Be sure to add on a fried chicken wing for good measure!
Good food that comes with long queue. Finally found a good dry mee siam. 👍👍👍
Best nasi Lemak in Jurong. Better than the one at Boon Lay shopping center. Beware of Long queue but worth the queue.
Good
Nice and affordable. Good for a weekend meal.
Nice foood

Stall only operates on weekdays as this stall is in a canteen housed in the Creative Building
It has already attracted its pool of regulars despite just operating a few months...me included
Favourite dish for me is Soto Ayam...or Mee Soto if they run out out ketupat
Their chicken broth is full body flavoured...and one would easily slurp the bowl dry...
Their chicken slice servings are peeled off fresh chicken parts as seen from the white colored chicken slices..unlike most stalls which serve overbight chicken or parts that are barely edible
Top it up with their begedil...and the dish is complete...begedil is well prepared...moist and not soaking in used oil
Their nasi padang food choices are also well seasoned and prepared...certainly worth the calories on a diet cheat day
Good for eating there or takeaway if one does not like the crowd in the canteen

Every dish is flavourful and delicious. The staff is always friendly and cheerful. The prices are also very affordable. It's definitely worth a try and also great in value. If you love Nasi Padang, you will end up being a regular customer.
Good food

(Translated by Google) Alhamdulillah, anyone who is close to Jurong East if they are hungry can try .. Good stuff doc ..

(Original)
Alhamdulillah, sesiapa yang dah dekat Jurong East tu kalau lapar boleh cuba.. Barang baik dok..

(Translated by Google) Basically Biryani is ok good

(Original)
Basically Briyani ok good

Pasta portion was okay, but not worth the steep price of $8+ . When compared to competitors nearby, you can certainly get better value for your money from elsewhere. For a baked pasta, it certainly could use more cheese. Prices are not student-friendly.
Meatball was tasty, a 3/5.  But other than that flavour-wise, the pasta was a 2/5.
Overall, the pasta tastes almost like what you would expect to find from 7-11 or cheers but less flavourful and at double the price. (although the portion here is slightly more)

I ordered cheese baked meatball pasta with mushroom. Pasta was cheesy and meatballs were tasty. The pricing is slightly more expensive than other food stalls in NTU but it’s still ok overall. Taste wise 7/10.

Pasta is really too oily, I ordered tomato sauce pasta but it tasted like fish curry....will not eat it again. Beware of the 5 star review here, its really suspicious...Look at the queue during lunch and dinner hours and the amount of people seated, its a clear sign.

I got the baked meatball Mac & Cheese. 3 pieces of meatballs, but the meatballs were great.
The taste of the mac and cheese was not homogeneous, some parts were quite bland, maybe could do better with slightly more cheese.

It should be called as heart attack pasta as pasta was very very oily and cheeze on the top makes it scarier to eat. Prices definitely are not student friendly. This pasta is a health risk and and costly for the pocket.
price is a little steep for food in a school establishment but overall decent baked pasta. would be great if there were a bit more ingredients :”) coffee was good though!
Although abit on the pricey side (could do w abit more quantity), their baked pasta is one of the best ones you can find in school!! really friendly staff too :D

Don't buy the 5-star reviews you see here. This restaurant is absolute trash -  as I'm sure you can see from the countless other 1/2-star posts. Food portion is not worth it for the price of the meal when you can get something of higher quality and quantity from Pasta Express nearby. Heck it, I think even the food courts are better. Although I have to say the 1-star mainly comes from the extremely rude Chinese uncle who prepares the food here. Has absolutely no patience with customers and speaks rudely.

Pretty shocked to see the rest of reviews right before I started digging in. I got the Chicken Tikka Pasta. On first sight looks pretty good, but the taste really isn't all that. Pretty oily inside as well. Agree with the reviews that the portion and quality doesn't justify the price ($9.42 with GST) Who even charges GST in the school though actually. Don't think I'll come again unless they shape up.

Edit: Original review was a week ago. Please take note of the 5 star reviews here, very fishy. Might be fake ones. How the hell is it value for money when someone else paid 8 dollars for 6 meatballs?
Awesome customisable pasta joint :D. Super friendly staff, warm environment, food looks AMAZING 😊😊

Their pasta is way much better than Pastamania.
Price may not be so student friendly.  But at this point of time, there is a overall hike in food price for Singapore.  I am glad they didnt compromise on the quality.
Quite a innovative concept of Baked pasta as a takeaway food. I liked the taste and speedy service. Will definitely visit again. Cheers
Store owners are very friendly and their baked pasta is really good! Will highly recommend to my friends and will definitely visit again :) Thank you!
a nice hearty pasta! it was very filling and tasted very good. the service was also wonderful here.
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ extra stars for the amazing service! food is glorious and the cheese is SO TOASTY!!! & they use paper bags too??? we love a sustainable business!!!!!
The food is served quickly and is piping hot. Really love the tomato cashew sauce - it’s a must try!
Nice to have freshly baked pasta and not expensive and portion was reasonable with the price compare to outside.
Good quality customisable pasta, although its on the pricier side. Very good and friendly service too.
Great location in middle of the school campus, able to customise and pasta was made on the spot, good service too!! Will patronise again🫶🏻
Finally I find a nice pasta shop inside the school. The pasta is nice and the waiting time is short.

This is my second visit and I orfer the chicken meat ball pasta and the same taste amazing as always.Slightly better service by the staff will be better and will be much better if management can look into this.
Yes we understand the challenges in this industry but possible to have better staff with improved service to rock.the great concept.
All the best to zitimamas team

Food reminds me of airplane food. It was a unpleasant experience.

Edit: original post from 1 week ago. Shocked to see that there are 5 stars review. Those must be fake. The food is expensive and it does not taste good. Furthermore, the service is bad. When I am there for the first time, I did not notice that I have to order online and I stood there for a long time and the staff simply ignore you. The food is oily, the croissant I had was cold. Please try for yourself to find out the truth.

As others have said, the quality of the food did not match up to the high
price (about $9). The pasta was inconsistently cooked. If you have a pasta craving within this area, I think Pasta Express or Tea Party are better choices.

EDIT: It seems that there are many 5-star reviews posted recently—make of that what you will.
zitimamas has great service as well as a quick fix for any cheese cravings that I happen to get through my week :-)
Great food, great service and great vibes always, a go-to for me and many others here at NTU, definitely recommend it!
Wonderful food and great customer service
Pasta tastes pretty good, great service by Samir. Highly recommend! :)

Quite overpriced for a school establishment. Quality does not justify the price.

Edit: All the 5-star reviews appearing all within a span of a few hours last week just after the few 1 star reviews seems abit sus. Suspect these be fake/employee accounts manipulating the review score - Polarising reviews of 5stars vs 1 stars abit of a give away. (I hope not, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt here). For the record I ate their chicken tikka and it wasn't great - I dont know what those people are talking about. Unless there was a significant improvement over such as short time. No hard feelings but I sincerely hope that the owners take a hard look at their business model and really consider the criticism of the lower reviews. You guys just opened, there is still time to improve things. It'll be a waste of such potential especially with a different dining concept. All the best!
Decent food at affordable rates. A neat place for vegetarians too.
very friendly owner and the food smells very goood! cant wait to try!!
Staff was very friendly and pasta was warm when served! New in campus!
Friendly staff! The food was good, will definitely come again :)

Quality of food and service can be improved. Needs more manpower.

Edit: Management should improve on customer service (polite to customers and not ignoring them) and the food served instead of engaging fake accounts to boost the score. This will increase the value of the experience and attract more customers to come back again.
Really really good pasta, even better service ❤️

Garlic bread is amazing, perfect.
Calamansi as well - go-to on a hot sweltering day! Their mains are great, love the variety of pastas to choose from.
Was forced to order via online where online menu was limited and price did not reflect GST until payment. Paid 8 bucks for 6 meatballs with no pasta.
Friendly staff! The food was good and it is a nice change from the food in NTU
chicken tikka pasta was great and must try.after I ordered we got the food in 3 minutes. my food was received  dry hot and yummy … must try this place as value for money
Nice food and servive here! great place to chill

Great concept with very unique proposition of food with price.
Lot of vegetarian options available which most of the other places are missing .
For sure let’s others know and visit again

texture was kind of hard. the food was oily and salty, but i like the cheese~ but the customer service was so bad, and in my opinion, the worst in ntu . the uncle mixed up my order and had the audacity to say that i was the one who agreed with him? he said “ i asked you mac and cheese u still say ya ya” !!?? i mentioned that i wanted baked VEGGIE mac & cheese twice? my friend said she heard me too. still, he didnt have the decency to change my order or refund me. i had to ask for it and not a single apology.. worse, the other guy still could not understand my order. my friend and i were so disappointed by the customer service :(( we tried to be nice but it felt like they were the ones who were mad at us?
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ super friendly stuff and amazing food! it’s a must try 😋
Very good place in side the NTU, the packed pasta was different from others and very nice. Best value for students and service also good and quick, must visit place
very friendly staff! and food is yummy
Great baked pasta and the concept is very unique. Will visit again and recommended for everyone to try.
Staff is very friendly & food is good!
Good food! And amazing service:)
great service and pasta is v tasty!
very friendly staff, and yummy food!
Food was pretty decent and the queue was pretty long. However, the food would have been better if it’s cooked longer.

Food delicious, and service is great. First time to try India food, and the man on the counter recommend some top rated food.Thanks for your help!
All is very nice except the one topped with chips. We really like these naans and mutton. But they are a bit pricey, among which there is one small bowl medium chicken meat, which is placed in a green bowl of diameter 6cm and that cost 6 dollars. We two adults and  one small child spent 28 dollars in total after the 10% off NTU staff discount.

Food is decent, albeit on the pricier side. Students and staff get 10% off the food.

I got the masala thosai, which was extremely flavourful and tasty. Dhal and chutney provided were rich and flavourful.

The staff was friendly as well, contrary to other reviews. Will consider patronising again if in the area!

High cost for a small portion. The dish on left is $15 butter chicken and on right is $7 Samosa Chat. Taken for a ride. Since not many options for Indian food at NTU this restaurant is extorting people.
The restaurant used to be good few years ago even though it was charging above average charge then the quality was good.
Now just pure extortion.

A very well maintained, clean and spacious restaurant within the University campus.

The service was good... and the dishes were very tasty.

The food took a little longer to arrive... perhaps this can be improved. But it was worth the wait.

Overly priced. Small piece of tandoori chicken cost SGD 6.00 &  too salty. . Ice Lemon Tea 3 dollars. If the drink comes bigger cup is acceptable but it's small size drinks.

Raita (onion salad) finish the moment we ordered mutton briyani so the restaurant gave me one vegetable. I appreciate it but they should ask me what vegetables I prefer to have, not give any dish they have there.

Ordered food and drinks at 12.33pm. Food arrived in 15 minutes time but the drinks arrived at 1.10pm but this also after we alert them.

Ordered prawn fried rice, oily and covered with many eggs. Egg smell too obvious in the fried rice.

Overall, it's not about paying high price for the food but we need fair portion and tasty food for the price we paying.
Such great food for someone who isnt a facility member of NTU. Dropped by for lunch and it was cheap and legit indian food.
Restaurant renovate with more variety of menu and good ambience . Much changes from last time . Good service and tasty food ..
I ordered a Kadai  chicken delivery , but I received something like chicken manchurian with bad taste .. useless restaurant to place your take away ..
Taste, hygiene and quality has improved significantly. Hope to dine-in more frequently here
We are regulars here because of the lack of Indian food on campus. The prices are exorbitant and service is poor. As the weeks progress it takes more time to get our food!
Very good indian restaurant  . Run by friendly  people. Certain items Might be just a little bit pricey but very good food and atmosphere.

Extremely poor service. It probably doesn't cost too much to smile at the customer. Maybe the food might even taste better if they start smiling. They push you to eat precooked curries lying under the heated cabinet. Ordered a  dosa, and the facial expression drops. What an effort that is going to be to fire up the pan and bake fresh dosa. I had visited this place 2 years back without eating, their reply for a dosa back then was "Why don't you want to eat precooked curries". It was a ludicrous question back then. Seems not much has changed in 2 years.
Service and food in the restaurant is good. But prices are expensive. Even after student and staff discount, its very expensive.

One of the best Indian restaurants in Singapore. I have never tasted such an authentic mutton curry and biryani in Singapore. I feel home. Their samosas are the best. I would suggest all the samosa lovers to give it a try. I have ordered food for few events at office and home from them. I had amazing comments from my colleagues and my guests. And it was under budget. Thank you guys. Wish you all the best.
This is April 2021. The food quality really improved so as the price range. May be due to new management. Now average price of lunch is 7$

Had lunch delivered over the weekend and 4 out of 5 items turned out to be below par. The plain naans were fine. The fried rice and the 3 side dishes, weren't, and this was not just a single person's opinion, but the consensus from a group of 6! Portion sizes weren't too big either and wouldn't be considered bang for your buck. (To make matters worse, I think the food might have given a few of us, including yours truly, an upset tummy).  2 stars for on-time delivery and decent naans.

Please do not eat here. Prices are ever varying and quantity varies from person to person. Food maybe decently tasting on certain occasions but in general the quality of food is average for the price.
If you want good north indian food please walk across to canteen 11 and eat at the Indian stall. If you are looking for South Indian options do not eat at NTU campus.

Opens till late so that is great for hungry peeps in hall. But not much variety (even tho the board shows so much food, not many available). When i was there around 9, there were only some veggie dishes and and meat and prata. The rest were not available.

This place is a fake. I bought fave coupon, wanted to redeem the naan coupon and they actually told me this coupon is not valid. On top of this, the food we ate was extremely expensive. 3 small piece of kitchen cost us 6 dollars.

Ananda Kitchen provides world class Indian Food @ The world class university NTU, the cooling restaurant located at Nanyang Technology University. NTU. Serving all kind of Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian food. Variety of foods enjoy by the different group of customers from every part of the world. It is an cool and silent locations to listen music’s and had a great meal always.

Tried this place out of curiosity, food was expensive, not particularly great. Order was forgotten and had to ask for it. Flies were present in an AC environment - hardly a great sign of food hygiene. Would avoid.

This place straight up scams people. Prices vary every time I visit and the people running this place gives different excuses for the change in price. The food is terrible and salty, especially their curry. Avoid this place at all cost.
Good Excellent fanatastic what else to describe their food.

Poor service. Pricey. Ok food.

Imagine waiting a long time queuing even though there's only two in the line only to get your order forgotten.

Ate here multilple times hoping the service would be different, yet each time it never fails to disappoint.
I wish i could give 0 star rating. Screwed up service to max. Either u will recive ur order late, wrong order, or never at all..... they can happliy cancel ur order 45 min later after accepting...
Decent food. Not great ambience and a lil pricey for the portion in school.
The prices are not stable here. Indian food is expensive here if compared to other Indian food outlets. Try Chicken Tikka Murtabak here.
Food is good for authentic Indian cuisine.
The cheapest and best place to have Indian food in Singapore if you are close to Pioneer or NTU.
Well managed restaurant. Price for the food is reasonable.
Very small portions
Nice food and reasonable price. Worth a little wait as Seller is OMO.
Cheap but average tasting food. Too much food color usage.
The delivery is usually very slow. You need to wait at least for 2 hours to get your food delivered.
Best North Indian and South Indian Food , very tasty food and good location Yummy C:
Good food. Especially the prata and thosai. Cleanliness can be improved

Very good food and
people
Patiently  answered  my queries and doubt
On my order .
Friendly staff and good food!
Amazing restaurant, great food and friendly staff.
Amazing tasty Indian chinese food and Indian foods.wonderful delicious restaurant
Amazing food and also amazing ambience
Very good!
