Closes by 8pm.
Gud Indian option inside NTU
Chicken and mutton dhum biriyani are very delicious. Daalcha is very tasty. It concur my taste buds on each time.
Limited dinning table is only available there.they take so many times for food deliver to dinning table to customers becoz of crowd.approximately 30 dinning seated there.thank u guys
Never  miss  roti  prata  extra  mutton  curry,  you  must  try  it.
Not So good food .. chicken and curry was  smelly.
Poori sucks

(Translated by Google) Drink first

(Original)
Minum dulu

Been around for years now, the go to for many looking for Indian cuisine.

⏰ they have a signage stating it will take 20-30 minutes during peak hours, and we gotten our food 10 minutes in at around 7pm on a weekend

Food was good, prata was fluffy the way I like, with a tinge of crispness at different bits - curry was generous too, spicy enough but not too overpowering or powdery.

Definitely use the $0.50 vouchers from shopee to enjoy better value off your meal! 👍🏻

The butter chicken briyani was fabulous. Love the side dishes too. Not too spicy at all and perfect for someone who is afraid of the spice! Service was a little messy and disorganised with people cutting queues and cashier being too busy with tasks other than taking orders.

Today having a very bad experience in this prata shop, one of the Chinese staff was shout at me from far. This was happened at timing 21:55.

What I was order come wrongly, but still shout at me. What kind of service attitude? Shop have CCTV recorded.

Ridiculous place. Waited 30 minutes for 2 prata to be told they have no prata. There are also alot of birds flying into this establishment. There is an alternative springleaf prata just across the street at safra.

In many of the patrons review shop was told to contact their whatsapp number. That's not necessary cos I'm not coming back again.

Horrible takeaway experience today.
Hear me out and I will explain.

I was there to order 2 plain and 1 egg prata at around 4.15pm. There were only one other male customer dining in at that time.

The female cashier kept on asking me whether I want crispy. I found it weird that she asked but nevertheless said yes. She asked a few more times to confirm and I said "of course I want crispy". I even said "if you have freshly made, why not?" And she never replied. By the way, tell me who doesn't want crispy prata, Right? And it also insinuate freshly made right?

But upon receiving the bill, I noticed I was charged 10 cent more for each prata. I quickly took a glance at the menu board above my head and realized I was charged the prata made of wholegrain.

At that moment, I knew I was cheated. Why did she not use the word 'wholegrain' in the communication? It was an outright lie to get people to buy the wholegrain prata when she said 'crispy'.

I confirmed with her whether she meant wholegrain when she said crispy and she admitted.

Even though it was only 30 cents more in total to get the 3 wholegrain pratas compared to getting the normal ones, but that wasn't what I initially wanted.

And because I'm rushing to fetch my daughter from school, I decided not to argue anymore.

It is so disappointing that the staff lied to sell the wholegrain prata which I assume might not be popular with the general public and probably trying to improve her own sales. It was plain dishonesty.

Please guys, this is a true story.. don't fall into the 'crispy' trap.

Excellent service. I am almost regular customer. Generally it's always crowded during late evenings and one day they missed to pack one of my items. Next day I told them with the receipt and they recalled that they forgot to pack and quickly arranged for packing the nxt day. They never compromise with quality and taste.

I ordered takeout from there. I actually went to the next shop meanwhile that order preparing and thought grab it after coming back few minutes later. When the ticket number crossed over, the Chinese woman over there yelled at me because she had repeatedly called the number but no one had come up to receive the packet.

If the given time has passed or the customer has still not picked up their food, you should keep that separately so that they can pick it up later.

Even if other customers are watching what is happening, do not shout in a public area.

Good place to eat a substantial meal. They have set meals as well as individual items. Vegetarians can also find some dishes / meals for themselves. Prices are quite reasonable and portions are large. They can improve upon their cleanliness. Single wash basin in a narrow enclosure needed scrubbing.
I went this place on holidays time.so many crowd there.i bought my dinner food.seating is not more.i think 30 peoples can sit and eat there.taste good.thank u

It was great.

Just make sure that you do not sit at the end of the restaurant as there is a basin and tray return area. At times some dinners might gargle and spit at the basin and sitting next to it might make you feel uncomfortable.

Nice songs were being played.

I enjoyed Samosa.

I want to share my experience with the dish Masala Dosa.

I did mention to the lady cashier  that I do not take onion and garlic. She said,she does not what I am saying so I requested for another staff to speak to me.

I was told by a male staff  that there are no onions and garlic in the potato vegetable which comes along with Masala Dosa so I ordered it but I did find a few peices of onions in the potatoes when I checked so I felt bad about not being provided with correct information.

Food is good otherwise.

They must not mislead the customers but provide them with right information.
It is so frustrating that i order pratawala through grab and came with a missing fried chicken. How am i supposed to eat?? Called the store to no avail. This will be the last

Something serious problem with Jurong point branch ….. Today I been there at 5.30 . Ordered 2 plates of samosa ( 2 pcs each plate ) take away  and 1 samosa to eat in with one masala dosai . Requested give one samosa among with dosai but received after 15 min . Even request twice .
Later I comes to know samosa packed 1 each instead 2 each . Dosai received without orange chutney so I requested at counter but no one attend later again I ask one man he don’t attend .
Poor customer service and lack of customer attention.very disappointed

Have always had an average experience with Prata Wala whether in terms of food or service but I was very disappointed that two Fridays ago, when I wanted to eat PRATA because I was craving for it, I went to PRATA Wala and was told that "No prata" and that there's only biryani. Did not get anything, not even a drink. Why should I stay when what I wanted to eat was not available?

When I was queuing to buy prata , the lady told me to wait and she took about 5 minutes to settle her stuff and when I told her I wanted prata she rudely said that she already told me that there is no prata as the cooks were on a break but clearly she did not tell me that. Furthermore , she spoke rudely and was very impatient. Horrible experience

I could understand order don't come in their order number sequence but mine was no.380, 3 plain pratas take-away. Then came after me of 8 orders: 4 cheese pratas and 4 cheese with eggs for 2 different set of people dine-in 383 and 384. Earlier 381 and 382 had also had collected their orders of other itemsqqa1q1.  When I confronted the manager, he argued that plain was make differently?! Isn't it with putting cheese and egg on the dough or plain dough right? What kind of logic? He could also argued that plain needs 3 min and ingredient take 5 min. So those who came in later, dine-in, paid more for their food can get to serve first then my order of 3 plain pratas and take away!? I was there the whole 33mins which based on his logic and well organised arrangement - bravo!! Conclusion, demand for your order when it is next in queue.

It would be really crowded at night and in the evening but you should be pretty fine if you are visiting in the morning or in the afternoon. However, the dining area is a bit small and cramped. A significant portion of the tables and chairs are placed near the toilet and washing area, so hygiene concerns may arise, especially at this point in time. The strategic position near the entrance of Boon Lay MRT Station while being situated in Jurong Point is very convenient. The food is generally good, though there isn’t a wide selection for vegetarians. I hope this commentary would be of use to you. Have a great day! 😀
The Food is quite good! The only thing I didn't like was the readymade prata..They should work on it! Otherwise, it was good.

ordered from grab. ask for fried chicken but got curry chicken. there’s a reason we choose fried because we want to eat THAT. next time if dont have , dont display and contact us.i thought i can escape the bad reviews but looks like i have to join in. pls improve or change staff thanks. and no i dont want to contact.
ownself check ownself
For late night meals - egg prata and teh C.   👍

Lousy service, waited so long for food but still wrong order. Ask her to refund the difference since the order we recieved is cheaper, but she still got the cheek to talk back. Both drinks and food wrong. HORRIBLE. If i could give 0 stars, i would do that.
Worst service ever. The sever in black is rude and should not be in service line. A simple request of asking a plastic seems a big deal for her. Slam my food on the glass counter.

Worst food ,I order nasi goreng  it's taste like spice rice no even necessary Vegas in the rice,  only  got lot of spices ,no tasty, cold food they charge 5.90$ never give cucumber also.Normal kopitiam  is more  better to eat nasi goreng  instead of this Prata Wala shop.

Their staff Christina was excellent. She recommend a new drink Halio O with milk.That was super nice. Her friendliness and good customer service is highly appreciated. You all should come and visid here

Visited this place for a late supper with a a couple of friends. They served pretty good prata and they made them fresh.

Curry was thick and tasty. The only drawback was the price. Very expensive in terms of prata.
Prata was good and so was its curry. The only problem is the pricing. Had it been a little cheaper, it would have been better
Ani was very nice and friendly towards me and my friends she made sure that we had a good time while eating

Decent prata. Both the fish and chicken curry are nice. Briyani is also good.
The queue can get quite long during peak hours. But overall, service is fast.

Standards are slowly but surely dropping. I don't mind paying a higher price for fresh, crispy prata but I hate it when they serve me pre-made ones. Made the decision to order Masala Thosai, it was good, with generous amount of potatoes sandwiched between crispy Thosai. Its weird that they served me with only Dahl curry instead of an assortment. Their teh tarik was tasteless on the day of my visit too. This my 3 stars.

Edit: contacted the hotline as requested by the business owner. Was updated that the branch ran out of the other condiments on the day of my visit. They offered me a free Thosai on my next visit which I turned down. Nevertheless, was heartened by the business owner's willingness to receive feedback. Kudos to them! Have upgraded my 3 stars to 4 stars because of this.
Prata and thosai were alright. Bru coffee was a tad sweet but that was my fault for asking 100% sweetness

Extremely slow service.  Who would want to wait for 45 mins to collect their order?  It’s not that they were  super busy. The ladies there, work like it’s there own home, slow motion.  No urgency, so disturbing to see people work like that in a shop.

my family is a regular customer here in prata wala jurong point. I would like to thank Ani for always giving us a warm welcome and an excellent service. I always see her tidy up the place and keep the place clean. five thumb’s up for her.

Terrible..
Never seen a restaurant that heats up already made Dosai and heat it up again with more oils and serve it to customer. We are paying high price and we are served like this.
Funny thing is the chef knows that I am seeing and he hiding and do it in a see through kitchen.

Please don't do this in foods and people's please be careful.

Very good service from Ani and very nice prata from Selvam. However, the female (chinese) cashier is the rudest person I’ve ever met in my life. She was screaming at the customers in front for no apparent reason and refused to take my order correctly. Will not be patronising again unless someone else is the cashier.
The prata is nice and cheap and good that it opens till late at night to satisfy my stomach at night. The staff Steven is also very nice to help me with my order.
Good food! At the middle of the night it is one of the most perfect supper place!

Prata wala is a convenient food joint located in Jurong Point especially as it’s opened during late hours. They make good variety of pratas and nans with really good chickpeas and butter chicken for gravy. Set meals are a good option for all-in orders. I’ve been eating here for 6+ years. The place is usually busy even at night so waiting might be necessary. Ice Limau and masala tea is also good, with Bru filter coffee as a new edition. It makes for a good eat-in option but most good options finish post 7pm.

The staff is really working hard w.r.t. serving customers and online orders but they still manage to be available and have good service. Yesterday, We weren’t happy about not getting potato since it was almost over but they freshly made n even tried to give more than what we ordered. Such an example of service is worth mentioning.
Had to wait almost 45mins for a prata, and it tasted average. Owner needs to reconsider the manpower deployment during supper hours. Not recommended.
The staff (fat lady) at Jurong Point Branch is so rude. I think she feels proud as she works at Prata Wala maybe. Please don’t let these type of people to serve customer. Very terrible experience lol
Food is good and the environment quite nice to enjoy your indian cuisine.
First time there to try their butter curry chicken. It was good. Will definitely go there again.

The prata made were tough to bite but the gravy was of top quality. There were few people to clear the empty dishes at the counter when we returned them. It was messy. The washing basin cubicle is too small and people with broader shoulder could not reach in to wash hands. There was a poor man inside the restaurant harassing people to offer free food or money. The counter staff were fully aware but chose not to see.

Samosas and pratas are really good here. Good hospitality and service from all the staff members.
Mrs. Christina helped us with takeaway with much ease

The place is at the Boon Lay Int. The food here is really tasty, good quality and hygienic.
The staff is very kind and help every hungry customer to choose food with advice. The cashier is a nice guy and I saw him directing and explaining people about the menu they have.
The place is bit small compared to the crowd that Boon Lay Int expects.
The chilli prata, dosa and samosa tastes good here.

Had the 7.9 butter byrani special. Four plus pieces of chicken in huge rice portion, salty crisp, pickles, and chutney. Tables a bit dirty but big crowd during early dinnner hour. Tasted pretty good but it is mall prices so a bit higher than in Indian town in the city.

The food is amazing, but the service is bad. The lady at the cashier, short hair very rude. She saw customer standing at the counter, never bother at all. And purposely act busy arranging glasses. Even after see also never approach. Imagine people want to buy food when they are hungry, this is how you guys treat?  We are not coming there for free food, to be treated like that.

Had good experience with PW in the past, albeit generally on the pricier side. Not sure what happened, perhaps the pandemic has called for measures, but $7.70 for this chicken thigh and... I don't know what? Scratched my head a few times trying to recall whether this dish should comprise more or whether the delivery guy ate something from it.

Will have to give them another chance sometime.
Female Staff likely the manger was energetic, food was freshly made. Great customer service.
Standard drop. Eat @ after lunch time 2pm no people but the egg prata didn’t taste great like last time. Curry is good.
Curry a bit watery, not that crispy n dough too thin. For small eater is good

Bought prata for takeaway. Reached home and was dismayed to see the amount of curry I was given (pictured). It was only a few table spoons worth.

I understand F&B is hit very badly by COVID but if this is how they choose to cut costs, I'm sorry but I will not be patronising again.

Ordered plain prata, masala thosai, butter chicken and mee goreng. Prata is crispy and doughy, and the curry (fish and chicken) are free flow. I personally prefer the fish curry. The butter chicken is different from what I had eaten from other places, this version is more of a dry and pasty chicken curry. The chicken is super soft and tender and the spices can be a little overpowering when eating the curry on its on, but it goes really well with prata. The masala thosai was ok, I was disappointed that one of the sauce are straight out from the fridge. The mee goreng is a miss for me.

The staffs were very friendly but they forgot to make our food item twice on a quiet morning. Hopefully this is something they will improve. Will definitely come back for the prata.
Friendly staff and prata was good. I ordered egg and egg+onion prata. It was ready within 10 minutes. I have attached the latest menu for your reference. Last order 9.30pm.

A new tenant at Safra Jurong. Prata portion is reasonable & cripsy. Unlike some other prata whereby thickness is very thin, I prefer Spingleaf prata thickness which is just nice. Dipping their prata into the thick & luscious(tomato tinch) complete the ultimate oomph to my eating pleasure.

Takeaway order during weekend morning peak hour(with grab & in store order)  is unexpected fast around 7 mins. Highly recommended for future prata visit :)

Updated review: Do show your Safra membership card upon payment for 10% discount off as Springleaf Prata Safra Jurong staff will not provide discount automatically.

Not a prata fan but came back 3x for onion egg prata....beautifully crisp on the outside, and well cooked on the inside. Accompanying fish curry is very good. Also tried their Curry Fish Head set which comes with a very fleshy tasty full fish head (not one-sided served by some). The set makes a very satisfactory meal. The bee hoon and nasi goreng were just ok. Service staff very patient and polite. SAFRA members get 10% off. Seating areas, indoor & outdoor, are quickly cleaned for next customer and well maintained. This new tenant is definitely a welcome change to the previous few tenants. Please keep it up, Springleaf!
Our favourite place for delicious crispy prata. The prata is made only when we order so it's always fresh and warm. This outlet has indoor and outdoor seating.

New spot for springleaf prata with Safra since May 2021, this location by the pool side... nearly. located outside / beside swimming pool entrance. Fast service with plenty of space both in air con or open environment. Prata and Briyani are easy choices, nice cozy environment at almost FC price.

Nice crispy prata - we ordered plain and egg prata. Definitely one of the better pratas I’ve eaten. Outlet has both indoor and outdoor seating. Didn’t ask us about our preference for curry though - we were served fish curry. Curry was ok, a tad watery for my liking. Overall, good deal via Shopee voucher.

Taste was ok only but pricing on the very high side. Ordered 2 prata with eggs, 2 normal prata and 1 chicken Mutaba (total: $27+).
Delivered only 2 pratas with and without eggs and forgotten to prepare the Mutaba.
Sorry to say and I'll not patronage again
Good quality prata like all their outlets.

Friendly staff and delicious prata.. the curry is perfect and the prata is crispy..

Keep it up.👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

The teh tarik kosong is smooth too

Very good Mutton Briyani.. the curry is thick and spicy.. the Mutton is very solid 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Very quiet, no crowd. Good place to have a simple breakfast and chit chat with friends.
Crispy egg prata. The kopi is not strong but just nice for me who cant take too strong coffee. Price of egg prata at $2.40 is abit expensive though.

Bad service , inflexible . Pay full price first for my items, then later after saw someone else get discount by showing Safra card, ask for my discount they say I have already made payment and cannot be given discount. I offer to order extra prata to be served the discount for earlier bill , but flatly rejected.
Been a long time customer. Need to improve the mee goreng. Standards have dropped drastically. Giving 4 stars because I hope there will improvements
I only ordered teh tarik and it was very bad. Everything went wrong… it tasted like it was done with Lipton tea bag with some milk. No tarik was done. Very disappointed.

waited 15mins for my order. asked staff A about it and he replied ok. another 15mins passed i asked staff B and he said ok too. after another 15mins i went to ask staff C and when he checked, the order was not even taken?!?! no communication between staff
solid cheese and onion prata, and really nice butter chicken.
Quality prata, loved their egg prata. Other items are nice as well. Family friendly seating environment at Safra Jurong.

Decided to come over for dinner on the 13th November 2021.

This outlet has a house rule that doesn’t allow more than 2 person to a table, which wasn’t clearly communicated (only an a4 advisory inside the eating area itself).

It wasn’t communicated to us while we were placing our order and only after paying for our food. Me, my wife and my baby in hand were at the counter ordering our food and I felt they had every opportunity to tell us then, not only after we have paid for our food and taken out seat.

I can respect that a restaurant can have their own house rule. I am extremely upset that it wasn’t communicated clearly. We ordered something that was clearly for sharing and we have been greatly inconvenienced.

We would have gone to eat somewhere else if it was communicated to us clearly.
Restaurant just at the entrance of the swimming pool. Lots of variety to choose from. Especially if hungry after swimming or using the gym above.
The food are delosh, but the service really slow! Idk maybe they shotage of staff? I ordered 1 plaster took more than 30 min, and people who are come after me get the food 1st!!!

Was delighted when they open another outlet in Jurong and partnered with Grab. Prata texture and taste was still good as compared to the original store (thongsoon) however no curry was provided and not the first time; it's like eating salad without any sauce. Anyway, had diarrhoea after consuming the kambing soup. Think twice before you visit this outlet.

Was craving for coin prata, but it turned out to be just mini kosong prata. Not buttery, not fluffy, not sweet... it's just smaller kosong prata, but higher price. Other than that, the rest of the normal kosong prata still acceptably crispy.
Chaos in the ordering sequence. Dine-in expect to wait 40mins when all orders went to Grab and FoodPanda

Yes. prata was soft like flower and the fish curry is the icing. no other curries allowed!!! or not worth it.  parking was available at 11.20am with normal car park charges.

just go for the prata
Nice prata but price is slightly on the higher side
Food is good, place is spacious but carpark is expensive if you just go there for dining. Parked there for 30mins and I paid $4..
Ordered murtaburger via grabfood. What i receieve was what i assume is nasi brani, come on how do you screw up something like this.

Ordered 3 pieces of Prata and had to wait almost 30mins. The queue is not long. Place not crowded. Workers too slow.
Avoid the place.
Like the fish curry gravy. It's taste great with the roti prata.
The food arrives late every blady  time !! I have to wait 15-20 mins for 1 meal & now it's taking longer than 30 mins!!! This is ridiculous!!!
Delicious prata. Like the fish curry
it is family feast for us. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT. MUST TRY PLACE. very nice. everything was delicious and the delivery was fast. SAMBAL FISH MUST TRY.
Worst kopi tarik in sg. Super sweet and diluted. No coffee taste just like drinking super sweet diluted milk yucks
Food is very nice and it's must to eat ultimate hawkerfest. Their customer service is excellent 👌
Love their plain prata and teh tarik. There is indoor aircon seating area and outdoor seating area
5 star for food, minus 1 star for the enclosed area noise from chit chatting.
Good crispy pratas as usual. New set up.
Food not bad a bit expensive but worth to try it.
Please make it 24 hours like the branch at NeWest!!!
Nice prata.. less traffic
Good food!
Best prata ever tasted
5 star for the prata
Murtabakburger is nice!
Delicious
Cheap and tasty!
Taste good

(Translated by Google) Super crispy coin prata and the Gao pull! ⁇

(Original)
Super crispy coin prata and teh tarik Gao! 😋😋
Good prata

Really good Indian restaurant, we frequently go there when we visit the science center.
Staff is friend and food really tasty.
The only 2 areas I would suggest to improve would be:
- to add some sound absorbing panel, restaurant is really noisy during peak hours
- improve kids menus with vegetables, as it only propose fried food as main dishes

A strange place for a good eatery to be for sure! 🤔 Nestled in Science Centre, next to Kids Stop. 😂 The naan was legit possibly the best I’ve tried! Soft, fluffy, crispy on the edges. 🥰 Tried fish tikka, chicken tikka, butter chicken and palak paneer and all were fantastic as well! Prices came up to $88 for our table of 5+2 which was very reasonable!

Now newly located to science centre and still out most favorite restaurant in neighborhood. The fish briyani is excellent and different from other restaurants. They have fish manchurian cubes instead of tawa fried vanjiram in briyani. They dont use food coloring which i personally like a lot. We visited on a friday night for dinner and there was queue to be seated. Service was good and fast. The place is bigger than their earlier location (opp. to phoenix LRT). Mutton gosht curry was tasty. Pappad with mint chutney will be served for free.

Great indian food. Jeera rice is so fragrant, it’s hard to eat just plain rice any more. All the dishes we ordered were fantastic.

The biggest problem was actually the beverage… the ice tea was sad. 🥲
Great food! Price is affordable too. Highly recommend the tandoori chicken - really tender and flavourful.

Had first visited Phoenix at the original location on a few occasions in Bukit Panjang near Phoenix LRT (hence the name?). The homely atmosphere coupled with the personal service from the owners made it a regular 'go to' restaurant. And of course the food, which is why we keep coming back.

Was happy that they moved to a location inside Science Centre, easier accessibility and quicker drive from home! They've got a bigger space now in a more cordial setting, as opposed to the 'industrial feel' location they were in earlier.

The food doesn't disappoint and spice levels were just about nice on the curries we ordered. Not too overpowering and extremely pleasant on the taste buds. Doesn't give you that heavy masala-ish feeling that makes you feel bloated and heavy. So it was very light on the spices which can pull you through a post-lunch meeting without nodding off!

Service was a tad disappointing, probably new staff that needed a bit of training? The lady owner was around and of course very friendly and hospitable as before. But service in general needed some improvement.

The new ambience is nice and a welcome change from the smaller space they had earlier. They also have an extended dining space to cater for a larger crowd, especially on weekends.

Must try item - Bhuna Gosht!

Just the typical Indian restaurant, hot 🥵 and spicy 🌶
There are two restaurants here, Italian and Indian in Singapore Science Centre.
If you are not used to or fond of eating spicy food or queuing up for food…better come to science centre with full stomach 😊 to enjoy the exhibits.

Really nice family run restaurant, friendly place.

Quiet and unusual spot, located inside Omni theater, to the left of the entrance.

Food was rich and savory, delightfully crispy (yet soft) naan. Aloo Gobi was the dry version. Butter Chicken was amazing.

Must patronise!

Ate at this restaurant for the first time today and we were impressed by its taste and service! Loved the garlic naan which was a little crispy on the outside and sag mutton which was so tender. Lady boss was also nice to help us inform the kitchen to remove the spice in the mutton dish and came over to check that it was done so when we were eating. Will definitely be back!

Service has improved. Cleanliness too. Now at Kids stop near Science Center. Prices have increased a bit. But still not bad at all.

The food is very good. A great authentic  "India" Indian restaurant in Singapore. Generally this is how food is in India compared to what we get in Prata places and local restaurants in Singapore.

Phoenix Indian Restaurant relocated from Choa Chu Kang to Jurong East - Omni Theatre / Kids Zone to be specific. Sparkling clean new restaurant, friendly service and superb food! My friends and I have become regulars of this restaurant and we highly recommend trying ALL flavours of their Naan! Other than Naan, Butter Chicken is a MUST order!  Love their Tandoori Chicken and Gobi 65 (Fried Cauliflower) too! Not a fan of their Lollipop Chicken, though it's a good dish by itself but we felt that it just didn't go well with the rest of the traditional dishes we were having. Their Masala tea is very good too! Will continue to support this restaurant!

Queued about 30mins to get in, thankfully we got seats! Highly recommended to queue a lot more 2hours earlier before closing if you don’t want to stand in a long queue and ended up ordering take out cause last order is at 9.30pm. We ordered garlic naan, Gobi 65, chicken tandoori, buttermilk chicken and other dishes. They all were delicious and freshly made, the naan was so soft and fluffy, chicken tandoori isn’t tough or dry. Everything and services was great! Definitely worth the wait!

It was located near Phoenix LRT, moved two months ago to Science center (rose from the ashes). Have eaten in or ordered out several times from the previous location and visited the new place, food and quality of service is still good.

Its our first time at yr resturant. Thk u for the friendly service. The curries are not too spicy n came piping hot which we love. Thumbup for free flow papadam. It will be perfect if the condition could keep us cool during mealtime. We are perspiring😅.

We will definitely be back for more catchup meals wuth friends n family.

Keep up your good food n thk u so much🥳🥳🥳

Authentic Indian food. Very attentive owner who recommended us a dish. But was a little insistent on us not taking a spicy one. I don't know if it is good or bad 🤣.
Their food is Amazing, flavours of spice is abundance. Cheese nan might be better to use shredded cheese instead of slice cheese. Makes not so evenly spreaded.

Overall: still an amazing place for Indian food.

North Indian Cuisine at its finest

This is truly a hidden gem and we were surprised to find it on our way to The Science Centre. We decided to have both Lunch and dinner at Phoenix as the Food & Service is really remarkable!

For lunch the Vegetarian Biryani and Chicken Biryanis were superb!
For dinner we had 4 types of Naan Bread, Chana Masala, Palak Paneer and Fish Masala. The food is amazing!

I am really fascinated by their speed in service and above all the food is simply affordable. Do look out for Mr. Jovan Tan, the fine gentleman who took good care of us when we dined at Phoenix.

Our empty plates, speak for itself. Special compliments to the Chef's!

This place has been a favourite always. We went for dinner and grabbed something light (Chapathi and Ghobi chilli) with a nice hot cup of chai!

Must try if you are near Jurong East. The staff are hospitable and friendly.

Decent choice for Indian food in the west part of Singapore
Courteous staff..
Good ambience..
Must try chicken lollipop, pepper chicken, malai kebab, masala kulcha
Nice Indian food, but service was normal Indian style. Not much people there and price also reasonable compare to other India restaurants.

Food items are very reasonably priced, garlic naan was crazily good. Butter chicken, mixed vegetables and the complimentary papadum were all done perfectly.

Will have preferred butter chicken to be in bigger chunks to add to the bite though 😊 Kulfi was too sweet for my liking, Nuts added were generous! I will definitely be back!
Marvelous north Indian food. Highly recommended!

This is a hidden gem. U will end up becoming a regular once u gon there.
Its a family run outlet. Very well managed. Good food and even better service.
No wonder they only open for dinner and remain occupied.
We usually reach by 7.30 pm because by 8 they start to have a queue.
The last orders are at 9.30.
Many dishes were quite well-executed and prices are ok. The wait is a little long though.

The indian restaurant is hidden in the shop houses on the Phoenix hill opposite the Phoenix station. Carpark is available at a fee right in front of the restaurant. However, parking along the landed houses is also quite easy.

The place is neat and clean, and the staff is rather friendly and attending. We were recommended dishes based on our preference, and the food tastes really great as well. Naan is slightly over done with quite some burns, but overall quality of the meal is good. They also serve wine here if you are seeking some romance over dinner. It is well decorated for nice ambience.

Tandoori dishes are perfect, and would definitely try again in next visits. They also do delivery and work with deliverloo.

North Indian food is quite expesnive here in Singapore but this restaurant serves you good food at fairly reasonable prices. It lives up to my expextations. The butter naan is the softest and probably the best that you can find in Songapore. Reastaurant staff is really nice, they serves you a range of mouth watering vegetables and kulfis.

Gem in the west. Tucked inside kidstop and near science centre. One of the best Indian restaurants we ate at, value for money and good portions. They definitely deserve more ❤️. Make sure to ask for their recommendations if you can't take spicy food!
Amazing food.. staff shown great attitude towards customers.. when we entered the restaurant we had few doubts. First sip of soup chaged our perceptive.. must visit place.. nice service by staff..

Was at science centre observatory last week and couldnt forget the bryani smell that filled up the science centre compound. So i decided to pop by today. It is secluded, as u enter from the kids stop entrance even when the kids stop is closed.  Food is served hot. Ordered prawn masala, butter chicken, naan, bryani rice, tandoori yoghurt chicken. The food is refined and of good standard. One of the best Indian food with very reasonable price. The yoghurt tandoori chicken is exceptional, juicy and the full of the grill fragrance. The butter chicken is more of the tomato type and my children love it. They downed much rice with the butter chicken sauce. Very good service, as they refilled the papadum. It is definitely my to-go indian restaurant now.

Perfect services and very kind indian aunty who served me. Good food and naan, especially the "papad" for all customers and i asked her bout it. When i take away my leftovers she even packed me some extra papad omgg. This made my day, and it's on my bad day. So, extra good. Haha.

Location is good!
Ambience is good!!
Menu is good!!!
Food is good!!!!
This is a nice place to experience the Indian cuisine, taste is good but there is a lot of room to improvement!!!!!
Good comfort food for an affordable price. This is definitely a hidden gem for me, my go to place for Indian Cuisine.
Nan basket with chicken gravy superb. Tandoori chicken was juicy and spicy.

Great food at decent prices.

Service was also great, the waitress told us that the quantity we wanted to order was too much for 2 people which was very appreciated

Not the easiest place to get to, but it’s nice and quiet. Hope it stays around for a long time!

Unplanned visit but pleasantly surprised. Clean large place with nothing messing around walls. Super friendly and quick service. Prices are cheaper than Little India and good was good, tandoori chicken, fish curry, Butter Paneer. Tandoori roti and chapati were very thin and well made. Overall a great experience.
Pocket friendly, tasty Indian food is the speciality here. Will visit often hereafter...

Wonderful restaurant. We had vegetarian food here and the taste is awesome!!!. Interesting point here is the service which is very good, humble and pleasant. Wonderful taste with wonderful service which is a rare combination,🙂😄🙂

really love their fried cauliflower!! very delicious.

their paneer dishes are nice too.
have to eat their starter papadum w their green sauce it's very appetizing
Super tasty, highly recommend Chicken Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan
Didn’t really know what to order. May have ordered the wrong dishes. Service was great though.
Brilliant food and service, comfortable seating. Enjoyed the Mutton briyani, Naan, Palak Paneer.

Me and my friends ordered the bucket naan (which comes in 4 flavours), the butter chicken, the fried cauliflower as well as the curry fish head. The food that we ordered were solid and delicious. Even the fish is fresh and really goes well with the curry and the other vegetables. The curry sauce was really rich but yet not so gelat. Would highly recommend anybody who love indian food to come to this restaurant cause it's really worth the money :)
Good value for money with good portion of food. Taste great. Looks like a family run restaurant with friendly staff.
Amazing North Indian cuisine at an affordable price, staff are very friendly towards customers. 5/5 would recommend!

Authentic Indian food. I get stomach burn after eating curries from some restaurants. Tried a few dishes from here, no issue at all. Requested for extra spicy, they prepared it according to instructions every time. Indian food in Singapore is way too expensive. This place is a rare as the food is good and it is reasonably priced. I will definitely order again.

good food, but when order thru online food apps, rejects the order after confirmation at the door step for self collection.
Poor customer service

Visited the Phoenix Indian Restaurant during Kids Stop visit. Tried only Vegetarian food. All items were tasty and delicious. Were served well on time.  The restaurant service is very good. Staff are extremely courteous. Haven't seen a better North Indian Restaurant (tasty and economical at the same time) in this part of the city. Would surely visit again. Highly recommended for good North Indian food!

Really good food - have eaten multiple times and always appreciate the taste and quality.

Its understandable that the place gets quit crowded and the waiting time could get higher , however , being rude is definitely not appreciated. One of the ladies at the counter was quite arrogant towards us as we waited to get a take out for easily 60 mins over a 30 min wait time. At around 50 mins mark, whilst we enquired about the status - she was kind enough to rudely tell us - "want or not want - can cancel if not". Hey - we get it the food is great and stuff - however this is not the way to treat customers - at the end of the day - we are just asking and checking on the time after waiting at the restaurant for nearly an hour and probably we will wait more too - however , talking politely goes a long way in retaining customers.
Overall quality of food is good though the fried stuff can be a bit too oily. Friendly service staff. Relaxed environment and an overall satisfying dining experience.
Consistently good food. Value for money. Pleasant service.
The food was great! Must try the Naan bread.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Gem at west area. Only disappointing dish is that the spinach is watery and diluted. Service is not very good because they make u wait. Ordered masala tea and recheck with one of the staff but seem to ignore us. However the masala tea is very good!! Mutton murtabak has alot filling too

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Very affordable indian food in a restaurant style setting. Depending on your indian food craving, do take note that they have different menu options for breakfast, before 5pm and after 5pm.

I went during lunch and really like their sets which comes with quite a few sides. The gobi manchurian is much tastier than the chickan manchurian (price point is the same fyi!). Their naan is on the thinner side so order more if you are going for that. Stuffed paratha came really piping hot and the teh tarik was good!

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Simple place, food tasted better than expected. Staff who took my order was perplexed by my order, another staff suggested naan to go with the gravy I ordered. I'm on a low carb diet so no rice/bread. Appreciated the staff service and friendly boss. Craving for Indian food settled!

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Mutton Briyani with a side of butter chicken. Indian food craving satisfied 😁😁. The meat was soft and tender. Curries were just right for me and not too spicy.  Prices are average and comparable with other Indian restaurants.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
I love Indian food and used to be a big fan of Anjana, I recommend to some of my friends and the love it too, the service and food was great on my last visit back in 2021.

I pay my visit again in 2022, and feel like I'm in a totally different restaurant. Service was bad, especially one of the young staff that no wearing the uniform.

I ordered butter chicken naan set, and see this is what I get, the portion much smaller than what I had previously, and they served white rice instead of nasi biryani because they run out of biryani. You can inform your customer up front so that we can choose another option, but no, they service you with white rice and when you question them, they answer impatiently.

Won't come back again with this kind of service.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Food is authentic Indian food. Had dum biryani, butter paneer, egg dosai and tissue prata. Price is reasonable.  Prefer this 10x over places like Springleaf prata place.

Update:
Inflation is bad. The serving size is quite small. Lucky to have 5 small cubes of meat in their mutton.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Had to edit this review as I was charged $3 just for a small bowl of plain rice. When I questioned, the cashier pretended that the rice came with some vegetables. This could have written off as just a misunderstanding but I was dining right in front of the cashier, two meters away! Dishonesty is not a good way to attract customers.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Food was amazing. Of all the Indian Foods that I have tasted so far, this one stand out to me as "best in class". Sheer quality of the food is impeccable and beyond comparison. I strongly recommend and will continue to recommend to my family and friends. If you have not tasted yet, try it and you won't regret. Thanks and its simply the best.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Its not bad.. the curries are deep in flavour and tandoori chicken is tender though meat is a little dry. Naan is soft and absorbs all the curry dip nicely

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Food is absolutely delicious, 10/10. 👍

Do try their Briyani sets or Vegetarian Thali set, with Masala Spiced Tea 😋

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Today i go buy mutton briyani ..the mutton only have alot bone only ..the service very bad

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Always not the same taste
But comparing with other restaurants ok
But serving staff is irresponsible

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Love the Indian food here, nice and value for money.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
The menu has a lot of variety. The waiter was patient to recommend less spicy options for me and spicy ones for my family member.

We ordered butter chicken naan set and mutton naan set. Both were delicious! The Masala tea was very good!!  Prices were reasonable too.

The owner was friendly and we look forward to our meals at her restaurant again.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Good quality food. Reasonable price. Both veg and non-veg options. Indian snacks available. Nice ambience to sit out. They don't chase you even if you spend quite a long time.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Been to Anjana a few times over the past couple of years but taking the opportunity to write a review after my most recent visit.

As mentioned in other reviews, I have to admit that the food quality has taken a slight dip from the time they were in the smaller space, to the time they've expanded. Seating, space and ambience is decent with outdoor seating being a plus. Service is quite alright, definitely nothing to complain about.

This time we had chicken dum biriyani and I had to admit that it was a disappointment. The naan set with mutton roganjosh was much better. One suggestion would be to possibly cut down 1 side dish in the set. But pretty much all the items in the set were tasty, and that goes for the naan too. Chicken murtabak was quite huge, a bit oily, but overall quite nice. Mango lassi a tad too thick that it was an effort to drink it using the straw :)

An 'alright' experience at Anjana, though the food is no doubt good, I believe it lacks consistency - unlike the last time. So an improvement in that department would do wonders.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Was doubting the name of “best Indian food” and came here to try. But it surprised me with its flavors. Ordered a set of North Indian Thalli and one special Thalli. It came with 5+ different curries with bread and rice. From savory to sweet curry are all really amazing. Def worth a try!

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Food is tasty and the ambience is good too , but need to improve in service side

During one of my visit I experienced these

The waiter didn't took my Order Properly, and the other staffs are also not so professional in taking orders and serving them

One of our dish got delayed so much and at last we cancelled that order and left

Need to improve in their Service side

Food is worthy , some mouth watering dishes are available , Got many Vegetarian options.

May be this day isn't the best day for me and the Restaurant

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Awesome food, my personal favourite was the butter chicken masala. Sometimes it gets crowded at morning and evenings because of it's popularity.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Our second time here, this time round we only had some snacks and drink.

Overall food both times are yummy and prices are ok too. Though I would love the Ginger Tea (Teh Haliah) to have more kick 🤪 it is a bit on the lower taste.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Good food and nice ambience. Sipping a hot cup of masala tea watching the rain splatter away while a cool breeze sweeps over was blissful. It does help being located in a uncrowded and quite place, and it elevates experience.
The butter chicken and naan was great too.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: This is one of the must try in vision exchange serving authentic Indian food. Tried the butter chicken naan which is alot for a normal lunch. For light eaters, I will recommend it for sharing. Complete the meal with Masala Tea or Teh Tarik. The cost of a set like this is about $12.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
O.m.g. very good.

The Gobi Manchurian was rich and flavorful.
The Fish Tikka was tender and juicy.
The butter chicken set was nice and well-balanced too.
Masala tea could be better though.

Sorry didn't take any photos.. We cleared everything on the unassuming plates before I thought of that. Lol

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Very good indian food. Not too salty n reasonable price. My fav masala dosa, naan n briyani

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Decent Indian food. Mainly south Indian menu. Price is also affordable.

Must try: chicken lollipop

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Nice food... reasonable price... good customer service.. recommend mutton chukka....

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Me & my friends visit this place at least one to two times a week. The restaurant serve very delicious north Indian food with freshly prepared chapati.  The meal contains various vegetables & non-vegetarian variety.

For spacial occasions, I love the naan & various bread varieties with butter chicken.

Deserts are also available for people who like to end their meal with sweets.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
With so many Indian restaurants around the place, Anjana’s stands out with their service and taste. They take order from each one of us and treat us like family which is a rare quality now. And, both south Indian and North Indian dishes taste delicious thanks to the authentic chefs. One Mr.Ranjan does amazing North Indian food. Just ask him what he wants and he whips his magic around and creates world class food.

P.S. Their complete vegetarian meal is packed with so many items and is priced at only $6.5

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Tried their children drum briyani and butter chicken naan set. Spices were plentiful and dishes were flavorful. No service charge and GST. Teh C ice was only $1.50, same price as coffeeshop. Coffeeshop prices found in a restaurant. Definitely value for money and I'll come back again.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Value for money. Excellent location and very spacious.  Both north and south indian food and drinks available. Friendly staff. Prices are very good. Portions are good for rice meals. Quality of meat in Mutton Biryani was good. Overall it is a pleasant experience considering that it is not a fine dining place.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
It breaks my heart to give this review. This was my favourite Indian restaurant in the west! We were so thrilled at how complete the flavours were and how authentic it was a year back. There was no question- every time we felt like having South Indian meals, it was always Anjana’s. Now they are very inconsistent. Disappointed thrice already (I know; I keep going back searching for the old flavours which brought back childhood memories). Most recent bad experience was for Tamil puthandu (new year) with curries that were still raw, veges haphazardly cooked without any flavour . I don’t think they are coping with the increasing volume of orders. They need to increase capacity, staff and not compromise on taste -this is their strength after all! We want the old Anjana back :(
From,
A die-hard fan of old Anjana

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: I have been regular cutomer for past 3 years almost everyday. Very hygienic and best service for every single customer. Highly recommended. Best family restaurant in Jurong East.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: One of the best Indian restaurants I enjoy visiting. The masala tea is a must-try, best one I've tried in SG :) I've not tasted anything disappointing there so far. Love the naan, love the rice, love all their gravies and their chapatti. They expanded since I last visited and feature a cosy ambience with solid wooden tables and cushion chairs too. Mmmmm! 😍

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: Food is good ,but service can be bad. I think they're understaffed. So need to wait long till someone come and take order or sometimes doesn't come at all 😅. Must try their masala tea. It's superb. The chapati also not so bad. Quite soft.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: If you are looking for cheap and best food option then go for Anjana Kitchen walkable from Jurong East MRT. I had Tandoori Naan Set, it was tasty & cheaper.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: I and my friends(4pax) went there to have dinner. We ordered Kothu Parata and Tea Halia. Kothu was not hot enough. Mutton Rogan Gosh was not enough portion for the price. They gave 3 Tea Halia and the waiter forgot one tea halia. Later he brought another which tasted like hot water. We didn’t feel good service here..

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content:
Your briyani is taste good but too much oil. Half of the briyani and prawn masala I throw because of high oil . Please it’s a health matter please correct it immediately.
This is not happening one time …. More than 2 time . Currently I am not prepare to purchase any briyani from you. Hope you change this as soon as

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: The service was really pleasant.Food was delicious and fresh. Chappathi, Naan , and the best is channa..!!  Good place .. nearby Jurong East MRT and in close to International business park ..  they can cater for all events .. the meal experience you won't soon forget.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore

excellent, one of the best Indian food on island.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore
content: This is a hidden gem! Amazing food. Good service. Great food and the owner is an amazing lady. The prices are so reasonable. They also serve beer and wine. They serve North Indian, South Indian and Indian Chinese. Overall a great find. They have survived the pandemic and even expanded to an adjacent unit. Speaks volumes of their resilience and determination.

restaurant name: Anjana Kitchen - Best Indian Restaurant Singapore

My mum had been there previously and the food was good. But had a horrible experience today. There were small cockroaches running around the place. Spotted at least 3 of them. To make matters worse, one of their staff (Imran) was extremely rude. His exact words were “cockroaches are everywhere” implying that it’s normal to have cockroaches in a F&B establishment and continued to argue that the place is clean. He did not take any accountability whatsoever and had the cheek to argue that it’s not a big deal to have cockroaches running around in a restaurant. The manager then spoke to me to address the issue. He was very nice and polite but it doesn’t make a difference that the restaurant is infested with small cockroaches. I will not be returning to this place ever again.

The ribeye was overdone. Salmon steak was also a miss (these mains comes with somd salad only, in case you were hoping there were fries as well)

Customer service though was a plus as there is this guy who would give out papadum to customers waiting for their orders.

I waited close to an hour for my order too. There was no proactive updates from the waiting staff as to the progress for my order (i waited in F&B before and this was something I did to my customers who had to experience long waiting times, and no one had to train me to do that, IMO its just common sense)

restaurant name: Signature Restaurant & Bar - Best Briyani and Grill chicken
content:
I have been visiting this place for a long time and regularly as I work in Vision Exchange building. But sadly The quality of food is going down day by day.

Today I ordered mutton biryani - it came with a large piece of mutton but extremely tough. Couldn't chew it. So had to throw away mutton.

Basically I just got then 1 egg and biryani rice for the price of mutton biryani.

restaurant name: Signature Restaurant & Bar - Best Briyani and Grill chicken
content:
Third class place. Few days back I went here, and order Chicken 65. However it turned out to be rotten meat ( Kind of marinated for 5-6 days).
So I complained, on google.

Then the chef Velu contacted me and offered refund and requested to withdraw the review. I said ok.

Adter 2/3 days I went there again, he told me he can not serve me as his management has decided not to provide services as I complained 3/4 times.

So they are not interested in correcting the problem , but just want to bar people who complaint.

Done ever go here. All rotten food. I am now proceeding to complain to Food authority. Once the do inspection it will be clear.

If you need Indian food, there are other options on same building and fortunately they don't serve rotten food.

Place to go for Awesome Dosa varieties, Vada, Bajjis and Sweets. Furthermore you get a service with smile and a homely feel. Do try out their Dosa Varieties and if you intend to try their Idlies do plan to reach their outlet by 19:00 PM as it gets finished very fast.

Like the rice coral of the pearl sea blooms with the petal of silky smooth sweet Unagi tango with the pistil spicy tangy pickled radish.
A taste that bless the soul.😋

Ebiko Eel Roll($9.30)(8 pcs)😄
Traffic Light(Crabmeat, Tamago, Cucumber) sushi holding an umbrella of sliced Unagi while withstanding the heavy downpour of Mentaiko rain and hail of ebiko. What a storm of umaminess it cause to Traffic Light sushi-san.⛈️☔😋
The sushi is just above acceptable. It's not fresh since it's meant to be merely fast food. If you're looking for sushi near NTU, I recommend going to Jurong Point for Genki or Sushi-Go.

Below average food at expensive prices. The only good thing is shorter queue and higher chance of getting a seat. Male cashier is rude and customer service can be greatly improved. We pay to enjoy our food and not to be treated badly and be stared at.

On 23rd April, 2021 11.50 am, just suffered a very very rude service from the cashier. idk the name of him
He told me to got out of here and did not have meal here, just because he did not see my checkin????? Actually I had shown him several times.
Very mean and rude!
Horrendous service

The $89 Omakase set is a little bit on the expensive side but it also comes with a bottle of sake. The chef’s selection is not bad and mostly fresh! Uni is not as sweet as expected but the salmon is fantastic as the cut has a good mix of fats in it making the sashimi melt-in-your-mouth 👍🏿
The oyster and scallops are also plump and sumptuous.

Chef Cash was extraordinary with this exquisite meal. Value for money Omakase in the west definitely! The meal set also comes with Sake.

Our love is the four gras, otoro and their unique seafood tofu with generous portion of ikura. Completely fulfilling meal and money well spent. Extremely wallet friendly Japanese food within TungLok.

===== 2022 Jan =====
came back for the omakase (12-course).

no fancy plating, not dish by dish, but it was compensated with good portion of food items (eg. chutoro and uni.)

overall, not bad for the price.

===== 2021 Sep =====
searched Google Map for a place near Jurong Point for lunch, and found this new restaurant.

it’s actually inside TungLok Seafood restaurant and sharing the large eating hall.  can actually order from both restaurants.

the food was great, way better than i was expecting!😋👍

i like the most were:
a. thick and fresh Sake Sashimi.
b. crunchy outside and soft inside Truffle Tempura Prawn.

The BOGO (buy one get one) free deal which is applicable to take- away is definitely worth it!  The wagyu may not be the best as they don't entertain the doneness of the meat (meat is well done) and the foie gras is probably from duck (and not goose) , it is huge, but the price is certainly right! The sashimi is definitely top grade and really fresh! The kurobuta pork is delicious and there is 1 abalone in it !

5/12/2021 - returned for their Omakase Teishoku. Teishoku means the meal is served all at one go. It was good and included sake which we could take home instead of drinking there, but they gave us only 1 bottle although there were 3 of us.

Small place within Tunglok Seafood restaurant. Best to do booking.
Yummy food.

Douraku Kaiseidon Set($38++)
Uni, Hokkaido Scallop, Botan Ebi, Maguro, Salmon and Ikura over a bed of sushi rice on that day. Sashimi were fresh and thick cut.
Served with chawanmushi, miso soup, refreshing salad of the day & dessert of the day.

Legendary Wagyu Don Set($36++)
Not legendary at all. The aburi wagyu tataki beef taste was great with chef's special teriyaki sauce but texture was well-done. What an instant disappointment. Foie Gras was sinful and fatty. Served with koshihikari rice, deep-fried garlic chips, sous vide egg, nori, pickles and radish.
Set comes with salmon sashimi, miso soup, salad of the day & dessert of the day.

Eihire($15)
Dried stingray. Texture was chewy with a taste of savoury and oceanic sweet note.

First time trying out douraku sushi by Tung lok, their Donburi was awesome! The quality of the food way surpass the price of it. Look at my photo below and you will understand why.

<bora chirashi don> we are usually quite selective when comes to sashimi as we are concerned about the freshness. To our surprise not only the look is appealing, the cut was pretty fresh too! Yumz

<Unagi don> pleasant to find that it comes with an onsen egg and jelly fish salad too. Love the egg as it add on to the moisture of the rice. The only thing that, the unagi is on the slightly saltier side, it would have been perfect if it’s lighter in the marination.

Both dons come with a seaweed soup too! Can you believe it that above order only cost $16? Yes.. it’s super worth it!!!

Perfect Place for a Romantic Dinner.

Highly recommended to have a dinner here.

Wonderful Chef!

Such luxuriously enjoyable Omakase 🤗
Rich sea urchin melts in our mouth 🤤
With friendly staff and chef, complementing with the sweet umeshu, making the meal even more mesmerising 🤠

Fish ... is thick.
The ikura ...😱

Feel satisfied.

After a few places tried,  I guess this will be where I go when I need my sashimi fix in jurong

Apart from the location, the food, portion, taste, quality and freshness.. everything is on point. Try the premium Omakase set for maximum enjoyment. Extremely worth the money. Thanks Chef Cash for serving us.

Two of us had lunch here. It actually inside the Tunglok Seafood Restaurant. The food served was fresh and nice especially Sashimi. The service staff was also attentive and helpful. Great experience! Will visit again!

Tried the 1 for 1 don. It's delicious n nicely packed for takeaway. We opted for the unagi don and a big piece of unagi was given.The food was still warm upon correction eventhough I pre-ordered and was late for collection. The staff was also very helpful and friendly to double confirm my order, providing good direction of the place and bringing the food and credit card terminal out so that I don't need to step into the restaurant and do safe entry. 👍👍
FOODS not bad…

I had submitted a feedback that after I ate a bowl of this premium rice waygu bowl yesterday, I had diarrhea, suspected the foie gras not fresh etc.. No one call back to check at all.. Terrible.. Will not visit any of their restaurants anymore.
We had a delicious lunch here. Recommend the salted egg mixed seafood
Good sushi expirence.
Decent..

Ordered their Chashu Chahan because I’m so obsessed with Japanese fried rice recently! 😂 The Chahan portion is good, just nice for me! It was coated with lots of eggs, the flavour is quite mild and it’s not oily, which is good! 👍 Chashu is soft and tasty. 😋

Went for lunch.
Had saba fish and beef meals and sotong from different stalls.
Good food and cake for money.
Will go back again.

Nice place to eat beef-don..the beef is cooked properly and very well seosoned..the price is slightly high and the portion is quite small..however the ambience is good while we enjoyed the dinner..came back for several times whenever we have no idea what to eat..

Very good rice and beef, very well cooked. No vegetables, which would make the meal healthier. Japanese style, with a nice location, enough space to avoid to be too close to other people. Good place to have a quick and tasty dinner. The machines to order are a little bit counter-intuitive, being connected exclusively with their related local stands.

Ordered Udon and Skewers. The hottest thing were the Miso Soup and Chawamushi, the others are all lukewarm. Lukewarm Udon!

If you have to eat here, avoid these two.
6$ chicken yakisoba was served cold with only one piece of chicken, do not eat here, had food poisoning afterward

The food there is really great, ambience is good too. I wasn't even intending to eat there but the smell was just so enticing. I was walking past and there this mouth-watering aroma. And I went to check it out, the variety there not bad, so I ordered the beef don. Although it was on the pricey side, they do deliver the goods. Beef was cooked just nice, not overcooked and chewy like many other restaurants, the texture was great. The sauce was amazing, when it arrived, there was a wonderful "grilled-smokiness" smell, wonderful. Rice was cooked right, not mushy, good job.  Would be happy to return again
Love having their sushis with my family. Great prices and great quality of sushis.
The waiter enthusiasm，the is good

Did not enjoy it - upsized portion was still relatively small, taste was just mainly salt and soya sauce from their udon sauce. Comparing it to the ichiban dry udon that I had, ichiban is wayyyy better. Udon was not Q, just flat. Probably some cheap variant.

Also be prepared to wait 20 mins in an afternoon with nobody because the “chefs” (management trainee) have no idea how to make the food. I saw them flipping through a printed piece of paper which showed the steps on how to make the food. Imagine that. Subsequently lots of staff were called to the kitchen to help after customers piled up. Imagine a group of newbies making your food. That’s how it’ll end up tasting.

Tried the fried Rice before. While it looks nice, it’s tasteless and flat. Very little meat also. Definitely not worth the price paid.

Manager Kim saw the crowd piling up and customers looking increasingly frustrated, chose to turn her head and walk away. Deliberately avoided eye contact with people.
Food was great. Price slightly lower than restaurant. Worth a try I would say.

Mid quality Japanese rice that’s not really chewy, and clumps together. Skewers are a rendition of Tori-Q, but &Joy does it slightly better. Tempura is made of breaded flour and not actual tempura batter. Soggy and inner filling is so so. Tamago egg is a little too salty. Fried rice is just soya sauce with rice. Almost tasteless.

Ambience and service is good though however.
Doesn't really like there. Is quite disturbing. Even the staff would brings up politics views of the company to you. When you already had enough from your work place.

Food is really fresh and they current have a 1st anniversary deal which is attractive!

Plenty of seats available and can order directly from phone at my seat and make payment

Had the double beef zen from roman tei,  personally like it a lot 🤩
Tasty food and great service by the staff here, which are both attentive and polite. Food is a little pricey, but the dining atmosphere is comfortable.

Food is decent, ordering is convenient.

The fried rice at ramen kiou is my fav.
Wow the current promotion very worth , my son brought the beef platter from roman tei very nice
Awesome japanese bento and ramen organised like kopitiam.
very clean environment and good food :)
Lovely night with my family 🤞🏻
Decent but overly priced.
Food taste gd

Menu offer is simple, neat and clear. Sushi rice is done just nice and taste moist. Although it’s at slightly pricier side, but the ingredients offer on sushi is fresh. But some types are quite saucy but probably it’s cater for general crowd. Can come back and try their noodle, rice and appetizers. This train concept is good as increase in efficiency in delivering the ready dish on table. So that customer can finish save time.

It's nice to have another Sushi Train option. Every one has their own specialties and reason to patronize. For Sushi Go I like the varieties of Sashimi they offer. There are slightly more premium items as compare to others. Hopefully there will be more branches soon.

My favorite sushi goes to a place. They have a variety of choices, and the sushi is made fresh based on orders. The only problem is they only served one small plate of sauce (wasabi and soy sauce per person) when you are seated. You need to request more soy sauce when you finish it.

Taste is not bad, normal price. I personally like this kind of train conveyor belt 😬. We came for weekend dinner, a lot of empty tables. Just that we needed to queue for a while because they took quite some time to assign tables..

Overall not bad. Just that portions are small.
Must get the giant prawns.
One thing they can add is the option for special requests cos I realise a lot of their dishes are with mayonnaise.

Fast, clean. Slightly advantage in the varieties,  so can order what your personal  that you like.

Fast sushi but good place to have decent peaceful catch-up meals without rushing in a busy shopping centre environment.

Chance upon Sushi Go while exploring B1 of  Jurong Point. The main question to answer is Genki Sushi vs. Sushi-Go. It was almost a year since i been to Genki but i felt the variety of sushi was more in Sushi Go. The online menu through scanning the QR is user friendly but it would be nice to see what order has been served through the app. Every $20 for a token to ice cream claw machine although it is not 100%. However one small issue is that they serve powder for the hot green tea instead of tea bags so after the first cup most of the tea is gone.

Worth the try! I’m not picky about food so it’s decent for me! Tho my bf who ate the sashimi said it’s not super fresh but still okay:) Love the fried salmon skin & egg mentaiko!! Rice bowl with the fried chicken was nice too~ But can get gelak over time, portion was good (for me cos i’m a small eater) Big fried ebi prawn also one of my fav 🤤

Food came fairly fast, staff was friendly & polite! Though had to wait alil at the entrance, im guessing cos they had 2 staff working (1 clearing table 1 at cashier) while others are on break or smth? So be more understanding towards them! Will come back :)

Also for every $20 spent u can get coins to play a catcher / kiap kiap for an ice cream outside their store!! and my bf did managed to catch one hahaha

Sushi wasn’t special or exceptionally good but it’s a nice place for ‘train served’ sushi. Price was reasonable but not as economic as other express sushi place. Would recommend to try if you want to have sushi while you’re in the area but definitely won’t travel to eat there deliberately.
Have Been Wanted To Try For Awhile, Finally... Visited 😊 I Think It's Much Better Than Sushi Express & Similar To Genki Sushi 😋👍 Will Be Back~

Loved their food so much and most of the food are much better than genki. Their sashimi is super fresh and reasonably priced. Waiting time is not too long too. Must must order their waffle ice cream because ITS AMAZING. I loved the chocolate one as it has choco bits inside. I think its some kind of japanese brand ice cream you can get elsewhere but anyway just eat it!!

You will also get token to their claw machine for every certain amount spent which i cant rmb off hand. But you can try your luck for a cup ice cream there. Hopefully they have more outlets (esp the east) and i'll be sure to visit 😋

Decent sushi at an affordable price.
If you looking for quality, this is not probably the best place.

Like quite a few and also felt sad on some too. Ikura gunkan is yummy and love the spam. Truffle Chawan and Hotate sushi is okay. Get their salmon, will not go wrong. Sashimi still ok. Oyster look good but doesn't taste nice.

Get their normal Chawan more worth it and delicious.

Every $20 spend can play claw machine catch ice cream.

Genki sushi has always been my family's to go sushi place as my kids loved the sight of the train delivering the sushi. After visiting this place, I'm beginning to think that this may be our new hangout.

I really like the variety and uniqueness of the sushi they serve here. The especially like the thick cut salmon sashimi that is so satisfying to chew on. Food arrives promptly after ordering. Do come earlier as the queue forms rather quickly.

First time trying. Food is really yummy, friendly staff. Menu is large.

Looking forward to my next visit.
Affordable sushi price. I have tried their salmon mentai don, not so suit my taste but there was good taste for normal sushi. Normally have long queue during lunch and dinner time.

This place makes Sushi Express feel like an artisan sushi restaurant. Food is slow to serve and sushi looks pathetic. Sashimi dont look fresh and is unappealing. Better off with other options. Worse sushi place I been to in my life.
Order via app! Food was served in a timely order. Overall experience with minimal contact with staff except payment. Should improve the app to complete the whole dining experience.

My child wanted to try out, food is very average, not enough staff on Sunday.

Long wait to go inside even no one in front of us, ordered a green tea also need to keep asking the staff .

Always had queue when we passed by, finally got to try Sushi Go on a Monday noon...
Free wifi so everyone can order from the online menu. Our total bill was $56plus for 3 of us. Food is fresh and served quickly.

Was unfortunate as one of the items sold out jist before I check out on Sunday night. The qr code website did not specify which item sold out and the staff had to make guesses after 3 to 4 times to and fro from my seat to the cashier. Delayed the ordering process by 5 to 10 mins. Mentaiko salmon sushi was nice but the app needs better coding than just showing item #3360 sold out..something like that. Coin machine was down as well.

From the qr code scanning to the food, it was hard to find a moment to appreciate. It took awhile to load the menu from the qr code alone, and even the simplest salmon sashimi which required no cooking was tasteless and not fresh. The fried items were slightly better but the entire menu wasn't worth the price. Everything could be enjoyed at a higher quality and lower price at Sushi Express.

One of my favorite branch. Food is great and value for price.
Must order Salmon Belly very good. Geso karaage is huge. I enjoyed the mentaiko sushis too. Everything we tried was nice. However, menu changed and there's no chasiu rice anymore.
FREE ice water, Wasabi and soy sauce available on request.  Generally not crowded on weekday lunch. Spend more than $20 to get a coin to play claw machine for ice cream.

Update: new item like steam osyter is a must try!

This is definitely an affordable and family friendly Japanese restaurant at Jurong Point.

15 minutes waiting time for weekday lunch. Always see a long queue on weekend. The salmon is very fresh and nice! The quality of foods are similar to Ichiban, but the price is slight cheaper.

Your money is better spent at Genki. Decent quality but a lot more rice:topping ratio.

Makes up for it with speedy service.

We accidentally dropped our house key in the restaurant and only realized it when we were reaching home. That time was already after 1030pm. Luckily, the store manager was still around and she answered our call. They did pick up our keys while clearing the table. We were grateful that she was willing to stay back and waited for us to return back to the outlet to collect our keys.

Truly appreciated.

Good sushi. Decent priced. Will come back again. Has lots of items on the menu, decently priced. Has inari items on menu(most places only sell inari+rice only) they have quite a lot of options for inari. Handroll with Avocado is available as well. First time having black colored tobiko here as well.

Frankly not the best sushi operator, but unlike other reviewers, I did enjoy my sushi dinner in Sushi-Go. Ordered the food and most of our orders came within 15 mins? That’s fast. Hot food served hot, fresh food served fresh. But just thought the Japanese rice was alittle too thick in taste. Requested the staffs to help us top up the green tea powder a few times, they were quite prompt too. Price and quality 👍🏼.

Thought it would be great to have more food choices, for e.g. Fried food; like fries perhaps?
More chawanmushi selections?

Overall, Place was clean, pleasant to have dinner. With every $20 spend, you get a play at the claw machine.. oh ya, u only have 20 seconds at the claw machine ya.

Due to delays in their QR Code order taking system, customers had issues submitting their order entries, most of them had to signal to the servers to manually key in the entries. After that, some of the orders were delayed. Some of our orders  delayed, some  only arrived after the customer( who sat next to me) left. Sushi train got stuck half way for a few dishes. Staff hv to manually go and get it to the customers. Hope they resolved the problem soon.

Positive note: The waitresses tried hard to be helpful in helping us when all the above technical issues affected the food ordering and the promptness of the food arrival process. Kudos and dedicate the two stars for them.

Downside: The temperature of the restaurant was too cold and customers were made to  feel hungry and cold  at the same time. One of my most unpleasant experience as a customer.

Its more for kids. The lay out, menu choice, automatic food delivery trains, plush soft toy collectibles etc...The portions are small. Tiny bowls of rice/noodles. Typical adult will need 2 portions (cost about the same as any typical Japanese restaurant in Singapore). They also give out tokens for the claw machine located outside the restaurant. But its almost impossible to win/grab the ice cream out of the claw machine.
