Delicious Japanese food. Genki sushi idea. Food quality is slightly cheaper than genki and almost as good as genki, but I’ll still feel that genki taste better. Food preparing can be slightly longer. 5 stars if the timing for food to come is faster. Quality is good enough for this price.

The Sushi standard is way better than those from other competitive well known sushi rivals. Fresh, made to order, reasonable priced.
I am impressed with the ramen and udon portion size which is relatively small but they also charged it below $4, ideally enables you to have ample stomach space to still try out their other food items  in the comprehensive menu.
Will surely visit again for any sushi crave in the future.
*Given 4 stars as i think their service speed can be further improve, but might be due to the current Covid-19 situation which affected their manpower*

It's first time to try at this restaurant newly open in Jurong Point.

Firstly, the concept is good that we can order the food in system and food will deliver right to your table. So far most of the food quite tasty, I like the ice cream also. For me, the room of improvement is selection of items can be more.

Hopefully along the way, the menu will getting more items selection in future.

Waited 15 minutes from 1.15 to 1.30 and no one serve us to the table. Other patrons also chasing for their food. Both the kitchen and waiters are short of staff and its just normal weekday lunch at 1.15! A bit unacceptable. In the end the waitress say if we cannot wait, then better not eat in so we left. Disappointed..if you are not ready for service, say in advance. Or otherwise get more staffs to cover during the lunch hour.
Pretty low quality fish for average price. The cooked foods were okay but I was hoping to enjoy sushi. Sashimi portions were ridiculous and did not match the picture at all.

Food literally takes forever to come. Staff was really rude as well when i asked for orders that weren’t here. I’ve visited this place several times and i never get good service here. Either my food takes very long, i ask for my food and i get bad attitude from staff or they just take forever to sit me down at my table even when there isn’t a lot of people. Worst sushi place ever.. Never coming back again.

I was a late boomer. Never the one to go after trends amd i am easy to satisfy. So long food is in my stomach i am happy :)

Got to know about sushi-go and was totally addicted over it! Loved the varieties of sushi they have and did i mentioned the wallet friendly sushis, rice and ramens???

Must go! Now it is a place for all my celebrations. Pray tell they do not raise prices anytime soon!

Place was literally empty at 5pm and i found out why.

You order from your own phone, had difficulty ordering due to some bugs. Almost wanted to leave after 3 failed attempts. They copied Genki Sushi delivery by train which is a gimmick.

Food took sometime to come, powdered green tea is awful. These has got to be the smallest pieces of sushi i've gotten from a restaurant and the takoyaki has the size of small fishballs came cold and hard.

I would skip this joint for better variety and quality at sushi express.
Food is not terrible. But, order for only 9 items, took 1.5hour before all dishes are served. Be careful if you want to eat here in saturday after 8pm
Food are awesome and delicious at an affordable price

Very attentive staff. Outlet manager remembered me when I had some ice left in the middle of the chicken meatball ordered from previous visit. She was remembered me and offered a free portion of meatball but I decline as it is we were full. Takes feedback seriously and acts upon it

1. First the concept is attractive and interesting.
2. However, the udon is too salty and got light soya bean sauce smell overpowering.
3. The fish got fishy smell
4. The cutting of the fish not properly cut as can eat some part of the fish that is hard.
5. The table is already so small and service provider can’t even cleared the table proactively

Nothing special in particular. The chawanmushi was served cold 😡 and the green tea is powder form (hot water drips very slowly while you tries to fill your cup). Not recommended. That said, the claw machine to catch desserts for every $20 spent provides some family entertainment.

The spoons were dirty, came with small pieces of what looked like leftover food… Chawanmushi is decent. Tonkatsu ramen tasted like cup noodles. Can be better! But reasonably priced and service staff helpful.

Sushi is not bad! I spent ard $20 (including taxes) ordered ard 6-7 plates of sushi. Minus one star bc for e new range of sushi that is supposed to have some butter on top of e salmon/scallop, the butter given was so tiny that I could not taste it. Otherwise e slices of salmon are fat enough for e price :)
It will be great also if their ice cream claw machine stocks some Meiji icecream instead also. (Understand that made in Japan ice-creams might be too expensive to maintain in the long run so even Taiwanese-made Meiji is much better than the dubious looking icecream inside)

Very interesting, fun Dinning experience,
Sushi 🍣 very  nice . price  from $1.8 a salmon Sushi.
Bring your children come and experience a unique fun dinning .

TLDR; food was average, the ordering system leaves questions about its service. It has a literal pre-requisite to use a smart phone and a qr reader at this shop, which seems a little strange. A customer shouldn't have to feel conflicted by such a process to eat & order food.

Overall, the food portions are pretty standard, the taste was alright. Though upon entry i was given 2 packets of soya sauce & a packet of wasabi, as well as a QR code & a printed guide to ordering food.

While the menus work and are neatly sorted into categories (nigiri, sashimi etc.), it seems I couldn't order for more soya sauce packets nor wasabi. Everything was controlled to prevent wastage, but yet you couldnt order more? This probably explained the lack of amenities across the tables in the shop.

Ordered food was served using the "train" plate delivery system, very much akin to genki sushi's system. Though the wait for food was a little longer than expected. I ordered 3 plates initially, 2 arrived within 5 mins, but the 3rd came almost 10 mins after i was done with the first 2 items. I ordered 2 more items and it took about another 10 mins before they were served. The service overall was too slow in my opinion. I wanted to double check on ny orders but noted the store front had about 2 staff in front, whom had much to manage with waiting queues, customers paying their bills & cleaning the tables. It seems they are understaffed in their store front area.

I was greeted by a warm smile and greetings by the people working there. Love the fact that they immediately offered soy sauce and wasabi. Great service!

The wait for the food was fairly short, about 10mins. The sushi quality was abit lower compared to genki but it was cheaper! Nonetheless, the sushi was tasty!! However, you can taste the mushiness of the salmon.

The Zaru soba ( cold soba) was pretty average. They changed from serving dipping sauce and noodles to just serving you a bowl of cold soba dipped in sauce. I was pretty bummed about that :(

Lastly, the crispy salmon skin ($1.80) were really tasty and cheap! Really worth the price just for a snack. Overall a good experience, definitely bring my friends there :)

Nice ambience. Friendly and fast service. The"food shuttle" is gimmicky, but it does speed up the service.
Food is average. Matcha powder for your green tea is a welcome so you can adjust the concentration to your taste.
Prices are reasonable for the place and service.

The concept reminded me of Genki Sushi. The variety is not comparable but in term of price and shorter waiting time I will vote for this restaurant. Their queue is so much shorter. I will recommend the black pepper series sushi and the fried prawn.

The queue speaks for itself, extensive menu of quality sushi, though slightly pricey.

Full fledged restaurant with ramen and don offerings in their menu, atop the usual sushi and sashimi, not to mention their kids meal which is served in a different plate and presentation!

They also have a unique way of serving their dishes, whereby customers places their order via an online platform found on a QR code, and is served by a robotics train system, a truly good fit for COVID period.

Will definitely return in future given the wide selection and fair price point 👍🏻

(Translated by Google) delicious

(Original)
很好吃

Perhaps the oldest restaurant still standing among all in the area. Sushi/sashimi platter was quite fresh. Worth giving it a try. Beef served in sizzling hot plate. Sake was given a decanter and chilled in bucket of ice.

Used to work in Jurong and this was the go to place beside Jurong Hill Park, for a Japanese lunch.

Surprised to see that the restaurant is still doing well after 20 years, even though all the other establishments around the same area have gone to the pits. Sure it needs a new coat of paint but something tells me it’s not going to happen.

We ordered sashimi, tonkatsu don and grilled chicken set. Food still tastes good although prices have gone up a lot. The sashimi was fresh and thick cut, not the thin slivers of fish you get else where. The grilled chicken (salted, not teriyaki) was a little under cooked in some parts but mostly okay. The tonkatsu was crunchy with every bite and juicily tender inside.

I strongly recommend this old school Japanese restaurant for a simple no frills Japanese meal. Great value for money.

Definitely not your usual conveyor Japanese restaurant. We chanced on this hidden gem, located in the western part of Singapore. We ordered the salmon belly sashimi (Sake Harami) to share. Dish came with 6 slices of sashimi. The slices were thick and fresh. Immediately melted in my mouth. Damn delicious. Wifey and me then ordered a Deluxe Kaisen Don each. It’s a rice dish with egg, crab sticks, raw scallops, prawns, tuna and salmon. Topped with I believe salmon roe and uni (sea urchin). This dish was fabulous. It was so fresh and definitely filling. I washed it down with a nice bottle of warm sake. Abit pricey but definitely worth every dollar. Will recommend not to order too many dishes first as the portion is pretty big and the richness of the dishes will leave you satisfied quickly. Ample parking available so no worries about parking.

Established more than 30 years, a very homely ambience, good food and reasonable price. Love their Saba fish and grilled squid. Children love the garlic fried rice and tempura udon. Please make a reservation to avoid disappointment.

One of the more popular Japanese resturant with Japanese at the west area

Serve quite an array of Japanese food here
They also give a good range of lunch sets

Therefore you won’t have any problem finding what you want to eat

Staffs also attentive to refill your drinks

I could have gone more of my yakitori but it was ok.

***If you like what I commented and wrote…
Join as my followers and let’s share life & food comments!!!***

I dont usually write google reviews for food places unless it’s exceptionally good but THIS RESTAURANT…

Decided to visit this restaurant after reading all the good reviews on google but it turned out to an utter disappointment.

Was greeted with a weird mouldy stench when we stepped into the shop and the interior is a bit run down. Staff were not friendly and made us feel that they don’t wanna work anymore lol.

All the rice bowls on the menu looked so generous so we were very excited, however upon the arrival of our food, we were shocked and disappointed. $26 for a palm size rice bowl? Ps, I have small palm so imagine how small it is.

Trying to stay positive, we told ourselves maybe the food quality really superb. After taking a few bites on their sashimi, we looked at each other with disappointment. Not only it’s not fresh, had a few with fish scale and bones in it. We then moved on to eating the rice thinking it wouldn’t go wrong. I mean, ITS PLAIN SUSHI RICE. To our dismay, the rice doesn’t even taste like sushi rice??? There’s no vinegar taste AT ALL. It’s VERY STICKY, I think it’s glutinous rice???

Miso soup tastes worse than the ones I get from donki and the soya sauce is so salty it doesn’t even taste like the usual sashimi soya sauce they serve in restaurants???

In the end, although the dishes weren’t cheap, we really cannot bring ourselves to finish the food. ITS THAT HORRIBLE. I love my chirashi dons and I’ve never not been able to finish them but this restaurant really outdid themselves.

If you are looking for quality Japanese food, this restaurant ain’t it.

Feels like being transported back to an old izakaya in Japan (now that we can’t travel). Set lunch was good with free coffee, nice ambience, service is good. At night it turns into an izakaya. A rare find in that vicinity.

Really nice interior! Went there pass the happy hour, the food can get quite pricey although the portion was definitely worth the price. The salmon mega don was really big and the salmon slices were quite thick. Would recommend to try that!
Regular hangout. Authentic Japanese restaurant. Favourite rice bowl. Friendly staffs. Price a little on the high side. But will still go back for the good food. 😀

Revisited after a l.o..n...g break, glad to find both quality & service remain par to early days, stiffer price tags understandable espy., being niche Izakaya 🏮 over ulu-part of western region.

Love the wide array of sake🍶 & shochu🥃.

The only nice dish is the UNAGI Roll. Their fish is cooked perfectly, moist and seasoned lightly. The tonkatsu was dry and thin with a thick coating. The other sides dishes were average. However the price is on the high side even through there are at a secluded area.

Weekdays lunch promotions are a steal. Food quality is comparative to most other well established Japanese restaurants.  Prices are competitive and comparable. Its not a super big restaurant. So go there early or make reservations.  You will be surprised by the lunch crowd.

Great food. The sashimi is very value for money as the cuts are very thick. Tempura is crispy, yums.

The place is right beside Sheng Shiong. It has an old school charm to it.

The place was packed on a Saturday night, had to wait 45 mins for our food when we placed order at 7.15pm. Come earlier if you have kids in the group.

They had bookshelves full of comics, but it’s all in Japanese language 😅

Hidden gem Japanese Restaurant in Taman Jurong, nice ambient & delicious food.
Like their interior design,  feel like at Japan.
Delicious reasonably priced fresh Japanese food in the heartlands. It would be advisable to reserve a place as it is well patronised. 10% discount during Happy hour (5.30 pm to 7pm).

Food under average , can tasted the seafood not so fresh already. waited quite long for the food waiting . If can I will give with no star but for the Google setting I can't . Service also horrible the gal think Vietnam or Philippines ask her anything seems like no response . If not happy you can just stay home don't look like people owe you money . Spent money come eat but not value at all....
Not bad. Cheese mentaiko potato is a must try. Most of the dish quite decent, price is quite ok.. can try.
Very fresh sashimi! Prices are reasonable too. Will come again :)
Excellent service & food at reasonable prices. 20% Off (Happy Hour) is available from 5.30pm to 7pm (Mon - Sun including Public Holiday).

Interior looks like going to demolish
No air con
Waitress not friendly but part timer good
Preparing of food took 40mins
Food quality slightly better than ichiban
Overall 2/5 will not come back to eat again

Chirashi unagi don
Japanese fair today Sun 31/1/2012 till CNY 2021 @ Kotobuki Jurong, 3 Yuan Ching Road (Superbowl Jurong).

First time there so it's first impression review. Both my wife and I were very  satisfied with the Gindara Cod stew that my and the Tuna bowl.
Food is at least 4 stars, and value for money with the 20% discount as we ordered before 7pm on a weekday

But service is 3 stars at best because they appear shorthanded.

Lots of Japanese clientile that looked like regulars.

Food standard has drop drastically, it’s about 20-30% of their usual standard. Bluefin grilled jaw was not fresh, beef was subpar chewy for price paid, miserable small piece, taste like rejected beef from supplier. Yakisoba which is suppose to be a easy cook was mushy and tasteless.

Always like going to this restaurant but today was a real disappointment.

However service staff was attentive, that was the only saving grace.
Value for money lunch sets with great quality!
Decent food, reasonable price, the Japanese boss very shy, haha. Almost visit this restaurant every week.
Great food, remember to go during happy hour for discount :-)

The Yakitori is a must try. Chef did the chicken just done. Cooked and Juicy. A true Gem in the west.
Extensive Sake and Shochu menu.

I hate myself for finding this place this late. Please don’t come here so I will always find a seat whenever I am here. True Gem.
Happy with rice bowl.. thick and generous Sashimi... 👍
tasty food, gd service (” treat others the way you wanted to be treated” )
Love the experience here. Free salad bar, amazing food and good service. Love this place...
Great, authentic Japanese food served in a homely environment.
Standards have way plunged down, doesnt taste the same, and the menu have changed. Food aint so fresh anymore. Having eating it for more than 10 years.
If can more vegetarian food is better
The service and food is from bad to worse.. 3 simple dishes are served separately with an interval of 10mins in between. Not going back again..
Beautiful ambience with great food as well!

Foods were nice. But overall standard has dropped. Step in restaurant before 8pm which is less crowded. Ordered simple Kaisen don, Maki, Tempura which do not need long time to prepare. Waited more than 30mins for the first don served. Maki is yet to serve after an hour. I don't understand why take so long to prepare the food when the shop left merely customers.
Food was great! Loved the Chirashi don
Very nice traditional japanese food and traditional setting out

Bad experiences, Was seated around 6plus and ordered the foods. We waited almost 1 hour and when I asked the staff to check, she said ok checked but she didn’t come back to me. i have to walk to her and  told her that I wished to change to takeaway or else then canceled. She didn’t canceled my order and asked me to wait for take away, I asked her how long, she didn’t reply me on the waiting time just told me to wait. Again, I waited another 15 minutes. I was in the hurried to return something to someone else and I told the counter staff, I will canceled my order and left in a hurry with fuming and hungry state.  Utterly disappointed with them. Last time, the foods was served fast around 20 minutes but today I waited for an hour. Won’t go back again.  😡😡😡😡

Shashimi is fresh. Reasonably priced. Surprise to find such good quality Japanese food at this place. Cosy, quiet place n good food. No need to travel to Orchard Road if you crave for Japanese food. Will return.

Been patronizing this outlet for few years. However, standard has been dropping. Especially with more residents shifting to the nearby flats and condos, the service crews attitude is really bad. No smile. And ever waited more than 1 hour for our dinner to be served. After checking with the crews a few times as kiddos are really hungry, they will tell you off saying that why you come at peak hour? (it was close to 8pm) Our kitchen are short handed with just 1 chef. And today, the rice that they served is mixed with short grain and Thailand rice. To cut cost, maybe. Just felt that it does not deserve to our continuous support anymore.

Having bad dining experience with this restaurant, the soup is super duper salty like drinking msg and the drinks was too sweet. This is my first time to leave my review on google, to me food Costly and tasteless! Will not go back again☹️. If really want to say, the service provided still okay.
Good food, price very reasonable, service friendly. Waiting time slightly longer when evening happy hour is on.

Good sashimi, below average tempura, nice beef. Service is extremely slow. Even when the restaurant has 2 tables seated, it took them 40min to prepare a set meal after repeated checks. Do not visit unless you have time to kill.

Firstly, we went there with no expectation as it was an impromptu visit and I didn't do any homework which I normally do. It was also to celebrate my better half's birthday and it was a nice substitute for where we initially wanted to go (Tanoshii ) but couldn't as it didn't accept young kids. Good service and nice space allowance. Nicely litted. I would give a 5 for the unagi as it really hit the spot. Don't expect a wonderful presentation like in the other restaurant. Why it is a 4 was more with tempura. It is not horrible but up to the 5 rating level. I will pay a visit for the chirashi and raw food to see if they can hit my 5 rating.

Food so so. Considering the location and old rundown condition of the place , price is high. They run out of char siew but didn't mentioned until serving the ramen, simply replaced with chicken with an take it or leave it attitude. No more repeat visit...

It’s reasonably priced and they often have additional offers but that’s the best that can be said of it. Food quality is decidedly average at least for their Chirashi Don. But what can you expect really for do it all budget Japanese places? Eat here if it’s convenient for you and if you are on a budget but otherwise you’d be better off at a less budget place.
Old school authentic Japanese cuisine that has been around for a long long time...

I usually like my food cooked well, hence #Sashimi is just not my kind of food. Plus i am very sensitive to fishy smell, the slightest smell will just explode in my nose when the fish is not fresh. But... I'm about to change that. #ConfidenceRegained
.
First time having a #ChirashiDon, i must say i am pleasantly surprised, especially when paired with #GrilledUnagu. Even ate a few slices of #Salmon, #SwordFish, #YellowTail and #Tuna (no mercury-like taste 👍🏻👍🏻).
.
Loved their #DeepFriedOctopus, goes well with #Mayonnaise (available upon request). The #BbqEggRolls are pretty tasty too.
.
So glad that we have a decent #JapaneseRestaurant here in the #West, #TamanJurong. #Kotobuki is a great gem serving great #JapanseCuisine.
.
#StanRecommends #StanzFoodHunts @kotobukisg #KotobukiSG #Jurong

Ordered Ramen, Soba tempura, udon tempura and mixed grilled skewers.
Service: Good but food prep/cooking was slow. waited almost 20-30 mins.
Quality: Ramen broth and dipping sauces (soba/udon) were watered down. Flavor lost already. Grilled skewers were okay. Salt/Pepper/Teriyaki sauce
Green tea and complimentary black coffee was satisfactory.
Price: 80$++ with tax
Verdict: Spend your money elsewhere

This restaurant has a large menu from Japan's Tohoku region. We ordered a couple of set dinners and a grilled squid. They come with a food warmer beneath. It's best to let the warm warm up. The steak was well marinated and soft. The squid was not to my liking. It was okay but slightly fishy. All in all a decent dinner on the average side.

The restaurant provide great variety and the taste was ok. It was a short queue for weekend lunch. Green tea is refillable. The kids utensil and cup are not properly clean, I doubt if they disinfect the utensils.

Firstly, it was long queue during dinner time, so the expectation was got very high.    The food was ok and hot pot quite good. The value was deducting from utensils didn’t supply. When waitress finish my order, then she didn’t supply utensils to us, that is after our meals arrived. we request from the service table. Secondly, the waiters is supply wrong meal frequently. The worst is there have two big fly surrounding, feel so unhygienic.

Stood at the waiting line around 5pm, nobody was there to serve us for quite some time. The service not up to standard. Most of the dishes were served either warm or cold, only the green tea was hot, everything here was underwhelming. Total damage $85++

food is delicious as usual. refer to photos. restaurant seems to be understaffed, but they took our orders accurately n timely. Oh.. and a tiny cockroach crawled onto my side of the table and i smacked it with paper napkins. An eventful night for us 😅.

Repeated customer. Tried their festive menu and it was soo worth it. Tasted great too ☺️ and their icecream scoops were actually unassumingly nice
Minus 1 star because the service was sooo slow

@ichibanboshi.sg has an extensive menu and offers a large variety of set meals so no matter what your preference are, they've got you covered. The set meal here are affordable priced. Most of them come with Chawanmushi, Rice, Miso Soup and Sashimi. My chicken nanban set come with tempura soft shell crab 😋 The tartar sauce goes very well with chicken and salmon is thickly sliced and fresh. Chawanmushi was just normal.

Ig: @zoey_belle_

Decent Japanese-style food. Visited on a weekday afternoon, didn’t have to wait long. Service was friendly and effificient. Preferred the previous version of fried salmon skin where it was thinner and crispier. I took the oyster nabe, tasted comforting and there was a surprising amount of oysters as well though there was just a few strands of Japanese vermicelli.

Disappointing experience. The fish+spicy fish roe from the seasonal menu which I ordered came with raw parts in the fish. I only realised the raw parts halfway through my meal. After I checked with the waitress, she took the plate and said she'd "return it to the kitchen", without waiting for a response.

After 10minutes, the plate was just thrown on my table, with the waitress mumbling "不好意思啊" ("sorry ah") and walked away, again without waiting for any response. And guess what, the fish came back still in its half eaten form (photo attached), albeit cooked more thoroughly. In this COVID-19 climate, not sure if putting back a half-eaten fish on the grill is a good idea.

There was obviously no room for discussion on the possible service recovery. No sincere apologies given, no offering of any compensation. Even though it is a grave issue regarding food safety.

I used to like Ichiban Boshi, but i am so disappointed this time. The ika yaki (grilled squid) is so small, it is so different from what I ate last time, and from the menu too. This is the first time (in my memory) that I immediately complained to a waiter on their food. That waiter called a lady and immediately they took it away. 10 minutes, the lady sent back the ika with additional few more pieces (the whiter ones in the left of the picture) and said they added more for me, then mumbling that it is 150g while walking away...

The taste is different from Japanese grilled squid, but more like a sambal sotong.

I am disappointed with the food. Wondering if this is  single case issue, or overall the standard of this branch dropped..

Not the best Japanese restaurant and guess this is what I can expect in Jurong Point. Price range is normal and tasted ok. First time I tried set meal and this time around I ordered ala carte. Service was good and less crowd. They sell sushi and sashimi at the entrance if you opt for a takeaway. Hotate sashimi was not bad but slightly thin. Total bill $40.37 for one pax.
It’s always our family’s all time favourite restaurant! Staffs are friendly and attentive!

I have visited Ichiban Boshi in Jurong point outlet on 22/7/2022 at night. I have been served by uncle Charles who are very patient and provide exceptional service to us. Uncle Charles provided prompt service when we needed. He also offered to help us take picture. Other than that, he are attentive to our needs and pour for us tea when we finished it. I really enjoyed his service. His service make my day and I have recommend my friends and family to Ichiban Jurong Point to eat.

I hope that you can award him with awards or give him recognition as he leave me a good impression about Ichiban Boshi. His service impacted me greatly and I will visit Jurong Point outlet again.

Haven't came in for a few years.
Quite taken aback overall drop in pretty much everything or I had a much rosier view back then when I was younger

Could tell they were understaffed right off the bat. Definitely got off from the wrong foot when they asked if I wanted wasabi and soy. I've never been asked that question ever anywhere else in my entire life in a Japanese restaurant when you order anything with raw fish

What would you expect the answer to be and what situation led to such a question in the first place ?

Doesn't help when it turned up with the blot of wasabi marinating itself in a saucer of sauce . This was  already pointed out by other reviewers and even with responses from the management, if there's no change its pretty clear things are not going to change . So please don't drop some message after this "you'll look into it "

Notice that tea ? It says refillable in the menu . But that's not the issue,  I choose that in spite of the fact i have utmost confidence it wouldn't be refilled because that's the standard you pretty much expect of the service staff nowadays

What I hadn't counted on is staff passing by checking the mug, peeping down at it throughout the meal 4 to 5 times  and not doing anything about it . I'm fine if your standard of service precludes refills but the repeated visits was as useful as asking me if I wanted wasabi .

One of the reviewers hit the nail on the head when this was described as something like a zhi char restaurant.  Everything feels like a tired  Chinese restaurant here

Been a regular patron of Ichiban for many years with my family - possibly close to a decade. Mostly at JP branch.

Other than the occasional long queues during peak hours, there has not been much of a disappointment or bad experience so far.

The quality of food have never failed us and it isn’t too over-priced. There will always be suitable dishes for the young and old, and even vegetarian.

Wanted to commend a staff who left a very good impression on me. Visited the Jurong Point branch on 18 Sep for lunch with my family. The section service staff (Uncle) Charles was really warm and attentive. He would constantly be looking to serve the tables with prompt and smallest gestures and checking to maintain his service corner to be ready and neat. Impressed with his professionalism.
Surprisingly waitin time for seats is not too long for a family of 5paxs, 15mins, on a Sat, 1315H. Food is tasty, portion is reasonable. Service is okay.

Like it especially when most of their food quality re pretty consistent at all their outlets. Fresh quality ingredients used! Extensive menu and huge serving. Always find ourselves sharing the hotpot meal. I like their ika tempura. It tasted incredibly delicious topping it off with the Wasabi Mayo! Just a note to highlight, although the service was relatively prompt, but the waiting time of the food was slightly longer than usual. Meanwhile, remember to scan your RE&S membership upon making payment if you are one too! 👍🏼

Updated with more photos on 5 April.
Affordable price with fresh sashimi. Food is nice and place are clean and tidy.
Relatively costly, but still good enough food.. a monthly treat is ok

Here’s my bang-for-buck ratings

Food: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Price: 3/5
Decor & seating: 3/5

Highly recommend stewed beef cubes. Grilled salmon a tad too salty.
Unagi sushi was not bad.
Swordfish belly was on point based on taste and texture.
Momo peach ice cream was yucks.
Sesame ice cream passable.

Service was so-so, not proactive which means tea pretty much unfilled and finished dishes not cleared promptly. Fortunately staff still attended upon request.

Had a chance to have lunch at Ichiban today... Had ordered the Saba and rice as a simple dish for myself.

When the fish came, i taste it and feels cold and the fish is like not grill and doesn't taste fresh...
Spoken to the floor manager, Mau whom was a nice lady whom came and make a replacement on the Saba.

2nd pieces of Saba came but to no changes... warm but could feel the meat is so hard which shouldn't be (see pic). Mau came to ask for review of the fish but she knew it wasn't good.. she initiated to change to Salmon. Meanwhile, she apologised and gave us a plate complimentary sushi..

Finally, the salmon came and the meal was completed.

I have to compliment the assistant manager named, Mau. She was very good and professional in serving customer and cater to their needs. Thanks Mau for making my experience worth while during the short period.
Loved Their Sushis & Salmon Teriyaki!!

Exceptional customer service from the elderly uncle here. However everyone else when he is not around is absolutely horrible. Manager walks passes avoiding eye contact so she doesn’t have to attend to customers wanting to make orders. Other staff looks like they are overworked or just woken up, it’s a pain to get any of their attention, even when the store is less than 20 percent filled. Hit or miss experience here

Japanese styled restaurant provides good value food for family, kids menu available which they would love to order. Good for group gathering or by ownself to seat by sushi train table. May have to queue  to be seated during peak hours.

Greeted with friendly waiters and waitress, meals are served around 15mins after order.

Ordered bento set and Food were tasty. There were seats during weekday lunch and do not need to wait too long

Second time visiting this outlet here at Jurong Point. It was a Sunday and needless to say, there’s quite a queue.. The “waiting area” was pretty warm and could do with some ventilation.

The waitress who attended to us was probably new as she had to went back and forth consulting her colleagues each time I ordered a different sushi on a different category. I would suggest to provide iPad on every table, like what many other establishments already are doing, so to convenience us consumers. Because fact is, she keyed in the wrong order for one of them, and it tasted awful 🤢

I have to highlight the fact that the soft shell crab is a must-have given that it is actually crispy, and actually contains crab meat! I’m really surprised and regretted not going for another round..

All in all, the food was good and the price reasonable.

Probably one of the largest store in the island. Lots of varieties to. Goose from .. sashimi, sushi, grilled fish, Tempura and with high quality fish like blue fin tuna sashimi and Uni! Lovely place to have casual dining but the waiter and waitress needs to be more attentive. The oyster with cheese and special sauce taste funny with bitter after taste! The quality of the food is quite good and price is reasonable. Good for family too.!

It's another weekend coming to an end. Decided to travel all the way to Jurong Point for lunch and ended up at Ichiban Boshi.

We ended up here because it was busy everywhere. Too many people in this mall.

Anyway, our lunch was just okay. I remembered that Ichiban had a much better quality but maybe that was years ago.

The menu definitely changed a little. I was hoping for a good lunch but got an okay okay lunch instead.

So what went wrong today? Firstly they served our soya sauce with wasabe in it. That's not Japanese at all. That's a Singaporean thing. Never do that!

Secondly, my SOBA was served room temperature. This should have been served chilled.

Thirdly, the Karei Karaage was not crispy as it should have been. This was rather disappointing but the flavors with pretty good.

The food didn't turn out so great but our waiter was amazing. He really took good care of us. He made sure our drinks were always full and he was very attentive.

Kudos to him!

Food was alright, not stunning. I got a hotpot with beef and the beef tasted great, although there could've been a bit more soup. Also, remember to check your receipt - I was charged for something I didn't order and paid about $7 more than I should have. The service staff (an uncle) was very nice though!
Same good quality food and service as their other locations. Extensive menu, reasonable price, good quality ingredients, prompt service.

been to numerous ichiban boshi across the island, this one always has the best service. service staff are always warm, friendly, and welcoming. some even check up on you to ask whether the food is alright. imho, if you're at japanese street and don't know what to eat, just go to ichiban boshi. it's the most "worth-it" japanese restaurant to go to at japanese street in jurong point.

The sushi off the conveyer belt tastes a bit stale but the menu items are pretty good. It’s a little pricy and I expected more from the food.

Service staff was friendly but a little slow to respond due to the small amount of floor staff working with a huge holiday crowd.

We accidentally ordered a chef recommended cold udon, with sesame dressing. It tasted weird, we did not like it. Sea urchin was not that fresh. The beef Don could not compare with average restaurants out there. The only decent dish we had was the sashimi.

Perhaps these few dishes cannot justify this restaurant's standard. Because it is very popular among locals, we had to queue for our seat. And other customers that ordered their bento sets seemed to enjoy their food. However, do avoid the dishes we ordered as they weren't pleasant.

I personally love this Japanese restaurant very much, and usually go there for dinner over once a month. The food is fresh and tasty, the atmosphere is relaxing too. The price is roughly 25-40 SGD per person.
The venue is big and spacious. The staffs working on that day have been attentive and responsive to our table requests. The food was great too. Awesome experience for our family that day.
Service is good. Food presentation is good! Recommend the sweet potato salad.
Did a takeaway for the sushi and not disappointed. Fresh and reasonably priced, with many varieties to choose from. Spoilt for choice!
Pleasant dining experience with great service staff. Food selection is wide and the quality of food is passable.

Extensive menu with wide variety of set meal options. Had the mentaiko salmon paired with sashimi salad set meal, comes with soup and chawamushi. Pretty filling. Service could be better, was seated at a corner and had a hard time getting the waiter/waitresses’ attention.

Good ambient and service staffs. Ingredients used are fresh. Good choices in the menu. Am happy with the combination in each set menu. Like the taste and presentation. Portion served more than adequate. Repeat visit is a definite Yes. Thank you for serving me a complete meal.
Good food. Great service. Reasonably priced.
Quick no frills lunch spot.

Empty tables available but not letting people in. Purposely creating long queue. If they are understaffed, management should do something about it. Having a queue outside with empty tables in the restaurant is ridiculous!
The set meal comes with many different varieties of ingredients and the experience is just wonderful.

Ichiban Boshi have good lunch deals and the food is alright. However if without lunch promotion the price of the food would be quite pricey and i would suggest eating something else. There are better food around Jurong Point

Been here at least 5 times. Service is below the industry standard. Waited 1 hour for my food. Poor communication between servers and kitchen staff. Staff appear busy but do nothing.  Ask for wasabi but they never return. Not interested in serving you or taking your order unless you call them. Overall a very lousy experience and I suspect its poor management at this outlet!
We have the pleasure of Charles serving us this evening. He was very attentive to our needs. Haven't had such good service in a long long time. Thank you very much! 🙏
Good service and food overall. Unfortunately, half of the veg in the salad we got was baf and inedible. However we usually never have a problem with our orders 👍🏽
Food was fine but they screwed up having the kids meals served late and last...
Superb service from a friendly uncle with specs. I wish I can award him best employee award.

Great service and super friendly staff. Told them our pork jowl is over cooked, too hard and burnt. The manager offered to give us a new plate.

Both my parent and I like to eat their salmon and prawn don (either with mentaiko or without).

Highly recommend this outlet.

Visited on a Sat for dinner. Ordering is done via the QR code. Had the pork bowl, Australian wagyu bowl & salmon sashimi. The pork was very tender with a rich flavour from the marinade. Beef was way too tough and not worth it. 10/10 would not order again as there are better places for beef. Service is pleasant.
Used to love it, but feels that the standard has dropped. The meat seems over tenderizer till it doesn't taste like meat anymore. Come mainly for their Foie Gras, luckily the Foie Gras still ok.

Highly recommend for Iberico Hoho Don. Meat is so tender,  juicy and smoky. The taste and texture is so good! Make me want to come back to eat again! The staff is friendly and  good service. I think they should hire more staff. Always crowded and busy

Late lunch after 2pm on a public holiday, no queue. Scan menu to order. Like the ability to add salad $2 to the dons which come with miso soup (seaweed, tofu & clams). The 3 kinds buta jyu $23 bbq pork - good flavourful fats and the wagyu suji don - tender beef stew $18.90 were the preferred ones. Wagyu stamina Don - grilled beef $23.90 was ok too but a little tougher...

Maybe there is a stand in kitchen crew.  The food is a far cry from the Vivo branch.   Even the way the food is prep seems different- our chicken / pork seems to be prep in advance and then reheated via pan fried or microwaved.  And there’s hardly sauce on top although it tasted salty.  Will not be coming again even if we are now living nearer to Jem than Vivo.

One word of caution for the owner- with an open space open-open dine-in your staff do need to watch out for patrons to ensure no free riders who eat and go without paying 😊

So good!! The pork was super tender and soft and not overly sweet, while the sashimi was super fresh and sliced thick enough too! Visited on a sat lunch, was crowded but didnt have to wait long for the food to be served. Will definitely be back to try the other dons.

Edit: 2nd visit and dropped to 4 stars. I'm not too sure why it didnt come with miso soup and sides this time round. Wondering if it was missed out or it is only for lunch. Was very satisfied with the sashimi as it was thick cut and very fresh, but sadly disappointed with the squid as the sauce was way too much and making it overly sweet. The squid was actually cooked to perfection though.. not too chewy. I will still go back again to try more mains and hopefully give back the 1 star again.

Have been here a few times and was never disappointed with the food. Ordered Wagyu Stamina Don with Foie Gras, Chicken Nanban Don & 3 Kinds Sashimi this time. The dons were pretty good, but honestly the sashimi was the best! Each slice was fresh and thick, which is really worth it for $12.80 :-)

This Aburi outlet is conveniently located at the ground floor of Jem. The outlet faces Westgate Mall and is located at the entrance facing Westgate. The menu consist of a selection of Japanese food bowls and raw fish. Tried a few of the Japanese rice bowls. The helping is sufficient but not excessive.

New menu and WOW - it's great. The 3 fish appetiser is amazing, new fish donburi sets are great. I liked this place before but it was getting a bit boring... However, now it's like an old good place that just got refreshing and better. Well done!!!

Had Buta don with onsen egg and Asari Miso Soup. Would be better with more sauce.

I was seated outdoor with live band playing from Tipsy Bunny just beside Aburi-EN. This is a good place to catch up with friends.
Especially waryu beef good quality , highly recommended. Just wish the restaurant can hired more staffs , coz we wait for drink and the food around half hour
Had the Chope deal which was the Premium Buta Don. The pork was so tender and juicy. The sauce was a little sweet and savoury. And that char on the meat was divine. Love it!

Aburi-EN may be known for their chargrilled meat donburi bowls, but their NEXT MEATS series are flavoursome too! Decided to try their 𝗡𝗘𝗫𝗧 𝗠𝗘𝗔𝗧 𝗣𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗶𝘂𝗺 𝗞𝗮𝗿𝘂𝗯𝗶 𝗗𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝗲𝘁 out of curiosity and was pleasantly surprised by how good it is. For $13.80, it comes served with 5 sizeable pieces of grilled boneless short rib glazed with their special sauce, atop a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. Grilled over binchotan charcoal, the meat slices are tender and have a nice smoky char. Tastewise, the NEXT yakiniku meat pales slightly to the other meat alternatives BB has tried thus far, but the glaze more than makes up for it with a good balance of sweetness and umami & a subtle hint of ginger. Definitely a solid meat-free option for flexitarians or vegetarians. 👍🏻⁣
We were impressed by how delicious the plant-based option was, ramen was also good.

We take away our food, we chose the Prem Buta Bara Don but when we opened it when we reached our house they only give the meat but no rice but in our receipt is we paid for the dish fully so it was supposed to be with rice. Very very disappointing.

I frequently patronise EN Sakaba in Tanjong Pagar as it’s near my office so decided to order delivery through oddle. Was disappointed that the wagyu stamina Don was full of veggies, mushroom, and NOT beef. The buta don pork is tough. Only saving grace is the egg and edamame. Also, the delivery guy was late (supposed to be 6-6.30 but he only came at 6.40, somemore Jem isn’t very far from choa chu kang) 😢

I usually like this place, the food is very nice but yesterday was a bit of a disaster. I think they are understaffed, the scan qr menu didn't work so a member of staff took the order from the menu. Seemed to cause alot of problems, we started to get orders from other tables and nobody knew what we ordered for the whole meal. Staff were trying to solve the issue but we're very stressed out, we had to keep explaining what we ordered even though they took the original order down on paper. Had to keep asking for things also, no discount or anything offered when paying for the trouble :|

Staff were nice enough and willing to help but I probably won't go back.

The foods are bad as what we expected. Actually went over on Monday to try at Jurong outlet. Those meats (pork n beef) Wagyu are totally worst disappointment in meat quality n even a rice are over wet. Terrible Monday dinner.. Please have quality check on food
Service are not to standard, bring to our table yet no one came take order as one of us need to walk out to ask waiter to come over... Is it meant when we seat far away then none will come to take care of our order?

Amazing Japanese cuisine in the west. Their dons and gyozo are a big “must try” dishes. Can’t complain about service, they have automated the whole process of ordering thru the QR scan method, which I find very useful. It gets a bit crowded over the weekends, so watch out for that. Would suggest ask for outdoor seating than indoors. Overall a great place to add to your list of diners

Not bad, the fish egg or roe is quite tasty, a bit salty but nice. The wagyu has a bit of sinewy fats lining, together with the eel, is quite good. The grilled squid is excellent. The rest are pretty above average stiff, toufu, sashimi, and the salad platter. Overall an above average meal. Good. :D

Overall good experience.
The grill food is well cooked not charred.
It's tender as well.
Minus one star is because charashi Don is not available today 😔 hence ordered sashimi to satisfied my cravings. Overall yummy 😋

Quick friendly service. Food is good. Physical menu and we order by writing on the order chit. Located near one of the level 1 entrances in JEM. There is outdoor seating as well. As the place gets its air conditioning from the central air conditioning, it can be a bit warm at certain seats on a hot afternoon. Payment at the counter when we exit.

Foodsssss are awesomely DELICIOUS….a bit pricey but worthy every buck….Ramen is so good and seafoods are perfectly cooked…staffs are great and place is conveniently located at Jem near the MRT. I will come back to this place again…🙂

Poor service, QR code to order food was not working, asked the staff she said she will order for me but she never gave me my order chit so I thought maybe she did order but they will give the order chit later. Waited for 15 mins nth came so I asked another staff(in red shirt) and it was only then did she order for me. So I waited for nothing and attitude was 0 stars, it was like I owed her money or something 🙄 it’s not that I expect top notch service or anything but at least treat people with respect

One of the really good Japanese restaurant chain, their pork rice bowls are nice, even better are the sashimi and salmon bowl with mentaiko sauce. Unfortunately their wagyu bowl are not really done well as the beef are a little chewy. Good place to chill with friends over some cold beer and nice Japanese food 👍

Really good butadon, though we prefer the original one as compared to the premium iberico version which is more expensive, to each their own. The only downside was that it wasn’t filling since the portion was relatively small.

The ramen on the other hand, was really poor. The taste and portion were not up to mark at all.

That said, this is a plus for solely the butadon which is what they are famous for.
The pork is well marinated and fresh. Really enjoyed the taste and the ambience of this place. The matcha ice cream is yummy too, will come again😄😋

Well torched and polished meat. Not exactly mind blowing, but it is satisfactory - above average. Indoors (also ourdoors) are very well furnished and looks classy. Not exactly value for money (about 15+ for a bowl of Don), but acceptable for the quality. Crowd here is mostly working ppl
Impressed by the food quality and the service provided! Value for money and worth it! However, there’s a few flies which quite annoys me during the dine.

Slightly crowded during lunch time. Has a wide variety in their menu, includes miso soup and a side of pickles for their lunch timing (11am-5pm). Looks appetising and amazing, however quality of the food is slightly lacking, neither good nor bad.

Thick cuts of Sashimi, albeit fresh! Beef carpaccio is highly recommended👍🏻 Seems like their specialty is Iberico. Tried the Aburi mentaiko, interesting taste. Grilled Hokke(not in pic) was perfectly grilled with subtle fragrant😌

Overall it's a cosy place for chill over drinks & food. Enjoyed!
Quality food, nice and tasty. Will come back for more! Prefer the Premium Buta Don to Buta Don as the meat is more tender. Sashimi is fresh but typical.
Had the three-kinds butadon and all three kinds of pork were amazing! Different textures and flavours and all of them were great!

Amazing buta don dishes served here! Recommend the pork belly and the aburi buta dishes. The unagi jyu is also a must have if you like unagi - melt in your mouth and very flavourful. Can get the mix sets for the best of both worlds - there are seasonal options and a wide variety of things other than unagi and pork, like sashimi, squid, chicken etc.

Decently priced, good location, spacious and many seats. Service can be a bit slow but otherwise satisfactory.

Had their 3-Kind Buta Combo Jyu. It was rice (don) with grilled chestnut pork belly, pork loik, and Iberico pork jowl. All of them tasted great with the help of the chilli powder. The waiting time was okay. A bit expensive, but would say it’s worth it.
Their chicken nanban don (fried chicken with tartar sauce) was delicious.. Service was quick and fuss free as well on a Sat lunch
Not bad in term of taste and quality, but a bit pricey. Total cost is $80.15 for these 4 items plus an onsen egg.
Very satisfied with the seasonal meatless menu!! Generous portion! Delish!
Marinated soft egg really good. Other than that, nothing else worth mentioning. Ramen broth incredibly salty. Salmon just sauce with rice, nothing special.
Tried unagi and pork jowl combo don, unagi was a tad fishy, while pork jowl was great with good combination of fats n meat. Overall pretty tasty but the sauce can be overpowering towards the end.
Expected price for good quality pork and beef don but still on the pricier side. Quick and efficient service, friendly staff
Ordered the Premium Butadon and it was flavourful, the ratio of fat to meat is great and it literally melts in the mouth. I would definitely come back to try the other butadon and ramen.

Not bad but still has a lot of room for improvement,  e.g. to provide honest n decent portion , felt cheated only 1 clam in soup , octopus karrage was too hard and such a small portion for the price.not sure it was top grade as its kinda covered with too much marinate

Simple-looked japanese restaurant & offers a variety of high quality donburi (rice bowls) at affordable prices in a comfortable and affable ambience. Their flamed seared grilled meats was a great highlight n premium quality used but we take a step back n try their other dishes. Wow... Equally good n oishi. The garlic edamame once eaten, I can say u practically can just go along with their liquor n chit chat with friends. It's not too garlicky n u won't have the "green" taste of peas. Next up is the chicken nanban don, avocado salad n saba shioyaki, brings out the perfection in each dish, balancing each component’s texture and coordinating their flavors so that all come together to create the awesome taste, tantalizing your taste buds....

Delicious, affordable.

Had the basic buta don (set thanks to the lunch promo), base price was $11 before tax.

Verdict? Really good. The pork was nice and tender and the seasoning makes you hungrier. Rice was packed nicely and fills you up well.

Eating companion took chicken nanban ($11) and it was good as well. The tartar sauce and karrage seasoning went well together.

Will be back to try the other stuff.
Best food in town good service recommended buta don😋

The portion size of the ebi salmon ikura don is paltry.  The staff also served us the wrong food items - ebi salmon don without ikura and salmon mentaiko don - and I had to highlight this to the staff. The wagyu stamina don I ordered on a previous occasion was also mediocre and had too much vegetables. What a pity…
Love the buta don! Affordable and delicious. Wagyu don is not worth the price, beef was not tender.
Good place for weekday lunch. Generous servings worth your money.
Okay, like any other Genki sushi restaurant in the chain.  It's not too bad although sushiro is slightly better with respect to their offerings.  The queue is long but they try hard.

⁣
𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐯𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐝: 𝟗 𝐀𝐮𝐠 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟐 𝟐𝐩𝐦 𝐓𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐝𝐚𝐲 ⁣
⁣
I'm surprised it's so crowded for this time of day. It could also be due to a public holiday. ⁣
⁣
We took a seat at the counter table. I'm surprised and a little disappointed that they served the chawamushi in a Tupperware container rather than a regular cup. It was also not served hot. Apart from that, everything is fine. ⁣
⁣
Okonomiyaki Skewer, Takoyaki, and Spicy Gunkan are must-orders!
As mentioned simply the best choice for sushi people. What to say for the best. Maintained services, good customer service. Keep up the good work. Look forward

The food quality can be better as compared to their competitor as some of the food items are really salty and portion are small/thin. The fried fish skin is not really appetizing as really tough when biting it...

Fast, clean. Slightly advantage in the varieties,  so can order what your personal  that you like. Quality is  higher and among the best

Fast sushi but good place to have decent peaceful catch-up meals without rushing in a busy shopping centre environment.  This one sitted side by side (abit more diff but will do)
Service is good but shoyu taste not really used to theirs. Salmon sashimi not fresh enough. Might consider to return but at the moment got better options nearby.

if I had given a review months ago when they first opened I would probably have given 4  stars . I actually thought they were ok , pretty decent , other then salmon skin which arrived cold and rather oily . Average reviews were over 4 stars then .

Visited yesterday and was stunned by the drastic drop in standards.
The salmon sashimi was literally pink like it's dried for a while .  My company thought it was weird for me to recommend genki since he boycotted for a while due to low standards.  And after seeing the salmon I just couldn't bring myself to send in the rest of the orders.

They also got our orders wrong.
It wasn't busy yet it happened.  So I have no idea what's happening in the kitchen .
When we received the tuna roll they actually felt warm to the mouth.  This is an air conditioned restaurant and something with raw fish felt warmer than room temperature.

Unless things change I doubt I'll be adventurous enough to risk another experience here .

The service here is good and that there were a lot of seats available when I come to have my dinner. The food taste amazing and that it is delivered very quickly through the use of the train set they have. The ordering of food is done through scanning a QR code and ordering at the website. The food is prepared quickly and I had an very good time here.  Would recommend for the residents of Boon Lay to visit and try out their food. Through the food might be expensive for some people though.

Some of the menu rly tasted different from other outlets. They also missed our order and after telling them, they only delivered 2/4 missing orders. Had to let them know again.

Other than that, everything normal.

One star is for the train service. Lol. Salmon sashimi itself is like frozen thawed food, not fresh. California Roll like had a train wrecked upon arriving. Chicken Nanban had so much dough on it, the worst among other japanese restaurants in Jurong Point. Fried squid tentacles, i dont mind it was double fried but when served it is not even hot on the inside..omg.
service super average, food is also typical. do note many prices have inflated, and there’s no more free mentai sauce! go to remain the genki roll and mentaiko trio salmon, cant go wrong
Mentai Mayo Fries deserved a zero star. Do not order this unless you top up at least 2 pack more of Mentai. Almost like regular French Fries.

Used to work for Genki sushi more than 10 years ago when I was still a student, even as customer, I often patronise them as the food was great back then. Recently went down to this outlet to redeem my birthday voucher only to then know about their app maintenance. Staff said they cannot use the voucher without the app and told me to email Genki Sushi to extend the voucher deadline. Thankfully, Genki Sushi understood my circumstances and agreed to extend my voucher deadline so that I may still enjoy a birthday discount. Will continue to patronise Genki Sushi with good extending customer service.

Order came wrongly and it took more than 20 mins for my first place of sashimi to come.

The outlet still has tons of empty seats which obviously show that it's not busy at all. Things were pretty much self service. My orders only came after I informed the staff that my orders have not arrive yet.

This outlet at Jurong point have way lesser people compared to other outlets even though it's a weekend. I can see the reason now.

Food was felt substandard compared to other branches. Less crowded than other branches but staff service was bad. Wanted to use a M mall voucher and explicitly mentioned before paying at cashier but the staff said “next time must say before using” and refused to redo the transaction even though we had not paid and had mentioned clearly before she keyed in anything.

Honestly not bad if you're just coming for sushi and some other things if you aren't super hungry. It's obviously pricey compared to other foods but it's sushi and the quality of fish was okay. Salmon and salmon belly were the best quality out of what they had. Much better than sushi-go Jurong Point if you're coming for sushi. However the cooked foods here at genki was pretty lame and sushi go is probably better for that.
Nice clean place for my sushi cravings. Order food by scanning the QR code and it's fun having to see your food arrive by the conveyer train. Prices are affordable and lots of options on their menu.
You get u paid for. Skip the Chu Toro. It will ruined u for life.

Worse experience ever
Came ordered from app
Water sold out. Ask waitress for water that say reply there’s no water here. So I have to req ice a drink water from hot tap…
Order a can of coke. From the start after I finish my meal the coke just served
Sushi Rices was bad
Raw ingredients wasn’t fresh
Service was bad
Food is ok abeit small in portion.

Relatively new branch.
The food and service here better than Westgate. Enjoyed the salmon belly and unagi DMZ. The gyu don was authentic too, only missing onsen egg. Chicken teriyaki rice was also good! Husband enjoys the soba and he's usually quite picky with his food.

However, chicken namban was much smaller than sushi-go. Fish soup has alot of bones. Fried prawn and tempura are not as great. Coroquet was good.

Besides green tea, there's a variety of soft drinks and root beer! Generally good experience.

Food tastes great and the sushi is fresh. I have been to some Genki stores in Singapore where the sushi isn't fresh or cut well.
Genki sushi can be quite expensive though.
Service and food quality getting worse each time I patronised. Majority of the food super salty. Chef knife skills damn good can slice the sashimi until like paper thin.
Great sushi for all times
Very good quality sushi for affordable prices.
Really love Genki sushi. Finally… an outlet in Jurong point! If only the outlet is bigger.. the waiting time can be shorten 😀

Had a superb dinning experience at genki sushi jurong point on 9/4/22 at 6pm. We are seated at table 41. Special and worthy mentioning of two staff namely supervisor Sean and one of the staff named janeth who warm our hearts. Sean cordially asked whether my 5yr old girl need any children cutlery without me even asking. Next my elder girl dropped the softshell handroll on the booth seat as she took from the assembly train. Janeth was so attentive and promptly informed Sean. Straightaway, Supervisor Sean offered to replace a new dish which we don't expect to as it was purely our own fault. Sean even personally check on us whether the dish had been served to my girl. We are so pleased with such top-notch service rendered to us.  Really thumbs up to janeth and Sean. They are genki valuable superstars. Sincerely hope Genki recognised Janeth and Sean for such fabulous service.

The food was average, Orchard central will be a better choice.
The staffs keep wanting to clear our plates when we were still eating… they will take and throw the cutlery into their trolley. Overall a very bad experience… I won’t recommend this outlet.

On 28/5/22,i bought my parents to try genki at jurong point for the first time,i had good experience from other outlets and thought i would have the same here too but to my disappointment, it was a let down on the services,lady at the table infront of us was getting up to get her food (okonomiyaki stick) from the train which was situated at the third level, when she was taking it off,the train begins to go back, she did not manage to catch the plate and the food flew off to our table and landed onto my mum's dress.The mayo and sauce smeared all over my mum dress and they did came immediately to ask what happen ,then proceeds to just clean up.While it is not anyones fault,we thought that we could have at least gotten a sorry that this happen as my mum was visibly upset.

Even though they were swift to clean up,it was not cleaned,the bonito flakes were still on the sofa and some sauce residue, thus we left that seat empty and switch sides.The manager just explain that the kitchen will allow the train to go back when the food is unattended for a period of time.Overall not a very pleasant experience,we quickly ate and left,hope that it shall never happen to anyone as there wont be any sort of compensation or even a single apology,have to deal with it urself okay.
One of the outlets that has lots of tables for groups of 5 and above. Not like Vivocity where they only have 1 table for groups of 5 and above.

The worst genki outlet! Went to collect my takeaway orders and 3 staffs walk passed telling me to wait and I waited 10mins when for nothing as my orders are already ready on the table. Finally a waitress attend to me but she was impatient and rude! Didnt apologize and even brushed me off rudely! Supervisor was at the cashier and he saw what happened but he ignored. No wonder the rest of the staffs had poor attitude! Paid for such service really not worth it! Will never step in this outlet again!
Ordered hanjuku egg. As first , I rejected as it looked like a cooked egg. Then they served again as picture .. is this hanjuku eggs? complaining only for their hanjuku egg . Funny hanjuku egg

Got a queue number an hour and a half before.
Message notification was in accurate (it’s still okay acceptable maybe malfunction)

Upon returning to check for our queue status had already exited 2 queue number. Confronted the genki  staff Shirley. she lied in an uncouth manner saying that queue not in sequence.

However checking with another Chinese staff she claim that queue number should be in sequence since day 1 working in this outlet.

This is nonsense customer service provided by Shirley. Utterly speechless by such uncouth manner.

Hopefully genki would take this feedback into consideration. To improve on customer service relation instead of lying with eye wide open to your customer

Thank you
Slow service. waited 15 min to receive my first order. food quality is poor.
Foodies , should taste this outlet .. fresh salmon and delicios sushi varieties
GrabFood estimate isn't accurate. Took 30mins for order to be ready, not 10mins.
Okay lah ur maki is 2.80 but can charge more idm, just don't embarrass the Japanese people any further by making a maki like this. One Makis worth of tuna u split into 6 Makis.
love sushi! u should only come before peak hours as the food comes very fast and u dont rlly have to wait when u are hungry… avoid peak hours!!!
amazing service staff thums up!!!! all my food arrived timely and the chawanmushi is better than sushiro! queue is long as expected but it was all worth it
Opening hours till 10pm... But stop customers from entering at 830pm.. alrighty
Nice food and one of the outlet with fast queue turnaround.
The food here is honestly substandard compared to the other outlets I've been
Waited 30min before getting in. This is comfort food for me. I love snowcrab croquettes, and mentai ebi sushi.
Ordered takeaway ebi tempura udon and I went home without the ebi packed in. Had to make a trip back to the restaurant after I had reached home. Lapse of service!
Had a good experience here, food was served quickly and was made well. Staff are very welcoming and friendly! (:
Worst. Think twice before you even made purchases with them.
The sushi was good
The sushi is good
Absolutely slow service
Food was good!

B2 of Westgate outside Hao Mart.

Have to order ahead before seating.

Tables are cleaned with cleanser after each patron as I've seen it done.

4 stars cause they're Japanese grill but the options are limited and has kimchi on their don. Kimchi is a nice touch though.

Meat are grilled nice, not too oily which pairs well with the rice. If you're going to have this as first meal or is a big eater, you should order more.

Had pork belly and chicken thigh which were nice. Someone mentioned looks homemade in their review and I tend to agree but isn't homemade nicer and more flexible in the ingredients?

I would be there again to try others.

Delicious don with smell of barbecue. The sliced  pork has little bits of bone, so needs to be careful for small children. Online ordering is not recommended as it only accepts PayPal. Perhaps they could upgrade to accept other modes of payment for online ordering. So it’s best to order from the counter. They accept PayNow, NETS and cash at the counter.
Good food at great prices, the chicken thigh don is really nice - especially the leek. The gyudon is decent enough, but kind of tough. Their more premium beef options fare better.

We tried a few of their dons including the pork belly, beef striploin, beef steak, Saba fish and a few of their skewers. Would highly recommend their skewers and the pork bowl and give the beef a miss as it was too overcooked and difficult to chew.
Food took a while to come. Portion was quite small but food was tasty. Ordering using qr code was quite confusing. Set meal option wasn't elaborated in the website

No frills Japanese dons and grilled sticks at reasonable prices. Serving can take some time. The dons were tasty and well seasoned, but it feels a bit like Chinese cooking on Japanese ingredients. Mushrooms were well grilled, gyoza was not as crispy as expected, mackarel fish rice was a reliable bowl.

1. There is hidden cost of service charge unless you pay with PayPal.

2. Ordered the yakibuta don and they served me a raw egg (totally regretted for not taking photo of it) - would have let the matter go instead of posting on social media if not for the unprofessional response from the staff - "our egg is like that one" after I pointed that the onsen egg was totally raw as the egg white was transparent.

3. Another staff changed the egg, came back still translucent (yes, a slight improvement I would say) - this time I took photos as attached. I'm sure anyone has a better understanding of onsen egg.

4. You might seriously want to consider another Japanese stall.. They use normal rice (not Japanese rice) and the rice was lumped together (see photo).
Pork belly is nicely grilled and tasty, but a little confused why there was kimchi in Japanese bowl. Tasted a little like homemade food.

Grilled meat over charcoal.

Ordered twice on Food Panda and once in-store. Quality has always been consistent.

Favourites: Beef Ribeye, Mushroom, Pork & leeks.
Gyu don at $9, buta don at $8. Grilled squid at $7. Price and taste are okay. Portions commensurate with price. You'll still be hungry after a don if you're an adult male.
Kimchi grilled pork rice bowl was not very worth it, pork slices were tender and grilled super well with that nice char but quite few. The kimchi was also such a meagre pathetic portion.
Very satisfying meal for both me and my wife - the taste exceeds our expectations and the portion is generous. Will certainly return for more, especially to try the other items on the menu. 😋
They serve good food at affordable price and their yakitori is yummy too. Though the stall is small but at least there's standard in their food.  Went there for few times and will recommend it.
Yummy Japanese bento in Westgate. Nicely grilled meat with fragrant soya sauce. Nice and polite crew too. Recommended to give a try
Food was quite good. We had Oyagu Don and Gyudon. I wouldn’t mind coming back a second time.

This definitely hidden gem at Westgate. that serves awesome Charcoal-grilled Japanese skewers. It may not be the most prominent eatery on the level, but its modest shopfront belies the delicious food that it has to offer.
Reasonable & affordable price...

I have been curious with this stall whenever I walked past, hence decided to make a trip down for lunch.
.
Must say i am slightly disappointed, wasn't as good as i had anticipated. I mean it is decent and is affordable. Ordered the #BeefSteakDon (SGD$10.90) and #KimchiSlicedBeefDon (SGD$6.90), both include a glass of tea. In my opinion, the kimchi slice beef don is more worth it.
.
#StanzFoodHunts #Kushiya @kushiya_a #Westgate @westgatesg #JapaneseCuisine

I had beef rib eye cubed Don. Though the portion is adequate, I loved the grilled meat, not too dry or raw wet, and it was so good.It is priced reasonably well compared with other Japanese eateries in Singapore.

Chicken skewer and grilled vegetables are packed with flavours while the beef is a bit hard / dry. All has a light charcoal flavour (which I like). You may want to order side dish as the portion is a bit small. No complaint here given a really affordable price tag.

Great value for the amazing food they serve. The portions are big (there were two rows of pork in my pork belly don!) and they taste really good. Definitely a place for a nice grill meat meal.

The pork belly don and salmon don comes with kimchi and half a soft boiled egg, while the steak don comes with an onsen egg.
Great experience. Small Japanese Eatery serving generous amount of meat. Pork belly is juicy and sauce goes well with the rice. Will come back again soon!

Ordered the jumbo pork belly don $10.80. Hmm, not fantastic in terms of taste because all I taste is lightly marinated and lightly grilled pork belly. Maybe it's just me, idk.

I wouldn't say it's very authentic, a bit disappointed to say the least. On the bright side, the portion is quite huge, maybe that's the selling point.

Would still recommend, do give it a try, maybe you will appreciate it more than me.
Rice is cold and a bit hard to chew. Beef is cold also

Food court Japanese yakitori don eatery. Simple food (while  a tad lacking in authenticity) but  reckon its good enuf and suffice for a quick meal. I had the Japanese premium beef rice bowl. The beef was a tad overdone but still OK. Could have added a bit sauce while grilling as the whole rice bowl is slightly on the dry side.

This place is not so much about service. A small shop located at the basement of Westegate. Ordered the Yakibuta don. I have to say, i don't really know what that was so I ordered it. It turns out to be more chewy than I like but tasty enough. The egg is done quite alright. Presentation was almost there. Maybe dont cover my runny egg with the weed? Look like like this egg needs a hair cut. 🤷🏻‍♂️ Maybe try something else if it is your first time.

Don’t want to splurge but looking for a decent Japanese meal? Can try this quaint cafe that serves a filling and quick meal to satisfy craving. Decent price point for average food served in the basement of Westgate. Recommend to try their beef and pork belly bowls. Each meal comes with a light rice tea to cleanse the palette.

This gyuu don (on that day) surprised me! Wow! The texture of the beef well grilled and tender..
Will be back to try others food again.
Having dinner here actually not bad the food was perfectly fresh and taste good a good place for family and friend meeting place
Unpretentious japanese grill stall. With just 5 seats, waiting time could be long so avoid meals time. Ordered premium steak don. Beef is well marinated but egg could be a bit runnier. No miso soup.
Tasty juicy tender yakitori. Price below $10 comes with tea. Have to wait 15-20mins during peak hours but you can be sure every bowl is prepared with much TLC
Fresh and nicely grilles food in an affordable price. But do set your expectations of the waiting time, it will be 10-15mins. Staffs are quite friendly.

Rarely post reviews but I feel that I have to, after dining here. We had the Gyu dons and also the pork version. Meats were grilled perfectly with a hint of charcoal taste. Crispy and very lightly burnt. Poached eggs were perfect, too. Prices were very reasonable and portions considered generous. Unless you are a big eater. The only downside was the waiting time. Please expect 15 minutes or more as food is prepared freshly. We were there without a queue and had to wait 15 minutes. If you are in a rush or with low patience, this is not for you.
Set meal was not worth it. Beef steak was too dry. Egg too salty. Grilled oyster mushroom too oily. Chicken thigh ok.

Great food at a reasonable price, everything is grilled on demand so the food will be hot and enjoyable. I ordered the chicken thigh don.

I do not like the kimchi that is served with the don as it's supposed to be Japanese food - not a fan of something sour, even if its purpose is to be an appetiser.

Would not recommend the sliced beef don as it is too salty.
Ordered the kimchi sliced pork don. Pork is very dry and tough, and overly smoky. Not very palatable.
Came here for lunch and the food was great! It was very affordable. Will come back again
Reasonably priced. Ordered a beef ribeye don. The beef cubes grilled OK. Overall, it was kind of dry.
Although the food selections not much but it's enough that if you want to have a meal. Food tasted quite ordinary.

This place is mainly for their grilled food rice bowls.. The portion is adequate, though if you're hungry the portion may not be enough..so do order some side dishes to add on. Taste wise the grilled meat and vegetables taste good, with smoky taste.. There is now an expanded seating area to its left, so you can sit comfortably.. Last time we can only sit as the counter to eat..
Great Grilled Japanese food with reasonable price tag.
I can have ck don with edamame everyday

Super awesome meal I had that other day on the 22nd of June. Was serve by a young lady. Rice bowls are awesome, tried one stick of grill initially, but it was way too good. Tea was free flow, like most Singaporean free thing must take. in conclusion, food 10/10 waiting time 9/10(Not so busy day afterall), customer service, 9/10. Will definitely visit again

If you want to have something cheap and yummy, please give this store a try. Here for the 6th time and the food standard keeps improving. Although they may be quite slow with their service, it’s honestly worth the wait.

Just hope the management can look into the lack of manpower here. I always see 1 staff rushing to grill the meat, do the cashiering, clear the tables, pour the drinks for the customers...... Hope their pay is worth the amount of stress they have been through.

Pretty good grilled meat rice bowl. The egg was very well prepared, the yolk soft but not runny. The grilled meat was well grilled and seasoned.

Would definitely eat again.

The $4 add on for a vegetable skewer and a cup of roasted barley tea is a bit too pricy in my opinion. Mainly because both those add ons were pretty small. But if that's what it takes to keep the stall afloat, I guess I'll keep supporting.

Tried a premium steak set lunch, their chicken skewer, and the grilled squid. Impression for each dish is:
-Premium steak set lunch was a good amount of food for the price but the beef was on the tougher side. I wouldn't recommend this particular set to others.
-Chicken skewer was fantastic. It was juicy and had a ton of flavour. Pretty cheap too.
-Squid was fine. Nothing particularly exceptional either way.

I likely won't be back due to the number of alternative options to try, but if I did go back, I'd just order a bunch of chicken skewers.
Ordered the premium steak don and pork slices don. The meat portion is surprisingly sizeable for the price and seasoning is really good. Very value for money.

Ordered the premium steam don, beef was super dry and rare, making it tough to chew. Miso soup tasted like those instant packet soup, and the grilled vegetable was probably the most decent thing there. First and last time, not recommended.
