Disgusting food, everything is overcooked and overpriced, how can everything still taste bland with all the garnishes and ingredients.

Upsized/Jumbo set is just double portion of rice. lol!
nice and delicious food. highly recommended！good customer service！
The BBQ beef or pork are very delicious. Never miss a chance to try their meals. You will not regret for sure.

Today ate dinner at about 1840.staff did not put any sauce initially ..I asked to put ..so little..then my wife ask to add.they told her got sauce already why need to add ?sigh..so poor service.then they add..you can see from picture its a miserable amount.conpared to before it's like super budget.then I ask 3rd time but they want to charge me 80 cents.think the service level is really poor and why suddenly so stingy over sauce ???
Good portion for kids. We come to the Japanese dining hall very often, each of them is delicious!

Excellent yakitori, the food is straightforward such as pork belly, chicken, chicken cheese balls on sticks but unlike most stalls selling such food it is dipped in sticky BBQ sauce. Good value, basically the same as Old Chang Kee but I find Wadori is better. Does value meals or you can just order whatever you like.

I would like to complain about how bad of a service the cashier is, rudely asking for orders and it was my first time ordering and not only that the person uses the same gloves to take food and cash and I find it very unsanitary. I hope this can change, I really love the food.

Nice japanese food street having lot variety of food, ample space to seat dining in.
Suitable for family and friends.

Great  1st time there. Food quality is good, plenty of sitting, orders can be made via QR code of ordering machine located in store. However price a little high. Almost comparison with the Japanese restaurants. Thought it should be slightly cheaper considering it being food court concept. Nevertheless, it was a pleasant lunch.
A nice japanese food street with stalls and also various japanese restaurants.  Good options if u like japanese stuff. sushi ramen yaktori etc.
Always buy but quite ex. Even add more sauce ask for 80c. Haha

This is newly opened in Jurong Point basement with many japanese food stores. I have tried the fried rice with char siew and ramen with char siew. Both dishes are taste good and especially the ramen soup is very thick as serving from restaurant quality.
Tasty but not the place to go to if you're looking for grilled

The Japanese food street concept is really great where you can enjoy quality Japanese food in a food court style as well as pick a restaurant of your preference to find more in elegance. The good is not all authentic, but the standard is close enough to the genuine ones in Orchard. The price points are around SGD10 for a set meal for an individual.
Not bad, but the menu of ordering machine a bit complicated, not so easy to handle especially for those elderly

Not my 1st unhappy experience..... I dun blame the staff coz I got the same answer thrice. Among so many Japanese bento brand, tis is the only one very stingy with sauce.

At Wadori, each time I asked for more sauce, staff sure say "it's gonna be very salty ya". The initial driżżle of sauce is so insignificant, how salty can it be? (I'm not exaggerating, it's really miserable)

Then they will highlight "additional sauce will cost additional 70cents".
70cents for another miserable drizzle of sauce?

I hope u can improve on tis, dun make ur staff say the same sentences again, do something abt the sauce. If not, u can consider giving way to other brands.

p.s. tdy's rice is mushy, not the usual Japanese rice standard.

Nice place for a quick snack but also pairs great with the Ramen shop opposite it! They have an agreement where they lease part of the shop's seating to the Ramen store so you can enjoy the best of both worlds! The sweet teriyaki sauce complements the salty Ramen very well.
Service sucks given by a guy I say more than 3 times combo A keep asking if ur staff having a bad day don't vent it to the customer showing one type of face
There were many options available. My personal favourite was the bbq.

The newly revamped Japanese food hall has many new and enjoyable choices, from Ramen to Gohan. The Saba Shioyaki Set ($11.90) and Beef Rice Set ($14.90) from My Gohan were both good and the furnishings were refreshing.
Reasonable price for food here.. great experience
poor service , auntie seemed reluctant to serve and showed black face
Enjoy my lunch here.
1st visit to Go Sushi at JP.. Sushi taste OK but the sushi not packed firmly, easily disintegrate when picking up with chopstick.. Unique way to serve food fast and fuss-free via shin train..

Like the jab foodcourt style and the food is good :)

Student price at $5.90 is affordable too for students. Else is slightly costly for a meal with no veg
One of the best, pssss Google asked for second review?
Nice food but watch out, sometimes the fried chicken a bit raw inside.
Have not visited this restaurant after my last visit
Went to pack at Yakitori, Didn’t notice my tamagoyaki is missing a few cube from the stick until I reached home. Feeling sad right now.
Great food at affordable prices. Requires qr code scanner to view menu for most places
Terrible staff at Wadori, either not focusing and letting others cut my queue, or not telling me something from my set has run out. Gave 2 chances, both failed.

Only tried the yakitori stall, ok food

Will try other stalls in future

Overall, nothing much changed for ambience, except the name and maybe, owners?

More additions for other shops along the street ba...
Restaurant quality Japanese food at food court prices. Great value for money. Great quality of food. You can take the quality of the ingredients.
Amazing food selection with the upgraded choice of japanese canned drinks
So so only. I was expecting bigger portion and better taste, turn out just okok only.

Although limited variety but it serves its purpose as a Japanese Food court.
What I like best is you can just scan the QR code on each table to access to each stall to order.
You only need to leave the table when food is ready.👍👍👍

I took away a set from My Gohan @ Jurong Point Mall today. Only when I arrived home I realized that not all dishes we ordered and paid were given to us. Be careful and check your order if you want to buy food from here.
My go-to place to satisfy all my cravings for Japanese cuisine! I like how I could conveniently make my order by scanning the QR code printed on the table also there's also free Wi-Fi provided.
Delicious food and there is free wifi. Has a variety of food. Highly recommended to eat here.

Not as good as I thought.  Hate the pasta !  Took two mouth and I gave up. Very oily for tomatoes pasta !

Ramen, sushi and sashimi were good. Forget about hokkaido buffet.
The rice is too hard and sticky! Not sure if it's overcook or undercook! Paid near $20 dollars get disastrous food. Please take note of the QC~

Apart from the sincerity of a few service staff like Catherine, there’s nothing to laude about this place. Had a terrible dining experience at the place today. Stall - Wadori kept getting my order wrong and I had to wait 30 min for raw pork with asparagus. Had to keep getting up to get orders from multiple stall and lunch was cleared while getting another order when I’m not done with it. Apart from Catherine who was helpful in rectifying the situation, the others merely stood by. Food quality is really so-so, coupled with this kind of service - there’s really no joy dining here.
It is a very characteristic street. A lot of stores. And some good restaurants. There are also some ninjas sneaking on your heads. And it is always crowded.
Meat is good but rice was overcooked. I always order the bird eggs to mix with pork meat Bcos it's sooooo good hehe

really a good place to chill ... feels like being in Japan
the food is excellent and fresh
MUST TRY
Nice place with nice Japanese foods
Reasonably priced bentos
Dropped my egg on the tray. Didn’t apologise and PUT IT BACK INTO MY BOWL OF RICE.
Food nice
Japanese food court concept. Fuss free japanese food.
It's so salty that I need to clean away the sauce before eating. I even ordered an extra sauce..... haizzzz

All sorts of Japanese food in one area! The Sushi Go train is fun! Have your sushi delivered via a mini train rather than on the usual conveyer belt. There's also ramen, yakitori, bakery, dessert, just to name a few. Bring your $ and empty tummy.

Tomato ramen is a must try.
Personally think the Tonkatsu ramen is good. No need travel to get your ramen fix.
Prefer the shio one as I like ramen salty.

The pizza shop is also good.

Nice place. Set menu are worth it. Meat quality is top notch! Smoke free BBQ. Won’t let you leave smelling like a bbq grill. Meat is juicy and tender after grilling. Top with rice and let the fats drip into the rice. Set comes with choice of salad or kimchi. Drinks are not included. Soup is included in set. Economical pricing. Choose from basic set menu or premium set menu for better quality meat. No bookings. Walk in only and expect queue during peak hours. Definitely 1 of my favourites now!

Great concept of bringing affordable yakiniku to the masses. Menu can come across as beef heavy although lamb, chicken, and seafood options are available. Wagyu is available. Ingredients are fresh but portion is small. Grilling is diy and smoke control is pretty good. Service crews were attentive.

Nice and fresh meat. Great beef, Good cut and well marinated. Good BBQ system with no smoke and no smell. Great portion also for that price. The mushrooms also very nice. price is slightly at the high side S$17 per person. Very clean restaurant. If group dine in, they won't allow incomplete group to enter into all has arrived. Clean restaurant. Was half full during a weekday evening 6pm.

Food is quite good but service and ordering system can be improved. Service staff spilled raw food residue on the order receipt, no apologies. Ordering System faulty, have informed service staff and shown staff the error on the screen. Troubled him to check on order but he misinterpreted us. Later, double portion food was served and we quickly informed service staff but was faced with dispute, he called manager and said we ordered wrongly in our face. There was no apologies from either the manager or the staff, and it seems that we are the ones at fault. The food was untouched and they brought it back to the kitchen.  When we ordered food the third time through the system. Still faulty (no stock for 1 item, but the other have stock). Food never came this time. We didn’t bother about it as whole dining experiences was ruined.

Over hype is what I think after the meal
I had always seen long Q at PLQ, etc...
So during an off peak time, when I walk pass this branch at JP, I walked it. Ordered the set meal. short rib beef.
If you are not too hungry, this set meal will suit you. Everything front he meat portion (100g), rice, side dish is small. Note, meat shrinks when grilled.
Generally, you get a simple Japanese meal without smelling badly like BBQ after the visit.
Note, the condiment, garlic chili hits a different note..rather spicy.

Very decent Japanese BBQ chain!

As it’s name suggests, they do have a dine-in limit of 50 minutes per table, which actually is more than sufficient, given that the meals here are individually prepared, and are cooked within minutes.

Prices are rather affordable, but could add up really fast once you start ordering the ala carte dishes (100g of chicken at $3.90, super worth it!)

Will definitely return, given the quality and price! 👍🏻
Chicken, karubi are nice. First try on tongue, it's okay. Got more varieties compared to other yakiniku competitors. This is under ichiban sushi group.

Decided to try Yakiniku-Go after trying their another competitor (hey yakiniku). The experience is quite similar except that it's slightly more pricier and the quality & taste of their meats are not as good. Overall an average experience.
Ordered the Signature Yakiniku-GO Set full steak with 3 types of cuts and Wagyu beef set.  The only complaint is they limit to 50 minutes for the dining-in.
Located at B1 near the end of the Japanese Street food section. Waiting time not too bad if before or after the peak hours. Just wish they had free flow cold green tea
Flameless technology and its smokeless! Rest assured that you won’t smelt badly for a meal of bbq. Meat cut is good!

Today is 3rd May, 2022. We have tried this restaurant many times since we live in the condo upstairs Jurong Point. the food is ok, but the staff's attitude is not acceptable.
We were standing at the queuing line, a Staff called Catherine, walking towards us without saying anything and didn't even look at us. She stand at the welcoming counter and doing something at the counter, just half a meter away from us, very close, trying to ignore our "hi", "hello" and many louder sentences because we wanted to get her attention, we even waved our hands a lot.
We could not believe this bad behavior from a staff of such a well-known restaurant.
We would like to highlight the female staff- Catherine to be trained properly, otherwise we will escalate to the management or will never return to this restaurant again!!!

Very bad dining experience, the middle age waitress has an unbelievably bad attitude, the set menu omits soup, and no plate was given, there is even a handprint with sauce on the rice bowl, very disgusting!  Some of the meat is cut into very small pieces even leaked out of the grid and burned the grid to black, when we asked to change the grid the waitress was very impatient and directly told us meal time out and we should go, OMG we had just been seated for less than 40 minutes,  Half of the order didn’t finish and she wanted to kick us out just because we asked her to change the grid! So ridiculous! How did someone with such an attitude become a waiter? Will never go back to this restaurant again!

The beef is not very good quality, the taw karubi is like pink color and taste like pork, comes in many small crumbs and pieces, the sauce also cannot choose your own, price is a bit high as well, however the mini salad tastes better than competitor’s. Overall it is not tasty and the meat quality is not up to expectations, I’d rather go to the other brand in Clementi mall.

Very affordable yakiniku! Service is good and they have a mobile queuing system so you don't have to wait in line.

Downside is there's some cold spots on the electric grill.
A few plates of meat for 2 pax, $90 and not even filling. Honestly just go for some random bbq buffet also more worth it
enjoyed every single bit of it. it has been a few days yet i’m still drooling over the photos we took lmao

Horrible service as there's no courtesy practice in this restaurant. They treated customer like a flog of hungry animals and reminded us that we are only given 50mins to finish up everything.

Especially a server named, Catherine, super rude!1

Not recommended for big group especially you have to seat few tables apart.
Quick meat you can grill yourself with 2 sauces

MUST TRY! Have been visiting their outlets a couple of times since my first visit. Affordable selection of meats which might I add weren’t of bad quality. Pretty consistent as well! Would recommend the Karubi for a affordable and enjoyable meal.

The meat was marinated perfectly with the sauce and easily to be cooked.
I do not like to eat beef but their beef is tender and tasted nicely with the lime sauce.
Worth a try and definitely will come back again.

It opened.
Nice queueing system.
Food were great for the price.
50 min Time limit dining.
Best value set meal
Tried the A5 Wagyu n double karubi. I prefer the karubi set for its value. Jyo karubi especially

A replicate version of another popular yakiniku in Singapore. The service is great, prompt and friendly enough.

However comparing the price, this is slightly cheaper than its competitor. The main difference is the quality of the meat, seems subpar and lack of taste (more rubbery and bland) the other components such a salad and condiments is a no go.

For its price at affordable level but could be better, if you’re gonna queue 2-3 hours for this then don’t bother.
Love it here, came more than 10x. However today, this staff called Catherine has a really horrible attitude & was too lazy to redeem our points for us. Anyway, hating on her, not the food.
didnt take much photos. but it was really value for the quality of meat.
Staff totally and intentionally ignored customers despite us keeping saying hello to get her attention to get seats. Staff name is Catherine.
Have ordered their Karubi Set upsized. Meat was good. won’t have the bbq stained smell after eating. also good place for solo people. Price :$$
Lousy service as in i order a set and there is no rice... have to talk to 2 staffs then the rice came. Order wagyu not bad but the meat is too thin slice.... not really worth to go.
Good service! Price is slightly higher as compared to other Yakiniku Restaurant but still affordable and worth it.
When it first open at seletar mall, I was hoping it will open on JP. After one year, they finally did. Love the food there. Staff Are friendly too on my 3 visits...
Very bad service experience. Why should we eat at a place and feeling annoyed but the unpleasant staffs.

Value for money.
Food is fresh and affordable
Suitable for small group or even 1 person
Clean and comfortable to dine here.  Extremely friendly and efficient staff.
Portion size abit small but is delicious

(Translated by Google) ! ! ! Go eat! I think it tastes great! The set meal is cost-effective, and I ordered the wagyu beef, the meat is delicate and juicy, and the taste is delicious! The sauce tastes great and the tea is refreshing. Scan the QR code to order, it's worth a try~

(Original)
！！！去吃！我觉得味道很好！套餐划算，又额外点了和牛，肉细腻多汁，味道香美！酱汁味道很棒，茶很清新。扫码点餐，值得一试～

(Translated by Google) Korean self-service barbecue restaurant
cost-effective
The taste is average, suitable for a family to eat with children, you can do the barbecue yourself, and you are not afraid of injury, the environment is very safe
Only beef, chicken, seafood, no pork provided
Meal time seems to be 45-50 minutes

(Original)
韓式自助烤肉店
性價比可以
味道一般，適合一家人帶著小朋友去吃，可以自己動手去烤肉，又不怕受傷，環境挺安全
只有牛、雞、海鮮，沒有豬肉提供
用餐時間好似是45-50分鐘

Had dinner there with family.
My 1st attempt on Japanese food. The taste was not bad at all. My other family members seemed to enjoy the food there.
The food served was fast.
The staffs were friendly. We were initiated to transfer to a more cosy corner for our family feast.
Indeed felt like in a Japanese restaurant atmosphere there due to the interior deco.

Tried their Smoked Duck Ramen & Garlic Ramen, and I took the Garlic Ramen. For someone who prefers a stronger taste, this garlic is on the lite spectrum.

Overall, the soup base is still tasty. One thing to note is that the service crew here is friendly and provide prompt service. This is also a halal restaurant that’s suitable for our Muslim community.

First and last time to be here! We order sashimi, beef ramen, chicken ramen, and abalone
The good thing was the salmon and eggs only, the rest was terrible! Cost me $60 incld tax and service charge. The soup was bland, overall not the taste i was hoping to be at-least-good enough. I rather go L2 to eat china beef noodle, than this one. Very disappointed

@ichikokudosg LOOKS promising.

They have quite extensive menu and are halal certified therefore their broth are simmered with chicken bone instead. Here their ramen noodle is using hokkaido wheat flour which menu stated thin noodle for most of their ramen except the spicy version.

Moving on to what we have.
Ichikokudo Ramen Original. Is Shoyu Ramen which we feel it taste just plain SALTY 😆. I personally didn't like the egg as well. Doesn't have the molten centered yolk.

Tomato Ramen with Cheese, felt the broth is too thick and overwhelming upon first spoon. Like thickened tomato sauce / tomato puree with some fresh diced tomatoes while it does have that tanginess BUT couldn’t detect any cheese at all and everything just taste VERY SALTY and jelat. Unfortunately, we had to surrender the entire bowl.

Guess we just can't appreciate shoyu base ramen and chicken broth. 😝

Ig: @zoey_belle_

Well firstly, this is Halal Ramen broth for those who came here thinking it's pork  tonkotsu broth. So great to eat with Muslim friends!

Portion and price point wise is pretty okay. Its the flavours that feels abit off. The miso Ramen was really thick and salty. Abit hard to drink the soup it's more like a gravy. I rate: 2/5 🌟

Veggie Ramen had a huge portion of noodles and veggie so pretty full and light flavours. I rate: 3/5 🌟

Condiments really helped to give more flavours in the Ramen as per ur liking.

store serves 2 types of Japanese staples,ramen and donburi.ramen Is based on  hokkaido style and there is a large variety to choose from.personal recommendation wld be their Donburi as it is quite filling and delicious.prices start from 12 dollars for a main and the set meal includes a fruit and either kaarage or gyzo.drinks are separate.all In all expect to pay abt 20 sgd++ per head.

Probably a poor choice to come to a ramen place for salmon don

The salmon was fresh . Just a little weirded out by the warm rice that warmed my salmon . Everything was warm by the time it reached me . Warm raw fish isn't my thing .
Portions not the type to leave you satisfied . Felt like I was rationing myself during the meal . The fish looks so sparse on the rice like my hair on my head .
The gyoza, an offhand top up was probably the highlight of the meal .

If I ever returned,  it probably would be for ramen and not this , assuming I do . The only draw seems to be a place you bring friends if it needs to be halal .

Everything came to around $26 I feel I paid more for the deco than for my food
It's the kind of experience I'll say leaves you feeling shortchanged.
If I have to say it , 3 stars are entirely because of the deco and staff

Wasn’t crowded during the dinner period.
Decent ramen with generous portion.
The Karaage was too salty.. but quite tasty if you brush the sauce aside. Tomato cheese ramen is surprisingly pleasant. However, the beef ramen wasn’t that good and it had the very strong beefy smell 😅

My honest review was deleted. Went here to have dinner with my family. Last visit was bad. Returned after 1 year hoping that they imlroved. It was the weekend but totally empty. Shows that the bad quality remains. Food is super salty. Service is so-so. No service staff on the floor. All hiding inside.

Out of all the halal ramen, this so far is pretty close, especially the beef sukiyaki! Soy sauce flavour and decent amount of fat♡ the soup, noodles and toppings were good and the egg was marinated well in the soy, albeit the yolk was not runny. Still delicious nonetheless.

Their breakfast porridge was alright, tasted like a oyakodon porridge. Char siew beef ramen was alright, and their beef donburi was generous! And their matcha was really good!! Thick and full of matcha flavour and you can feel the powder. The ice cream was also great. Matcha pudding was very bitter by itself but paired with its brown sugar sauce was delicious. The only thing that was subpar that I ate was the salmon sashimi. But I'd definitely return for their ramen♡♡♡

The service was really friendly and quick and helpful! Atmosphere was really nice aswell.
Googled ramen shops and decided to go this ramen shop. I had Hokkaido butter ramen set. This set comes with Gyoza and Watermelon. Gyoza was not so nice but the ramen was enough to satisfy me.
Great service, nice place for ramen and dons. Filling and tasty food enjoyed the smoked duck ramen and the dons, quite generous with the ingredients.

Not my first time dining at Ichikokudo, but the first time at Jurong Point outlet, so congrats on the opening! I had my favorite lite shoyu ramen and it was savoury, rich, and mildly sweet too, just like how I've always liked it to be. The garlic chicken karaage and sauce was delicious. Fried ebi was a little overcooked in my opinion. Nevertheless, my friend and I had a great dining experience. Very satisfied! :) Will come again to try the other flavours!

The food, service and menu design feels very authentic and Hokkaido. Portions of food are rich and fulfilling. Customer service was prompt and polite.

A nice halal touch to traditional Japanese food. I will certainly be back again!

New ramen shop, an additional option especially for the Malay friends, cos it’s Halal certified. Clean, nice setting. Taste of Ramen is flavourful, though it’s a bit salty for the regular. One can opt for the clear option if you prefer something more bland. Tasty in general, though the onsen egg is a bit overcooked and being halal, it’s chicken instead of pork.

Price is reasonable and a place I’ll come again, with my Malay friends along.

Went on boxing day Saturday evening just before 7pm and had to queue about 10 minutes.

Ordering is online via QR code and quite straight forward.

Waited for almost 20 minutes for our food which I think is a little long for ramen

I had the chicken based Ichikokudo Ramen (Extra Rich). Noodle texture was the best aspect of the ramen; stock was over salty and overpowered any chicken flavor. The chicken meat was not tender and stuck to the teeth. The egg was very ordinary.

My wife had the Hokkai Ramen Gifts from the Sea - Regular. The seafood was average at best. The stock way too salty even for someone like myself who likes salty food. At least the seafood stock wasn't too overpowered by the salt.

The iced green tea at $1.90 is a rip off. More like iced water with no green tea taste at all.

Overall 2 star rating for food and service staff.

Our usual Sat dinner at Jurong point, decide to try the new ramen restaurant since there is no queue. I know that I should order the ramen but was craving for rice so end up ordering a unagi toji don and it did not disappoint. Rice was soft and savoury, together with the well cooked unagi, it was pretty delicious. She got the limited lobster ramen and it came with a plastic glove, napkin, crab scissor and a wet wipe! Attention to details is amazing and the broth did not disappoint. Initially think that it could too thick but it wasn't, it was easy to drink and has a good punch of seafood taste. Noodle was good and lobster was not overcooked.

Rating: 8/10
I am coming back to try the remaining ramen!
Do come and try!

#ichikokudo #ichikokudosg #ramen #lobster #unagi #don #rice #jurongpoint #sg #simonreview #foodreview #simonlew #food
Quite upset as the taste was not as expected ,the soup was salty and the cabbage was not fresh, even rotten.

Order:
- 121 and matcha latte
Taste:
- Pretty decent Japanese ramen, nothing too special, onsen egg is a bit over cooked ; matcha latte is rich in flavor and possibly pretty authentic
Environment:
- Quite some flies around, probably the common issue in JP B1 restaurants; compared to other restaurants it’s pretty empty
Service:
- Fast service, tho the staff almost dropped my ramen soup without realizing it.
Price:
- Affordable, in the cheap range for ramens.
Location:
- Easy to find.

First time here. We had the tomato & the original. It was ok. Tomato broth was pleasantly fragrantly, but the taste was on the stronger side. If you prefer something lighter, the Original is better. For me, nothing in particular yearns me to return. Gyoza was a tad too oily for my liking.

My first and last. The food not tasty at all. Unagi Don I ate are most terrible ever. I knew Unagi is full of bone, but this :( My cousin order the Sapporo Miso Ramen but the soup not like Miso is taste like butter soup.

This is my first time trying and it was totally horrible! Soup was salty and it just tasted awful even though I'm a fan of tomato soup. The vegetables and noodles were sticked together in the bowl like it was not well cooked and it was not warm. The wait was long even just for a bowl with no crowds and no napkins were served. Too bad I had to give 1 star to post if not I wouldn't give any star sorry to say.
Please don't try this dish 🙏🙏

Not sure why the divided reviews, but the noodles (at least my bowl of) tasted no different to the ones at urban malls. The chicken broth with hint of saba essence is fresh but no lack of punch, I especially like the addition of seaweeds that bring complexity to the soup. After 2/3 to finishing line, ask for a plate of fried garlic slices to bring the taste to next level!
The outlet provides average fare at reasonable prices.
Abit different from the usual ramen broth since this is halal. Overall not bad experience but not my cup of tea. Ambience is good. Try out for novelty.

I used to enjoy this place very much and came for ramen for many times, but the latest visit really let me down. I ordered set lunch for the first time and it turned out to be a terrible decision: The soup is lukewarm, noodles are soggy, and the chicken char siew is half fat. As a result I was only able to finish less than half noodles and the rest are wasted. I won't go to this place again, so disappointed that the standard dropped trmendously. 1 star is given for the quick service btw.

Came on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded. Food and drinks came across as rather mild compared to other restaurants but it tasted healthier too, so I'm quite okay with that. Price is affordable as well. Would come back again to try the ramen.

The ramen taste is not bad for chicken based broth. Ordered the Ichikokudo extra rich Ramen and it came with shredded fish and chicken chasu. Ordered big fry ebi don too but it was disappointing. The rice came in big clumps and is super wet and sticky. Ebi fry is not crispy at all and super soft, like mochi texture. The egg contained prawns as well, too much for my preference but seafood lovers might like it? Gyoza skin is slightly thick and made using chicken as well, no dipping sauce was provided. The set comes with fruits not drinks so drinks have to be order d separately but green tea is refillable. Overall would not order the don again unless improvement is made to the rice and ebi fry. This place is Halal as well so an additional option for halal friends to dine at.

Food is horrible especially for its price.Unagi don tasted so horrible and ramen was just salt.Never come to this place.Not a picky eater at all and will always finish food even if it’s bad but I just can’t finish it here.Goes to show how horrible the food is.Service was friendly and prompt.

The Mini karanegi chashu Don is extremely salty, feedback to the crew however claim it’s normal. That’s ridiculous! Seem like not listening to my feedback seriously. I will just accept the outcome and blacklist the restaurant. Everyone out there if u lack of salt or low blood pressure u can opt for it.
Great tasting ramen. Quality of the soup and noodles are made to excellent.

hello Ichikokudo, I ordered the Ichi beef ramen as shown in the picture. It looks nowhere like the clear broth in the picture. The marinated egg was also missing, had to ask for it. Is this a case of false advertising or misrepresentation?

Food is good, just not what I ordered.

Opening on 4th Dec 2020,
One of the best Halal Hokkaido Ramen in town. Try it if you haven’t.
A very different chicken broth ramen at this halal ramen restaurant. Thought the flavour is rich, it is distinctly different in taste compared to your typical ramen.

Hi Ichikokudo! Here's my review (Food, Service & Ambience) for my dining experience today:

Food:
Ordered the limited edition Ichi-Mazesoba for a more adventurous palate. Usually would just go for the classic ichikokudo ramen but i wanted to try something different. Totally worth the experience! I loved how the sweetness from the sauce and the tanginess from the vinegar comes together. There is also a variety of texture from the crispy bits and diced onion. Really felt like a party going on in my mouth and it's really worth the try! The best part was the onsen egg, my favourite! It binds all the different elements together and combining it into one. Definitely will be back for this before it runs out!

Service:
The staffs there were really an amazing bunch! Came during the evening time and i will usually expect them to be drained but was otherwise. Welcomed me with great energy, greeted and assisted me generously and politely.

Ambience:
I was seated somewhere near the kitchen and it was nice to hear some chill music playing along. They were pretty soft... which is a bummer because i don't like silent meals but it was nice seeing the people there enjoy their working environment. I must say that most places i've been to, service crews will be just stuck one corner and watching customers as they come and go but for ichikokudo jurong point, the store itself felt alive with the vibrant energy from the staffs. It's pretty calming and enjoyable seeing them love doing what they do and still serve us greatly. It makes my experience here indeed more pleasant!

Overall, i'll be back for the yummy mazesoba and the lively atmosphere there :)

Quite disappointing on the taste... Original supposed to be thicker in the broth than clear I supposed, however it was bland... The 'clear' version should be blah...  Ramen was softer than I expected...
The 101 noodle is fine. Other is not as expected. The tea is terrible the cup is not for the hot tea.
Ramen broth is a little too salty. Waitress told me in future could let them know.

Today we eat the original ramen together with my husband at Jurong outlook, taste so wonderful. I finished till last drop of soup . Can say is the best ramen I have ever had so far. Love the bamboo shoots plus the slice mushroom, the combination is just too excellent, I can't have enough of it. Will come back again next week
Extremely disappointed,  the taste was an absolutely amateur boring nothing special,  will never come to this restaurant ever again , wasted my money!
This is second times I went there having dinner with my family members. Foods are nice n delicious. Staffs very polite n good service.

1. Noodles soup not hot at all.
2. Butter clams, not even hot enough to melt the butter cube.
The broth wasn't tasty and the clams were tasteless. The staff was dancing around with the songs blasting didn't give me a good dining experience.

Decent halal-certified Ichikokudo Ramen with flavourful broth and egg. Broth reminds me of tsukumen. The namban chicken sides was good. Refillable green tea. Not much crowds on weekday lunch.

If u like garlic, the garlic chicken gives the kick along with cloves of cooked garlics.
Nice foods.
Great Food. Appetising. Great setting.

Ordered ichi-ramen (original) with kaarage (set) and hokkai clam ramen. The soup base felt bland and was not hot. There was an alkaline taste with the noodles. The other ingredients, e.g. bamboo shoots, black fungus, felt cold too. The "onsen" egg was a huge disappointment. $4.50 for the add-on Kaarage set was also disappointing as the portion was very small (~abt 3 small pieces).

Hard to get attention of servers to re-fill the iced and hot green tea. The iced green tea was also like room temperature.

Through the dinner, there was also a pestering fly (we were seated at the booth seat area). This was also highlighted in other reviewers' comments.

Felt over-priced for the food and service quality.

-2 stars for the poor food experience.
-1 star for the lacking service.
-1 star for the pestering fly, which we couldn't wait to end the dinner and leave asap.

Definitely will not return.

PS: This might be an one-off incident, and maybe other food options on the menu could be better. Saw some customers ordered donburi dishes and they looked not bad.

Went to Jurong Point's outlet on a Sunday. Was my 1st time and probably the last. My family of 6 were not let in to the restaurant when there's clearly an unoccupied table for 6 there. Had to talk to the worker and reason with him as to why he couldn't let us sit at that table. His reason being that table is too close to other tables (safety distancing measures) but all other occupied tables with customers seated are close to each other too. It made no sense and the worker finally let us sit there only when we said that we would like to speak to the manager about this matter. Upon sitting at the table, we were not given the menu after a good 5 minutes and had to approach the waiter to be given the menu. The waiter told us that the order is to be done via scanning a QR code but the QR code slip was not given to us. We were cluelessly finding the QR inside the menu when it was actually a printed QR code slip which is supposed to be given by the waiter. So we had to ask for the menu and also the QR code to be given to us. The food arrived fast but the soup tasted bland. Even the soup with the "richest" taste option selected tasted bland. The soup was barely warm too, not hot like a soup that is freshly cooked. The only thing that was nice were the onsen eggs.  Basically an unpleasant experience going there.

I liked the flavorful curry ramen, which has a really big portion that can feed 2 if you order one more side dish (if you are not a big eater). Gyoza has quite flavourful fillings and a just nice charred aroma. Service was quick and friendly and there was no big weekday lunch crowd. One star deducted for the fly that keeps disturbing me during my meal though, which is generally an issue for all the open air restaurants in JP basement.

I gave a 2star only because the sides of the Hokkai Seafood BBQ tasted off/sour.. (like those u will find in example: mixed veg rice the vegetables left for quite awhile it starts to go bad). The Ramen was good though.. Hope the team will conduct regular checks during their off peak..

Hi Sir/Mdm,

My visit was at 07/04/21 17:27 and table 56.

I just want to feedback for you and your team to take note as other customers might not be that understanding or forgiving.

Your food is good, don't let the good name be pulled down by these small areas..

Place is not the most convenient in Singapore but the restaurant is rather quiet, good for people who want a quieter environment. Servers are friendly and helpful. Ordered chicken quesadilla, beef fajita and braised beef cheeks. Portions are above average sized. Beef cheeks were soft and flavorful. Quesadilla was not overly cheesy. Fajita was average. Guacamole texture and consistency could be better.
The lunchtime 3-course meal is nice and affordable. The meats are on the more expensive side, but the main dishes are pretty good and fairly priced. The atmosphere was very relaxing and chill.

This place is located inside NTU. It has a good ambience and suits both small groups and couples who look for a good dinner date.

The menu has quite a bit of options - a decent number for vegetarian. The set I ordered had a starter, main course and dessert.

I chose mushroom soup (also has interesting option like samosas) , vegetarian pasta. The dessert is quite standard- choco lava cake with ice cream. It comes about 18.8 S$.

Don’t miss this place if you are in NTU.

Ambience is good.
A bit on the expensive side.
Food is well presented but nothing fantastic.
Service - nothing much to talk about.

Terrible experience. Called to reserve, told us to walk in. Walked in, said tables are booked. Waited for table, then began painful check in experience. Food was subpar, only good thing was the view. Bread was about a week old (see photo). Charge for water, menu online prices have all been raised in restaurant. Avoidable.
really nice ambience and quick service, plus the food was honestly pretty good! i really liked the peach lemonade too~

Do yourselves a favour and avoid the steak!

Great ambience, professional and friendly service crew, overall a fantastic respite within NTU. However, the food items were hit-or-miss. The salmon was fantastic, but the steak was... let’s just say, even a hawker stall could deliver better. Fries were tasty...pork fajita was alright, nothing really remarkable...

I’d give it a positive review only because on both occasions I patronised, I hadn’t paid the full price: first time was with an eatigo 50% discount, the next was for their $14 set lunch. Without these discounts, I’d feel disappointingly shortchanged, given the quality of the food - certainly does not command the à la carte prices, in my opinion.

It has the potential to become a five-star establishment, as long as the consistency of the food quality improves. Everything else (service, ambience) is already in place for an excellent dining experience.

We booked the private area dining to host guests on Tuesday. The halal set meal came more than an hour late. The restaurant was not apologetic and did not inform us at all until we checked with the kitchen. We booked the private area dining for Thursday but we wanted to postpone it one day before due to medical concerns. The restaurant did not allow postponement, did not propose alternative solution and was not willing to negotiate at all about the whole situation. There was completely no flexibility and no compassion. We were told that we will be charged regardless and the food will be served. Fine. We went for the lunch and are now eating in the restaurant. There is a fly in my glass as I am writing this review now.
Very good ambience. Pricey but worth the experience. Closes early else it'll be even better.

Came here for a nice, quiet dinner on a Tuesday evening during school term. A quiet respite that lifts you away from the hustle and bustle of university life. Food was great - ordered the tender beef cheeks cooked to perfection and the crabmeat pasta fully infused with the flavour of crab. Menu is on the pricier side ($18-$30 for mains) excl. service charge and GST but the quality of food is great. Would definitely visit again!

Super expensive place to eat! Peri peri chicken main portion was so so small! Taste nothing to race about. Salmon main was okay. The chicken tikka pizza was good though. Ice lemon tea drinks were so diluted. No lemon taste at all.

This place is located at the heart of NTU in Northspine! (Near the KFC). I was decently surprised by the ambience! It was cosy and comforting.

I ordered the beef cheeks, pork loin fajita, wagyu burger and lava cake.

The Wagyu burger was disappointing. It cost a whopping 18 dollars! However, the patty was really bland. There was no seasoning at all. I had to add my own pepper and salt to the patty to make it tasty. The onions were raw and not grilled. However, I have to say that the fries were good! ($18)

Next, the beef cheeks were soft and tender to the bone. Sauce was decent and mash potato is creamy! However, there's not enough sauce to pair with the mash potato as it was paired with the beef cheeks. (Preferred the fries). They could have been more generous with the salad portion. Overall a bit too pricey for this dish. ($22)

Lastly, the pork loin fajita was surprisingly good!! Pork was cooked and seasoned well! It was paired with onions which was good as well! The combination with the wrap and the pork was really delicious. It even came with a side of sour cream and guacamole! Overall a really really good dish that I recommend :)) It was the cheapest out of the 3 main dish. ($16)

When dessert came, I was pleasantly surprised on the presentation of the dish. The lava cake came off a bit sweet but paired really well with the vanilla ice cream. (Although they probably used a cheap ice cream brand) A great way to end the meal :) ($6)

Overall, dish place is a must try if you have the money as it comes off a little pricey. Would recommend if you are finding a place to splurge. Till we meet again, au revoir!
I loved the food, service and staff! Great selection of food. Wonderful atmosphere and ambience. 10/10 would come again. Ps wear a jacket, it’s cold!
Great place to have a drink if you're on NTU's campus.

This place gets 5 stars as it is the only good joint that accepts reservations at NTU...

Pretty decent selection of food and drinks. Service can always be better.

The waygu burger is nice. Thick juicy Patty on buttery bun
Fajitas is nice too. Lots of meat. Yum.
Molten lava lorte is a must have.
Apple crumble ok ok

New branding, new menu.
Grats on re opening.
Had 3 course set lunch 14 SGD nett. Most affordable from the menu already.
Mushroom soup🥰 - creamy, heavy yet watery, truffle oil can't taste. Garlic butter bread was nice too.
Beef strip loin🙂 - Doneness medium rare but come out medium. Lightly seasoned. Tasted okay. Chewy and tough. Paired with sauce or salt and pepper to enchance it.
Brownie 😋 - Super moist, chocolatey and fudgy. Shiok. Must try.

Good ambient, place cooling, service indeed is great.
This their soft launch menu. So subject to change.
Nice Atmosphere!!! Friendly Staffs
Nice food and nice view! And very amazing prize for a whole set at only 14 dollars . Will definitely visit again with my future girl friend ( if I have hahaha )
Wonderful place to eat! The staff is very friendly amd the food is great
Nice restaurant in NTU. Food is good. Recommended.
Food is of worse quality than earlier. Staff was not very helpful. Angus beef was chewy.

Often they have offers that make the food affordable. I used to like when they had beer hours that include tasting various beers at a good price. Regular pricing is a bit on a high side considering that their location is in the campus and most students can't enjoy the services. Staff is always friendly however, they tend to force guests to occupy a table they might not necessarily like. As a guest, you need to have a feeling you're welcome. In general, food is alright, however, when you're taking a burger, try to let them know that you want a fresh bun, otherwise you're stuck with the older. I do occasionally go and bring a friend so you might try as well. This will help them improve.
Average restaurant food you can find in NTU. Steak was bad, other food ok.
This is a nice place to check out in NTU when students are looking to treat themselves to some good food

Food is decent, especially the ones from the menu. The main attraction of this place is the heathy salad bowls - however, they have reduced the options and items to be included in the body's since the time it was first introduced.
good vibes and friendly staff! food here is really good as well, will recommend !!

OK. So the redeux is nice.  It looks nice and the menu is better.
Margarita tasted like pure juice and sour which was a bummer.

As for the food, I think they are missing the best point of having a SW US or Mexican menu:  You only have to stock 10-15 ingredients to make DOZENS of
different southern dishes!!!

My suggestion, and I mean this with best intentions.
Offer plain everything in the menu, then make proteins add-ons.  You are punishing vegetarians by charging full price to remove the meat.  Or even punishing anyone that isn't in the mood for a particular protein.
Adding a surcharge to change proteins is not cool.  2 bucks extra to sub prawn for chicken is kinda crazy.
Go basic + add-ons is my best suggestion.

Best of luck to you!
Tasty food but there was a small dead cockroach in my mocktail. Ruined an otherwise tasty lunch.
Very nice ambience and good food. Mr Sara is so courteous and customer centric person and Ms Skyler is so prompt in her service.

Re-opened with a new menu.  Main courses and desserts were great along with the service.  We had dinner and the prices were reasonable considering the comfort, view and proper restaurant service.  Really great addition to NTU if you need some cool comfort after a long day of study/work.

The service was ok. However, the food was pretty low quality. I had a 50% off voucher and I still felt it was overpriced for what it was. After reading the other reviewers maybe I should not have ordered the steak.

Really nice place with nice ambience. The staff there are very friendly and professional as well! Definitely a good hidden corner in ntu for a getaway from campus life to enjoy some fine dining. Food is nice as well, love the jalapeño poppers!!! Rare to see such a dish and it was done superbly well. Will highly recommend to check out this place! Do try the wagyu burger as well, and the lava cake and pecan pie are off the charts.
They’ve got the best honey lemon tart.
Nice ambience and food especially good service and friendly from Lynn..
food was really expensive and not tasty, not worth it even with burpple 1-for-1 😅
Five stars . Good place for respite when overwhelmed with the university work. Loved the lunch menu variety. Steak was great and sides were a great complement.
Fish and chips was delightful!
Recently reopened with a new menu. The $14 set lunch is a good deal. One of the only places in NTU to have food with service other than Cosmo restaurant.
The pork ribs were tender and the portion was quite big. Value for money at $16.
It is a pleasant experience as the service was good and the ambience was nice
The service was impecable and the good was delicious!
The closed at random times and don’t update Google. Don’t bother coming as they are likely closed. Told me there is a “sign on the door” that they are closed so I should have know!
fancy and clean place in ntu, nice to have an important appointment. however, the service is not good with the slow waiters and waitresses, which delays everything

Food was disappointing for the price point. Only giving it 2 stars because it’s the only fancy place in NTU

Brownie was good
If you go at peak hours be ready to wait for an hour for your food and when it arrives it might not even be what you ordered. They clearly need to hire more staff.
SUPER YUMMY, TRY THE LAVA CAKE
Nice location and with a great view.  Not many options of beer on tap -  they only have archipelago lager and summer ipa. The salad is quite popular.
Used to go here often.  Lunch time can be crowded
Salted Egg Prawn Burger
Love the dessert here!

Didn’t expect a meal so lovely before we went. The head chef apprenticed in Japan and the dishes are elegant, beautiful and yummy… the restaurant is a fabulous combination of traditional style and modern style… we had a very pleasant time there.

The food was great in overall, in particular the squid and the uni hand roll. We felt that the mushrooms could have been done better, it seemed to be lacking in flavour/fragrance. The sake selection was unique. The ambience was nice! Recommended to try.

It's a Japanese fusion place. Food and service was great. Opted for the restaurant week menu and portions were very reasonable. They have quite a good selection of sakes available too. Place is not too big (though they do have two levels) so reservation would still be recommended.

A delightful and enjoyable dining experience!
All the dishes were on point.
Got a complimentary birthday dessert too!
Great service from the friendly host, Zamzi.
Would definitely come back here again.

Had such a lovely experience dining at Tanoke! Chanced upon them last month during the Nespresso Singapore Restaurant week and made a reservation for my partner’s birthday for their 4-course dinner menu.

Everything served was fantastic, my partner and I enjoyed them all. Service was excellent as well. Would definitely be back again some day :)

Amazing food & service was great! Would love to visit again and try other dishes! 👍🏻 We liked the ambience too. Felt cozy there! They were able to accommodate to our little request as well which we very much appreciate! Keep up the good work :)

Nestled on L2, this place exudes a cosy exclusive atmosphere, although it can get a mite noisy as the dining floor is rather small. Reservations necessary given the limited capacity. Good food, goes well with the extensive sake list.

super good experience at tanoke. came on a public holiday and despite the crowd, service was on point and attentive.

the food we ordered all came at a good pace. serving was just nice for my family, but for big eaters may feel their rice bowl & sando portions of be a little small. the food were all well seasoned and very nicely presented.

For dessert, our favourite is the panna cotta followed by smores tart then the shiso lychee sorbet (although it is quite a good palette cleanser) likewise for the yuzu ice cream (i recommend it)  👍🏻

Overall, would definitely return for another meal 🥰

This has to be marked as not just the best fine dining Japanese, but one of the best fine dining period. Spectacular food. Great atmosphere. Fantastic service from Iries. Extremely reasonable price. We’ll make a habit of going back for sure.

Had such an enjoyable time at tanoke! The space was beautiful and ambiance was really nice. Special shoutout to Nareeth and chef Ken for helping me arrange a little surprise. Extremely attentive to details and needs of customers, definitely will be back! :) However, note that portions are quite small and if you have a huge appetite, the food may not be substantial.

The ambience was good, but the food had some that were hits (the karaage) and some that were misses (the uni in the seafood bowl wasn't fresh - it had become a bit watery)

I think Tanoke would be a good place to come for sake (they have a wide collection) and have some of the appetisers with the sake. That I will give 5 stars. But for dinner, it falls a bit short.

Great food, great service.

If I could eat the Hamachi Carpaccio every day I would. Perfectly seasoned and a burst of joy with each mouthful.

Highly recommend the beef bowl and wagyu sliders. The chicken karaage was ok but probably only seemed average in contrast with the outstanding taste of the other dishes we had.

Got there 3 minutes before the happy hour wagyu slider promotion ended and our server was very kind to quickly lock it in for us. Very good value of a delicious slider with our sake ordered. Will be back!

Good ambience, great service and awesome food
Ordered the aus waygu beef medium rare! It was perfectly medium rare! Savoury, well seared and melt in the mouth :)

Impressed with the otoro roll, iberico pork jowl, egg plant, black truffle udon and matcha pannacota!

It's located on the 2nd floor of a shop house. The ambience is good. Staff is friendly.
Food is nice & the salad is fresh. Australian Striploin bowl is my favorite. Pork bowl is also nice.

We went for a Sunday Brunch at Tanoke. The food was a delight especially the 3-cut Wagyu platter. We ordered medium-rare and each cut of the wagyu meat melts in your mouth😋 I love the ambience of the place as well as the design and the lights. The service is splendid and friendly . Overall experience was excellent and we enjoyed it much👍👍

Real authentic taste with modern twist. The rice of the signature Rice bowl is so damn good with right balance of truffle taste, furikake and pickled cucumber. I don’t eat beef but I had a taste of the rice, and it’s amazing. I’m sure the beef is vy nice too. The temaki, grilled hamachi and grilled assorted mushrooms with butter, are yummy too. Tbh I didn’t expect the simple mushroom to be this addictive. Hope to see more non beef choices on menu, provided they manage to up their manpower. Shortage of manpower happens at every industry at this time, sigh.

I mean I love Japanese food but I come to realise that I love the Japanese fusion even better. I think their seasonal set menu is really well designed and every dish is a hit in my opinion. The Hamachi Carpaccio is super refreshing and well balanced with tomato ricotta cheese come afterwards. Wagyu platter is a must order, I was super full when this dish came but it just tasted so great and I just couldn’t stop eating. On top of that, the service is excellent, thank you Iries and Nareenth !

Stumbled upon this shop on a rainy day and we were pleasantly surprised! Service was great, and zamzi recommended a great bottle of sake to go with the food.

Food was tasty and prices were reasonable! We ordered otoro handrolls and they were pretty generous with the ingredients. Ordered the beef bowl and the Australian striploin beef and rice was well seasoned. Also ordered the ika and we absolutely loved the combination of seasoning + sauce!

Overall the food and service really made an impression on us and we really enjoyed it! We will definitely be back for more :))
Probably the best Karaage I had so far in Singapore. Price point is very reasonable and every dish was great. Seasoning was on point too. Great selection of sake. Will definitely come back

Excellent food and service, ambience was eclectic and nice. Servers were prompt and friendly, we had the beef bowl and iberico pork bowl, both were wonderful. Come at lunch for their sets, value for money, and the food is outstanding! We will be back :)

Sister restaurant of Kabuke’s, the concept of this place is somewhat similar. Beef bowls, Uni, Sake. The food here didn’t blow my mind away, but the service was excellent. We were served by Nareenth and Iris and they were great folks. Their famed Aburi Ootoro hand roll was a massive disappointment, with the seaweed slightly soggy (I ate it almost immediately), Uni obviously not in its best quality and rather tough altogether. Truffle hamachi carpaccio looks nice but I couldn’t taste any truffle from the pieces itself. Their sliders saved the day for me, along with their service. To be honest, I’ve never liked Kabuke and I dragged my feet to Tanoke. While I’m glad that I finally checked out Tanoke, I felt the food’s quality was on the same level as that of Kabuke’s. For the more discerning customer, you might feel slightly short-changed as everything that’s supposedly fancy on the menu do not deliver at all in terms of quality and taste. This is the same problem with Kabuke too. I doubt I’ll return again but thanks for the effusive service!

Restaurant is tucked in a corner on level 2, Purvis Street, one might miss the entrance if one were to walk too fast. I was there on a weekday night for dinner for my birthday celebration and was seated on level 3, which was private enough for a group of 5 pax. Ordered their newly created set dinner for 4-5pax. Service was impeccable, quality of food was served was of top quality. Food was delectable, to our delight.

In addition, the restaurant took note to serve the next dishes only when we have completed the previous one with a short time gap to ensure food prepared is warm, which many mediocre F&Bs are lacking in. Restaurant also allowed us to bring our own cake which is a plus point.

Special shout out to Zamzi, Iries, Nareenth who introduced and every dish serve, and patiently helped us to take photos and a gifted us a complimentary birthday shot of sake.

Overall it was a very pleasant and delightful dining experience. Highly recommended restaurant indeed, will be back!

Thank you Tanoke Team!

Food is really good and service crew is very friendly! like Otoro Aburi Handroll and Black Truffle Cold Udon the most 😍😍 Lamb Ribs is average but Spicy Baby Corn is quite good 😁 *Bonus* they gave my friend a little birthday surprise when we're about to leave 🥰 thank you for taking note on my reservation comment that I almost forgot 🤣

Tanoke is a recent partner to my company and also only in recent did I get the chance to head on into Tanoke to try the dinner menu with our members. Twice I've been here for dinner and once for lunch, and never once was I ever disappointed. In fact the portions are so huge for both our dinner set ($128++ or something in that range) and the portion is generous! I'm disappointed at my own shrunk appetite for not being able to finish my ricecovered in truffle shavings!

The wagyu, it melts in your mouth, the grilled lamb omg that char—grill on it is perfect! The rice with the onsen tamago in it, and nothing but black truffle shavings on top, it's luxury at its best. And let's not forgot those appetisers that build up to the main course that you'd have thought could not get any better. Oh it does, it SO does.

I super love the sushi of uni, with ikura wrapped in crispy seaweed, with some gold flakes on top and a side of deep fried gobo shavings. It's all so good! And the portion, they're so generous with the uni that it's spilling out!

Let's not forget the dessert! The first time I was there I tasted their sorbet, not just any, but a shiso with Lychee sorbet, it's an acquired taste, but I so love how it cleanse the palate and makes you want to continue eating even more! The second time I visited, I had the gin infused jam with matcha panna cotta, speechless good. Its so silky, smooth and omg so wonderfully easy to keep eating it despite how filling all the other dishes before makes you.

If ever you need some drinks to go with your food. Everyone in the restaurant are well-versed in their knowledge of sake and could recommend good sake pairings for each of your dishes too. I love how intimate the mezzanine is, and it's just so cozy up there in the private space that I wish the night of fun dining will just keep continuing.

I'm always back for more, especially to try out their lunch menu, and omg it is so so SO GOOD! They serve mainly dons in the afternoon, but the miso soup is so good, I wish I could have just had more. And the staff are so kind to pair my grilled pork don with a glass of sakura sake.

I'm already missing the food and dishes, especially the grilled baby corns only avail in lunch! Super looking forward to going back to dine there once again!

This is now our favourite restaurant !

Restaurant week menu is superb - from 2 appetisers to main course (Yellowtail cheek) to dessert + Nespresso .

Nareeth & Iries were very friendly . Nareeth was very patient in explaining the menu and highly recommended yellowtail cheek (Hamachi Kama) & he is right ! The fish was fresh and just simply delicious! We also paired with 4 types of sake and they matched the dishes so well.

We couldn’t wait to share the joy with the rest of family and have since made reservation for our family of 5 to visit again later this week. Looking forward to another delicious dinner with our family :)

Highly recommend this humble restaurant. Food was great, portion is good and value for money! I highly recommend the rib eye, the otoro wrap, egg plant as side dish and also the cold udon!!! Thank you Nareenth and Zamzi for your great service too!
Taste and quality of the food was great. Friendly service. Complimentary birthday dessert and sake were greatly appreciated. Reservation recommended.

Tanoke is located on the second floor on a shophouse.  We decided to drop by as the other popular restaurants were full but we are happy with what life brought us.

First the service, Mr Rao was there to follow up on the food and ensuring our water glass is never half filled.  In fact, for one of the dishes, he noticed that something was amiss and brought it back to the kitchen.  So this is someone who takes pride in his work.

We opted for the Happy hour sake which comes with a mini wagyu burger and burdock chips.  A good start.  We went for the set and it is extremely well priced as it comes with 2 appetizers(one of which is a hamachi carpaccio), 2 gigantic desserts, a substantial portion of 3 types of wagyu and a few other items.  Hubby and I both enjoyed the Kagoshima ribeye the most.

All in all, a great find and I hope more people will appreciate them to keep them in business.  Not every restaurant has earned this but I feel they have.

Great discovery by my husband. Food is nice n Instagramable with very reasonable price. Since we dun eat beef, Waiter is friendly n helpful with great recommendation! Lamb n carpaccio with truffle is must try ! Satisfied dinner 😊

Came here for my husband’s birthday and had a wonderful experience. The staff were super attentive and friendly, the food was such a treat, everything tasted so good.
We had the aburi otoro handroll, lamb rack (this was **chefs kiss** best of the night), spicy baby corn, tanoke classic bowl (strip loin), pork jowl, shisho lychee sorbet (super refreshing) and matcha pannacotta.
Food was great (sliders were amongst the best we’ve had), ambience was cozy for quiet dinner dates, and the service from Nareenth was top notch! (: will return again to try their brunch menu

We had Katsu chicken truffle sando and Australian Wagyu sando and they were both amazing!! Their matcha panna cotta was good too. Their service was beyond excellent!! Thank you Zamzi, Iries and Nareeth!

Had a wonderful experience dining at Tanoke for Nespresso Restaurant week! Food was delicious (special appetisers only available for restaurant week) and the service was impeccable. The servers were attentive and patient in explaining the menu to us. Will definitely come back!

One of the best sake tasting I have been. Waitress and Waiter service is superb excellent. Thanks Iries & Nareen. Excellent place and very tasty lunch. Must try
Thumbs up 👍

A true hidden gem!  Tucked away discreetly on the second floor of a shop lot on Purvis street, you won’t notice it unless you go looking.

Hands down, probably the best meal I’ve had in Singapore.  We started with the Hamachi Carpaccio that was topped with generous truffles shaving and ikura, drizzled with truffle shoyu - the yellow tail was so fresh and every bite was simply a flavour bomb hit!  Next came the Tanoke Beef Bowl (rib eye).  It was a masterpiece, where the meat just melts in your mouth, so tender, juicy and cooked just right. The creamy yolk from the onsen egg made it the perfect sauce to go with the Niigata rice.  Soooo yumms.

They also do Sake pairing but not much of a drinker…. But definitely a must if you are a sake lover.

Also love the sleek decor & vibe, making it a great place for date nights or girlie get together.  Staff were all attentive and ready to serve.

Can’t wait to come back and try more items on the menu.  Highly recommend!!
Food is SUPERB! Love the quality of food here! Service is excellent! Will definitely come back again!

Service by Mr.Nareenth & Iris are fantastic and Awesome!
The food here is delicious! Definitely be back.

Seriously one of the nice cosy Japanese foodie place!!!!
The food was good !!! The service excellent!!! Crazy ambiance
Must come and don’t gonothe replace in that street

Tanoke is such a gem! Beautiful cosy place with good food and even better service. Unpretentious and really lives up to the online reviews.

Nareeth, thank you for making our evening so enjoyable, and ensuring that we didn’t over order. You have such good knowledge of your products and a wonderful passion for your job. We really appreciate that. Cheers!
We took the Set Dinner which was offered during the Diningcity promotion ($78).   Food was very delicious and service was good!  Highly recommended!

Room for improvement but a good first visit nonetheless. Found Tanoke on restaurant week's list and booked to try but ended going ala carte instead. Nestled in small cosy space on the second floor of a shoplot building at Purvis St. Chic modern interior accentuated with the play of light. Quite a few favourites but after having 9 dishes off the menu, I found some of the elements used to be repetitive. Would love to see more variation in flavour and style.

We started of with the otoro aburi handroll and they were accomodating to cook one of the fish more and shift some of the toppings over to mine so I had 2 portions of uni and ikura(in pictures). We loved the wagyu marmalade toast and made a second order if it. The sweet buttery finish on the crisp toast and rich umami mash of braised wagyu complimented perfectly with the dollop of yuzukosho cream.

Refreshing, sweet tomatoes and tart vinaigrette a top creamy thick mascarpone tofu. Love! It's like a fusion take on italian tomatoes and burrata. Definitely order this. 3-cut wagyu platter failed to make an impression. These had a beautiful smokey aroma when served. A5 Kyushu tenderloin, A5 Kagoshima ribeye and MB7 Australian striplion. Meats were cut too thin, 1-1.5cm thick. Tenderloin had the best mouth feel and melts but was cooked done, no pink probably as it was cut the thinnest. The Ribeye section we got was bottom half fat and some pieces with gristle. Striploin is forgettable.

Even grilling on the US jumbo asparagus. Bonito flakes and yuzukosho cream made all the difference for this simple dish. Koji aged NZ coastal baby lamb, semi-frenched. Appreciated the clean cut, less fat and well seasoned outer char. Tender and juicy without any gamey scent. Great if you aren't a fan of fatty cuts. One day air dried flying squid was overkilled in chili flakes and meat itself was rather flat. I wouldn't recommend this. Iberico pork jowl with sweet karashi mayo. Decent but again overkilled in chili flakes. The mayo helped here. Love that it was served with pickled radish slices on the side.

Nice jiggly matcha pannacotta with strawberry jam and pistachio nuts to finish off the meal. The  Smores Tartlet would have been perfect if not for the marshmallows being extremely chewy. I shared that perhaps the marshmallows were not toasted long enough to caramelize and melt inside, or the ice cream on top made them harden back too fast. The tart shell was perfect, thin and cracked easily while holding firm. Lots of melty dark chocolate at the base and bits of raspberry inside that brought it all together. This was waved off the bill after my feedback and the kitchen agreed that this could be improved.

Naren took great care of us during our visit. I was offered a complimentary sake to try and was served the Senkin Modern Moku Junmai Ginjo.

Was once the old Mikkeller bar before covid hit.
Now it same floors brings new exciting food and beverage paring adventures.

a phenomenal dining experience! my second time back at tanoke and the experience was as good as the first. The highlight of the night had to be the Otoro Aburi Handroll- definitely order this. The other dishes we ordered were spectacular as well but as the night progresses I got really full as the portions are pretty substantial! This is not a bad thing surely if you come in a big group and reservations are incredibly easy to make for some reason! The dishes took very long to be served hence the deduction of 1 star. If you are not ravenous this place would be perfect for a quiet date night

Had an amazing team dinner here. Top notch food and great value for the quality. Every dish was meticulously prepared and presented. The service was just as good if not better. Special mention to Nareenth who took care of our group. He was always there but never intrusive - that is top class service. Will definitely be back.

A really cosy and beautiful place. Such wonderful and warm service from the lady who attended to us. The service is definitely top-notch, coming over to check on how we like our food, making recommendations and refilling our water glasses ever so often. Really made us feel super relaxed and comfortable.

The food was creatively plated. Especially the delicate cod with miso that I ordered, portions were quite small, but much detail went into the plating which I appreciated. Love the touch of charred lime which brings such refreshing lift to a dish that may usually be over salty. Love that! The lamb rack was also delicious and tender. Would love to try more dishes next time! A definite recommend!!

What an enjoyable experience! Sure some kinks here and there, not perfect, but definitely has so much going for it that I wholeheartedly give a 5 star review!!

The manager was warm, attentive, very genuine and friendly. He explained the composition of each dish and also the beginnings of the restaurant as a scale up from the previous gastrobar.

Went there to sample the restaurant week menu.

The yellowtail is to-die-for, one of the best that I've tasted. The cook on the lamb was so good, it was tender and had none of the gamey flavour, although the marination could be improved to impart more flavour.

The sirloin was so good, the marbling so rich that it melted in the mouth and hardly needed any condiments to accompany it.

Desserts probably could be improved further. The s'mores tart was overpowering in it's sweetness, there really wasn't much else going for it. The matcha panna cotta was so much better, and well matched by the tart was of the raspberry jam.

The yuzu sake recommended was spot on and was delightful in its citrusy flavour and subtle sweetness.

This is a restaurant where the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. Hope to see this restaurant grow from strength to strength, and I will be back to sample again.

The food here is top notch, every dish carefully thought through. The Japanese Fruit Tomato dish was layered with multiple flavour bombs, simple but delicious! Extremely great service provided by Nareenth who really made the dining experience very enjoyable!
Understated from the outside; all substance in the menu. One of the best finds in Singapore.
Like a secret clubhouse. We enjoyed the drinks and food. It's not the cheapest sake place to chill but worth the trip. Kanpai 🍶🥳

Visited the restaurant during restaurant week. Great ambient and the food was delicious overall. Service was prompt and friendly. Both the Amuse Bouche, Hamachi Carpaccio were full of umami and love it. However, the main couse - wagyu striploin was not the best cut as it is kind of chewy, otherwise, it would be a perfect dinner. The macha panna cotta dessert is a must have and not overly sweet.

Place is not the most convenient in Singapore but the restaurant is rather quiet, good for people who want a quieter environment. Servers are friendly and helpful. Ordered chicken quesadilla, beef fajita and braised beef cheeks. Portions are above average sized. Beef cheeks were soft and flavorful. Quesadilla was not overly cheesy. Fajita was average. Guacamole texture and consistency could be better.
The lunchtime 3-course meal is nice and affordable. The meats are on the more expensive side, but the main dishes are pretty good and fairly priced. The atmosphere was very relaxing and chill.

This place is located inside NTU. It has a good ambience and suits both small groups and couples who look for a good dinner date.

The menu has quite a bit of options - a decent number for vegetarian. The set I ordered had a starter, main course and dessert.

I chose mushroom soup (also has interesting option like samosas) , vegetarian pasta. The dessert is quite standard- choco lava cake with ice cream. It comes about 18.8 S$.

Don’t miss this place if you are in NTU.

Ambience is good.
A bit on the expensive side.
Food is well presented but nothing fantastic.
Service - nothing much to talk about.

Terrible experience. Called to reserve, told us to walk in. Walked in, said tables are booked. Waited for table, then began painful check in experience. Food was subpar, only good thing was the view. Bread was about a week old (see photo). Charge for water, menu online prices have all been raised in restaurant. Avoidable.
really nice ambience and quick service, plus the food was honestly pretty good! i really liked the peach lemonade too~

Do yourselves a favour and avoid the steak!

Great ambience, professional and friendly service crew, overall a fantastic respite within NTU. However, the food items were hit-or-miss. The salmon was fantastic, but the steak was... let’s just say, even a hawker stall could deliver better. Fries were tasty...pork fajita was alright, nothing really remarkable...

I’d give it a positive review only because on both occasions I patronised, I hadn’t paid the full price: first time was with an eatigo 50% discount, the next was for their $14 set lunch. Without these discounts, I’d feel disappointingly shortchanged, given the quality of the food - certainly does not command the à la carte prices, in my opinion.

It has the potential to become a five-star establishment, as long as the consistency of the food quality improves. Everything else (service, ambience) is already in place for an excellent dining experience.

We booked the private area dining to host guests on Tuesday. The halal set meal came more than an hour late. The restaurant was not apologetic and did not inform us at all until we checked with the kitchen. We booked the private area dining for Thursday but we wanted to postpone it one day before due to medical concerns. The restaurant did not allow postponement, did not propose alternative solution and was not willing to negotiate at all about the whole situation. There was completely no flexibility and no compassion. We were told that we will be charged regardless and the food will be served. Fine. We went for the lunch and are now eating in the restaurant. There is a fly in my glass as I am writing this review now.
Very good ambience. Pricey but worth the experience. Closes early else it'll be even better.

Came here for a nice, quiet dinner on a Tuesday evening during school term. A quiet respite that lifts you away from the hustle and bustle of university life. Food was great - ordered the tender beef cheeks cooked to perfection and the crabmeat pasta fully infused with the flavour of crab. Menu is on the pricier side ($18-$30 for mains) excl. service charge and GST but the quality of food is great. Would definitely visit again!

Super expensive place to eat! Peri peri chicken main portion was so so small! Taste nothing to race about. Salmon main was okay. The chicken tikka pizza was good though. Ice lemon tea drinks were so diluted. No lemon taste at all.

This place is located at the heart of NTU in Northspine! (Near the KFC). I was decently surprised by the ambience! It was cosy and comforting.

I ordered the beef cheeks, pork loin fajita, wagyu burger and lava cake.

The Wagyu burger was disappointing. It cost a whopping 18 dollars! However, the patty was really bland. There was no seasoning at all. I had to add my own pepper and salt to the patty to make it tasty. The onions were raw and not grilled. However, I have to say that the fries were good! ($18)

Next, the beef cheeks were soft and tender to the bone. Sauce was decent and mash potato is creamy! However, there's not enough sauce to pair with the mash potato as it was paired with the beef cheeks. (Preferred the fries). They could have been more generous with the salad portion. Overall a bit too pricey for this dish. ($22)

Lastly, the pork loin fajita was surprisingly good!! Pork was cooked and seasoned well! It was paired with onions which was good as well! The combination with the wrap and the pork was really delicious. It even came with a side of sour cream and guacamole! Overall a really really good dish that I recommend :)) It was the cheapest out of the 3 main dish. ($16)

When dessert came, I was pleasantly surprised on the presentation of the dish. The lava cake came off a bit sweet but paired really well with the vanilla ice cream. (Although they probably used a cheap ice cream brand) A great way to end the meal :) ($6)

Overall, dish place is a must try if you have the money as it comes off a little pricey. Would recommend if you are finding a place to splurge. Till we meet again, au revoir!
I loved the food, service and staff! Great selection of food. Wonderful atmosphere and ambience. 10/10 would come again. Ps wear a jacket, it’s cold!
Great place to have a drink if you're on NTU's campus.

This place gets 5 stars as it is the only good joint that accepts reservations at NTU...

Pretty decent selection of food and drinks. Service can always be better.

The waygu burger is nice. Thick juicy Patty on buttery bun
Fajitas is nice too. Lots of meat. Yum.
Molten lava lorte is a must have.
