Apple crumble ok ok

New branding, new menu.
Grats on re opening.
Had 3 course set lunch 14 SGD nett. Most affordable from the menu already.
Mushroom soup🥰 - creamy, heavy yet watery, truffle oil can't taste. Garlic butter bread was nice too.
Beef strip loin🙂 - Doneness medium rare but come out medium. Lightly seasoned. Tasted okay. Chewy and tough. Paired with sauce or salt and pepper to enchance it.
Brownie 😋 - Super moist, chocolatey and fudgy. Shiok. Must try.

Good ambient, place cooling, service indeed is great.
This their soft launch menu. So subject to change.
Nice Atmosphere!!! Friendly Staffs
Nice food and nice view! And very amazing prize for a whole set at only 14 dollars . Will definitely visit again with my future girl friend ( if I have hahaha )
Wonderful place to eat! The staff is very friendly amd the food is great
Nice restaurant in NTU. Food is good. Recommended.
Food is of worse quality than earlier. Staff was not very helpful. Angus beef was chewy.

Often they have offers that make the food affordable. I used to like when they had beer hours that include tasting various beers at a good price. Regular pricing is a bit on a high side considering that their location is in the campus and most students can't enjoy the services. Staff is always friendly however, they tend to force guests to occupy a table they might not necessarily like. As a guest, you need to have a feeling you're welcome. In general, food is alright, however, when you're taking a burger, try to let them know that you want a fresh bun, otherwise you're stuck with the older. I do occasionally go and bring a friend so you might try as well. This will help them improve.
Average restaurant food you can find in NTU. Steak was bad, other food ok.
This is a nice place to check out in NTU when students are looking to treat themselves to some good food

Food is decent, especially the ones from the menu. The main attraction of this place is the heathy salad bowls - however, they have reduced the options and items to be included in the body's since the time it was first introduced.
good vibes and friendly staff! food here is really good as well, will recommend !!

OK. So the redeux is nice.  It looks nice and the menu is better.
Margarita tasted like pure juice and sour which was a bummer.

As for the food, I think they are missing the best point of having a SW US or Mexican menu:  You only have to stock 10-15 ingredients to make DOZENS of
different southern dishes!!!

My suggestion, and I mean this with best intentions.
Offer plain everything in the menu, then make proteins add-ons.  You are punishing vegetarians by charging full price to remove the meat.  Or even punishing anyone that isn't in the mood for a particular protein.
Adding a surcharge to change proteins is not cool.  2 bucks extra to sub prawn for chicken is kinda crazy.
Go basic + add-ons is my best suggestion.

Best of luck to you!
Tasty food but there was a small dead cockroach in my mocktail. Ruined an otherwise tasty lunch.
Very nice ambience and good food. Mr Sara is so courteous and customer centric person and Ms Skyler is so prompt in her service.

Re-opened with a new menu.  Main courses and desserts were great along with the service.  We had dinner and the prices were reasonable considering the comfort, view and proper restaurant service.  Really great addition to NTU if you need some cool comfort after a long day of study/work.

The service was ok. However, the food was pretty low quality. I had a 50% off voucher and I still felt it was overpriced for what it was. After reading the other reviewers maybe I should not have ordered the steak.

Really nice place with nice ambience. The staff there are very friendly and professional as well! Definitely a good hidden corner in ntu for a getaway from campus life to enjoy some fine dining. Food is nice as well, love the jalapeño poppers!!! Rare to see such a dish and it was done superbly well. Will highly recommend to check out this place! Do try the wagyu burger as well, and the lava cake and pecan pie are off the charts.
They’ve got the best honey lemon tart.
Nice ambience and food especially good service and friendly from Lynn..
food was really expensive and not tasty, not worth it even with burpple 1-for-1 😅
Five stars . Good place for respite when overwhelmed with the university work. Loved the lunch menu variety. Steak was great and sides were a great complement.
Fish and chips was delightful!
Recently reopened with a new menu. The $14 set lunch is a good deal. One of the only places in NTU to have food with service other than Cosmo restaurant.
The pork ribs were tender and the portion was quite big. Value for money at $16.
It is a pleasant experience as the service was good and the ambience was nice
The service was impecable and the good was delicious!
The closed at random times and don’t update Google. Don’t bother coming as they are likely closed. Told me there is a “sign on the door” that they are closed so I should have know!
fancy and clean place in ntu, nice to have an important appointment. however, the service is not good with the slow waiters and waitresses, which delays everything

Food was disappointing for the price point. Only giving it 2 stars because it’s the only fancy place in NTU

Brownie was good
If you go at peak hours be ready to wait for an hour for your food and when it arrives it might not even be what you ordered. They clearly need to hire more staff.
SUPER YUMMY, TRY THE LAVA CAKE
Nice location and with a great view.  Not many options of beer on tap -  they only have archipelago lager and summer ipa. The salad is quite popular.
Used to go here often.  Lunch time can be crowded
Salted Egg Prawn Burger
Love the dessert here!

An affordable healthier choice in campus. Tasty and light food, good and fast service.

Bring your own bowl if you want to take away (dabao)!

Price wise is alright.
Freshness is good.
Food wise taste normal.
Portion is just nice.

Regular Bowl($4.50) - 1 Main, 2 sides.
Olive Rice(Main) - Felt the one the one you eat with porridge, those bottled pre-made olive.
Sweet Corn(Side 1) - Normal corn lor.
Mock Fish(Side 2)😋 - This is nice. Crispy, fragrance, tasty.
Japanese sesame sauce for drizzle

Creamy Scrambled Eggs(Add-on)- Savoury, creamy with a pinch of pepper sprinkle for the perfect gooeyness in your mouth.

It’s a new place located in North Spine near Lee Wee Nam library within NTU. Some of the best salad options with pasta or rice or potato base.

On an average it costs about 4-5SGD for a base +2 add ons with a salad sauce on a bed of lettuce. It’s worth visiting multiple times.

Proteins include tofu (2 types), chickpeas and veggies cover broccoli, corn, cucumber and tomato etc.

It’s handy for quick bites or takeaway!

This new vegetarian salad place in NTU, Singapore is great. You can chose a regular or large size salad. They have pasta, rice or potatoes to choose for carbs which is good cos one doesn't get bored of taking same carb. I recommend their cheesy pumpkins. The creamy eggs cost extra but it is quite tasty. The staff are nice too. Over all affordable and to go place to eat in NTU.

The 2nd best vegetarian food in NTU. Olive rice, broccoli, pumpkin were all very tasty. Lettuce was fresh and crispy. Overall, the food is very good and fresh. I will try the chickpeas next time. Besides pasta and potatoes, I hope there will be other options like buckwheat or quinoa in the future. Other vegs like french beans, egg plants will be good too. Just a suggestion.
Affordable, filling salad bowls. Egg costs an additional $1.20 but it's really good!

I was visiting NTU and stumbled on this salad bar. Everything was very fresh and yummy. Love it! Please consider opening an outlet in Jem, many ppl will patronise for sure and view salad in a diff light 🤣 one of the best and v affordable salads I’ve tasted in a while! Just wish it was in a more accessible location ❤️
Very clean and hygienic. Staff know the ingredients of all the items on the menu. So it's easy for vegans to make good choice of their salad bowl. Very good pricing too. Love the options in tofu.

Fresh ingredients, healthy options and delicious. It’s always crowded during peak hours, the name is apt. Add on options are available apart from the main dishes and it’s a welcome change to the regular food options in NTU.

Price wise is acceptable but I wish they could offer a no-carb option. The $4.50 option comes with 1 main + 2 sides, which the main are all carbs (Fusilli pasta, olive rice, potato). I asked if I could swap the main with some other veggies, but the answer was no from a staff in the evening (with some impatience attitude, probably tired throughout the day, let's give chance?) Feel like the swapping of main with veggie should be accepted and they should be more flexible. Anyway, the scrambled egg was super delicious.

I LOVE THIS. Wholesome comfort food. And I'm so disappointed they don't deliver further or offer their own delivery because the NTU campus is so far in. I'm obsessed with the cheese pasta, seaweed tofu and scrambled eggs 😍

Excellent foods and delicious.
Probably to take away as the network's signal is very low in that lot.
Good olive rice with so many veggies to choose. Nice option for vegetarians.
Have been buying salad from here. Their rice are delicious with generous serving:) very affordable pricing! Service is very good and the staffs are polite.
Jenny is a very pleasant lady who never fails to serve with a smile. Great personality.
Very good
Food is v bland n not tasty.  There are better places with clean food,  tasting much better
Affordable, tasty and of course healthy.
Good for veg lovers

Chicken Steak($7.50)
Order standard dish. Less chance to go wrong.
Swapped my 2 sides for Pasta
Cream Pasta is pure cream and garlicky taste. Will get jelak overtime. Portion is big tho. If got some mushroom will be better.😐
Chicken is tender and have a light char crisp skin and pour with Black Pepper sauce.😋
One of the favourite western food stall. Fried fish Aglio Olio pasta tasted good. The fish is soft. Chicken steak, fries and mash potato also nice.

My go-to heartland pasta shop! Love both their cream and aglio olio varieties.

Became a regular after ordering via food delivery apps during Covid period. Unfortunately delivery is no longer available, but it is worth a walk over once in a while.

I am glad they reopen after a fire burnt this coffee shop. After renovations, the stall front looks brighter. But the best thing about Chester Express is the healthy options. I asked for grilled chicken chop without sauce. I also ordered steamed vegetables (broccoli) and garden salad without sauce. And they did it perfectly without mistake. Great for healthy diet
Friendly staff. Meal was decent. Chilli crab pasta was spicy and for the more adventurous taste buds.

I love Chester Express! Have been patronising this stall since it first opened years back as I live near the market. Love the mains in general - chicken chop/pork chop/sirloin steak/grilled fish/breaded fish etc and the side dishes (including pasta) are well proportioned too. Tasty and adequate portion sizes. Recommended!
It is quite rare to see any stall selling Sirloin steak for only $12. Gave it a try and it was worth the money. Meat was tender and juicy, and the sides were equally good. Will be back again. 👍

I stay in the area and probes this western is one of the best tasting in my area. Aglio olio and breaded chicken is my favourite, value for money and big portions $7.50. The menu itself is good. Chicken and lamb dishes are well season.
Ordered the sirloin steak for medium rare, turned out to be well done... and it was very very tough. Will never go for the beef or lamb dishes again

I ordered salmon steak from stall Chester Weston Grill noticed that the fish was not fully done or half raw. So I approached the person whom take my order for replacement. He was rude telling me that they don't check the entire piece of fish and claiming that if you want replacement then he will need to call his boss for approval first.

This stall is located at Jurong West Street 91.
standard drop alot. been patronise for 2years and today will be the last. sirloin steak is the hardest i ever tried in my life for medium well. side dishes are ok still.

Quality standard can vary.
Sometimes it can be charred or re-fried and masked by the sauce so that visually it seem fine.

Wondering is it because it was late night and they pre fried it.
Best place for budget western food in jurong west. Chicken steak and fish are the best sellers. Open till 4am. Will be great if they offer delivery.
Ordered a $12 sirloin steak medium doneness. Super overcooked and hard to chew. Not worth buying.
Worth to try, price still moderate
This is the 3rd time I ask for nachos add on for the fries but I paid and didn't get .... Please always remember to put when customer pay for it
Yeah I wouldn't recommend western food in coffeeshops in general, but go for it if it's your thing
Incredibly tasty and a filling meal at quite a cheap price. Strongly recommend for people who is a meat lover.

This greedy restaurant has gotten worse ever since they recently removed set meals which costs less.

Main courses and a choice of soup and drink which usually cost total of $14 are now separated. They now charge $8 for soup and $3 for drink.

The new total cost would be $19 for the same exact amount of food.

Even though the food is decent, it's still not worth the price.

Don't come here again and support this place, I certainly won't.

Being a grad student at NTU, I have at least 3-4 meals in a month here at The Soup spoon. Being a vegetarian I mostly stick to the meatless minestrone soup. I do miss the wraps option they use to have earlier. I do like their salad,pretty simple. Wish they could increase the serving quantity slightly though. This outlet is priced lesser than the outlets outside NTU. So make the most of it.
I was also wondering if they can serve the drinks in non plastic containers when one is not taking away the drinks.

As a lacto vegetarian cum vegan my opinion about this place is: These days most items are marked with “out of stock “ dunno why. He staff have no idea about the ingredients in the sauces and the falafel balls. I’m basically a vegetarian and have eaten this falafel wrap - have been eating here for the past 2 years and I also gave a frequent diner card. Alas! They have fed me food with egg all these days.. when asked, each one of them reply differently and I’m in chaos and hunger.. I’ve finally chosen not to eat anything from here except the soups and the focaccia bread. PS: this place isn’t for vegans and vegetarians if you’re looking for something to eat other than soups

After the recent renovation, they removed the soup sets from their menu and replaced it with "hot food" which you can ask for combinations of pasta, fries, vegetables, fish and meat (like an army cookhouse with more choices).

Unfortunately, the "hot food" is nothing but hot. I ordered falafel with fries and vegetables but everything was cold, hard and unappetising.

A very regrettable choice for lunch; I could have something cheaper and better at any of the other restaurants beside it.
soup tasted v good but soba tastes like strings with flour.

Has a wider menu selection than your regular Soup Spoon outlet, so you can also have other western food options beyond just soup! Food was good, but you need to order using a kiosk, which was a bit fiddly as one of the menu items on the main signboard we wanted wasn't available on the kiosk and we spent a bit of time tapping around looking for it, so knocking off 1 star for that
Prompt service & helpful staff. Fresh ingredients & yummylicious soups.

Almost ate a piece of hard sharp plastic found in the soup. When I complained, the staff said, "What? So you want a refund?" Shocking. Your only job is to open the plastic box that the soup was shipped in and pour it into the reheating device. Is it that hard to open a plastic box without plastic shards dropping into the soup?
The standard has dropped, portion also getting smaller. The counter staff could have been friendlier. Miss the old soup spoon....

Was blown away by how they went as far as using a wooden board to serve my grilled salmon! (Take note that this is in a neighbourhood coffee shop that is hidden from main road so they could have just save the effort and no one will mind)

For this good attitude and food, I think they deserve a 5 star rating! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I feel that the branding of the store really suits the way she acts as she is simply MAD when it comes to customer service.

Absolutely ridiculous how for a second time they fed me with spoiled food when i finally decided to come back months after they fed me spoiled spaghetti. How can you not smell the foul smell of your corn when they’re spoiled??? 0 food quality check in this store

Pasta portion was okay, but not worth the steep price of $8+ . When compared to competitors nearby, you can certainly get better value for your money from elsewhere. For a baked pasta, it certainly could use more cheese. Prices are not student-friendly.
Meatball was tasty, a 3/5.  But other than that flavour-wise, the pasta was a 2/5.
Overall, the pasta tastes almost like what you would expect to find from 7-11 or cheers but less flavourful and at double the price. (although the portion here is slightly more)

I ordered cheese baked meatball pasta with mushroom. Pasta was cheesy and meatballs were tasty. The pricing is slightly more expensive than other food stalls in NTU but it’s still ok overall. Taste wise 7/10.

Pasta is really too oily, I ordered tomato sauce pasta but it tasted like fish curry....will not eat it again. Beware of the 5 star review here, its really suspicious...Look at the queue during lunch and dinner hours and the amount of people seated, its a clear sign.

I got the baked meatball Mac & Cheese. 3 pieces of meatballs, but the meatballs were great.
The taste of the mac and cheese was not homogeneous, some parts were quite bland, maybe could do better with slightly more cheese.

It should be called as heart attack pasta as pasta was very very oily and cheeze on the top makes it scarier to eat. Prices definitely are not student friendly. This pasta is a health risk and and costly for the pocket.
price is a little steep for food in a school establishment but overall decent baked pasta. would be great if there were a bit more ingredients :”) coffee was good though!
Although abit on the pricey side (could do w abit more quantity), their baked pasta is one of the best ones you can find in school!! really friendly staff too :D

Don't buy the 5-star reviews you see here. This restaurant is absolute trash -  as I'm sure you can see from the countless other 1/2-star posts. Food portion is not worth it for the price of the meal when you can get something of higher quality and quantity from Pasta Express nearby. Heck it, I think even the food courts are better. Although I have to say the 1-star mainly comes from the extremely rude Chinese uncle who prepares the food here. Has absolutely no patience with customers and speaks rudely.

Pretty shocked to see the rest of reviews right before I started digging in. I got the Chicken Tikka Pasta. On first sight looks pretty good, but the taste really isn't all that. Pretty oily inside as well. Agree with the reviews that the portion and quality doesn't justify the price ($9.42 with GST) Who even charges GST in the school though actually. Don't think I'll come again unless they shape up.

Edit: Original review was a week ago. Please take note of the 5 star reviews here, very fishy. Might be fake ones. How the hell is it value for money when someone else paid 8 dollars for 6 meatballs?
Awesome customisable pasta joint :D. Super friendly staff, warm environment, food looks AMAZING 😊😊

Their pasta is way much better than Pastamania.
Price may not be so student friendly.  But at this point of time, there is a overall hike in food price for Singapore.  I am glad they didnt compromise on the quality.
Quite a innovative concept of Baked pasta as a takeaway food. I liked the taste and speedy service. Will definitely visit again. Cheers
Store owners are very friendly and their baked pasta is really good! Will highly recommend to my friends and will definitely visit again :) Thank you!
a nice hearty pasta! it was very filling and tasted very good. the service was also wonderful here.
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ extra stars for the amazing service! food is glorious and the cheese is SO TOASTY!!! & they use paper bags too??? we love a sustainable business!!!!!

Nice to have freshly baked pasta and not expensive and portion was reasonable with the price compare to outside.

Great location in middle of the school campus, able to customise and pasta was made on the spot, good service too!! Will patronise again🫶🏻
Finally I find a nice pasta shop inside the school. The pasta is nice and the waiting time is short.

This is my second visit and I orfer the chicken meat ball pasta and the same taste amazing as always.Slightly better service by the staff will be better and will be much better if management can look into this.
Yes we understand the challenges in this industry but possible to have better staff with improved service to rock.the great concept.
All the best to zitimamas team

Food reminds me of airplane food. It was a unpleasant experience.

Edit: original post from 1 week ago. Shocked to see that there are 5 stars review. Those must be fake. The food is expensive and it does not taste good. Furthermore, the service is bad. When I am there for the first time, I did not notice that I have to order online and I stood there for a long time and the staff simply ignore you. The food is oily, the croissant I had was cold. Please try for yourself to find out the truth.

As others have said, the quality of the food did not match up to the high
price (about $9). The pasta was inconsistently cooked. If you have a pasta craving within this area, I think Pasta Express or Tea Party are better choices.

zitimamas has great service as well as a quick fix for any cheese cravings that I happen to get through my week :-)
Great food, great service and great vibes always, a go-to for me and many others here at NTU, definitely recommend it!

Pasta tastes pretty good, great service by Samir. Highly recommend! :)

Quite overpriced for a school establishment. Quality does not justify the price.

Edit: All the 5-star reviews appearing all within a span of a few hours last week just after the few 1 star reviews seems abit sus. Suspect these be fake/employee accounts manipulating the review score - Polarising reviews of 5stars vs 1 stars abit of a give away. (I hope not, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt here). For the record I ate their chicken tikka and it wasn't great - I dont know what those people are talking about. Unless there was a significant improvement over such as short time. No hard feelings but I sincerely hope that the owners take a hard look at their business model and really consider the criticism of the lower reviews. You guys just opened, there is still time to improve things. It'll be a waste of such potential especially with a different dining concept. All the best!

texture was kind of hard. the food was oily and salty, but i like the cheese~ but the customer service was so bad, and in my opinion, the worst in ntu . the uncle mixed up my order and had the audacity to say that i was the one who agreed with him? he said “ i asked you mac and cheese u still say ya ya” !!?? i mentioned that i wanted baked VEGGIE mac & cheese twice? my friend said she heard me too. still, he didnt have the decency to change my order or refund me. i had to ask for it and not a single apology.. worse, the other guy still could not understand my order. my friend and i were so disappointed by the customer service :(( we tried to be nice but it felt like they were the ones who were mad at us?
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ super friendly stuff and amazing food! it’s a must try 😋
Very good place in side the NTU, the packed pasta was different from others and very nice. Best value for students and service also good and quick, must visit place

Staff is very friendly & food is good!
Good food! And amazing service:)
great service and pasta is v tasty!
very friendly staff, and yummy food!
Food was pretty decent and the queue was pretty long. However, the food would have been better if it’s cooked longer.
I love having my lunch here. the atmosphere is chill and the windows are bright. What a Beautiful day~ Thank you Phillip for giving me this strength. See you again!

Ridiculously slow. Management too cheap to employ the necessary staff. It's one person at the cashier, one person cooking and one person wandering around. Have to wait half an hour for "fast food". Buy KFC and join behind a queue of 20 people waiting for their food.

Zingerito okok only lah. Not cheesy enough. Service still as slow as ever.

Standard KFC food. Food generally is ok but the waiting for your food to come need to take quite some time. Not sure are they lacking staff or what...
The meal I had anyway is so freaking full lol. Only thing to improve is service I guess.

The standard of food here is simply unacceptable. I’ve been here multiple times in the morning, each time with the ludicrous hope that it will be better than the previous time. The porridge is so watery it feels like you’re drinking salted rice water. There were literally only 1.5 pieces of chicken in my bowl, which itself was only 2/3 full. I have never had such an atrocious experience in other KFCs before - please close this outlet down as it is a disgrace to the brand name.
If you like your food served AN HOUR after your ordering. This is your first choice.
Come in 45mins  to 60 mins prior to your meal time. Order taking at counter slow, order peeping  is extremely slow as well.

I came here during lunch time... I tell you guys, the queue is darn long... There are only 2 workers working, 1 at counter, 1 inside the kitchen.. orders are moving at snail pace... 40 minutes to get to my order... They could only pack 1 order every 4 minutes... So please order online prior to coming down to save time.

Welcome to the WORST KFC outlet in Singapore! There is only one famous female staff that is serving and collecting payment at the same time. And you always have to wait for them to fry a new batch of chickens which takes 15 mins. The chickens are literally waiting for you to appear before they drown in the oil. There was once we waited for 45 mins for them to fry 3 batches of chickens. Mine came at the third batches. NTU KFC always doesn't have new menu like the others KFC. They do not have BBQ crunch chickens!
Also most of the GREAT promo codes that KFC offers doesn't include NTU KFC. And at night they only have chickens, no burgers. Good luck to the next batch of NTU students. Have fun camping in KFC for 1 hour!!!

It's crowded, seasonal items are often out of stock, long waiting time and sometimes the fries or the chicken are cold and soft. I'm not a big fan of fast food, but this KFC is surely not the best out there.
A great fast food option on campus. However some items are not available and there is no discounted price for students.

Ordered a BBQ pocket meal, and a zinger box with a choice of chicken for take-away.

First thing, the BBW pocket was missing, just the fries and drinks. The zinger box was fine, it had everything.

Second, the chicken i asked for was original, but the one in the box was crispy.

Third, the chicken and zinger burger was dry.

The staff were not focused at all on what they were doing. I had to remind them for the drinks that came with the meal and the box.

Anyone who wants to go should probably triple check their orders, especially for drinks and every item they ordered.

Their only saving grace was the kind uncle that gives out encouragement notes to the students.

Hits and misses here. Wait can be long during peak hours and they have a tendency to mess up are customised orders (even simple things like change of drinks). Clearing up the kfc cafe area will allow for more seating area. All these are made up for by the fantastic uncle who gives out sticky notes wishing students all the best for their study.

Always no stock of something, drink, ricebucket or original chicken

Bad and slow service, no answer phone calls

Comfortable air con seating area.

Outrageous extra charge for Diet Pepsi! Destroyers of public health

While the seating area is air-conditioned, the queues are usually very long during lunch and dinner. Service is often slow thanks to low number of staffs and a lack of self-ordering machines (Sometimes there is only 1 staff at the counter, who has to collect money and pick up the food/drink items all by himself/herself.) Items in this branch are often out of stock, and there is no indication of items running out. Hence it is annoying when I realise my desired item is out of stock after queuing for more than 15 minutes. (In McDonald's, out of stock items are indicated on the menu screen and blocked on the self-ordering machines.)

Update (07 Sep 2018): There are 2 self-ordering machines at the entrance now, but they only accept card payment. When I was there, nobody was using the self-ordering machines and there were more than 10 people queuing at the counter. I ordered through the self-ordering machine and surprisingly I received my food within 5 minutes, while the queue at the counter didn't seem to move at all. (There were only 2 poor staffs manning the counter and preparing the orders.)
They gave me the wrong order. Again. I guess Cheese Fries sounds alot like Bolognese Fries.

This post i am writing after experiencing it  after many times.Highly disappointing. food quality is so bad. Attached is the photo of  the packing  provided for takeaway... So finger licking good it is.

Not crowded. Nice place to enjoy the yummy KFC chicken 🐔
Really bad customer service taking more than an hour to serve. The NTU branch is the worst, I would suggest you to go somewhere!
Dont have many things despite having a menu. Staff kinda rude
Sooo slow😢 I am starving and have to wait for more than 30 mins.
Limited promotion but still the staff is very friendly
Missing order. Bad queue and order management. ☹️ Staff are nice though.
The worst KFC in the world! You wait a lot to eat bad food
Better off eating the food court upstairs or macs. Worst quality of service imaginable
Place is nice and there is pizza as well!
Campus price point. Approx $1 -$2 cheaper than the malls.
Almost always crowded but service and food is always good!
Such a good place to eat the meal.
Quick bite option. Usually not crowded.
Very nice ambient
Unhealthy food, don't crave too much.
so expensive despite being in campus.

(Translated by Google) Probably the junkiest KFC I've ever been to. Tell the clerk to pack, pay the 0.2 yuan plastic bag and then tell me that the beverage ca n’t be put in and I want to hold it in my hand or it will turn over. So what is the significance of my packing? The ordering machine is also broken. The production speed is also very slow, and even on weekends, there are many people waiting for meals. I have never seen KFC with such a poor service

(Original)
大概是我去过最垃圾的肯德基了。告诉店员打包，支付了0.2元塑料袋费用然后告诉我饮料不能装进去要自己拿在手上不然会翻，那我打包的意义在哪里呢？点餐的机器也是坏的。制作速度也很慢，哪怕是周末也有人多人等餐。真没见过服务这么差的肯德基

restaurant name: Golden Spoon Eating House and Catering
content:
There many names for this canteen but this is probably the only canteen that is open till late 11pm is the closing time for its last store, economic bee hoon. Not for picky eaters, it fulfil the purpose of a supper and the staff is pretty friendly.

Would like to give a shout out to a hidden gem. There's a Thai wester fusion store here and the green curry is pretty not bad. A 3.5-4/5 mark I would give, the flavouring is there and the spiciness mild yet with existence.

This is still a review in doing as I try more food but haha more await

Worst experience ever. I placed the order at 18:09 and now it is 18:58 and I finally get my food after times and times inquiries. It seems that my order was missing in McDonald’s system.
The funny thing is that the aunties at the counter just asked me to buy food at other stalls even though I had paid in McDonald’s. They said they were busy and no one tried to get my food ready. Then I requested to get refund and gave up the food. But they just refused and said how can I get a refund after I paid the money. (Totally wired logic)
Luckily, I am not in a hurry to do something today, and another auntie finally stood up, collected my food and beverage, and gave them to me (the food in my order is just ordinary ones, why took so long to prepare). But who wants to waste time on these tiny things, right?
Lesson: don’t order at McDonald’s in NTU if they already have a lot of orders to handle.

Scrambled Egg Burger with Sausage
Fluffly scrambled egg and yummy sausage patty.

Crispy "Hainanese Chicken" Burger
Taste like McSpicy non spicy version.
Okay lah. Try once can le.
Banana Pie is Fuyoh!
Crisscut fries is standard.

Quick eats. Open sitting.
Long queue always.
Busy area.

Last few days to get spicy McNuggets.
Will miss you.

Great place to hangout with friends, however it can be very pack during peak period especially during lunch hour. Best to avoid during this period, if not you can do mobile app via using mcdonald app.

During term time alot of students placing order. Note that when I tried to order using Grab, the shop was "closed". So thinking of picking up your order? Nah. I also realised that children's Happy Meal is not available here. 😐

This was really a very busy during day time. Since i webt there evening, therw was no queue at all. It was quire free, got my orders very quickly. You will have a very hufe dining area, so finding a seat will not be an issue.

Worst experience ever!!!!!!
We spend 7.4 for the laska burgers online
However, we waited for 40 mins!!!! Could you even believe it?? We were super disappointed in McDonalds in Singapore due o the awful service. We paid by Visa card and show the receipts, yet,  compensationMcDonald doesn’t believe it and insist that we are saying nonsense. They checked the records and say that there are no records!! We almost couldn’t receive our burgers because of their lack of understanding and bad service!!!!! They even looks like that they don’t believe in us at the end even if we show them the receipt of visa card(also the message) Surely, we deserves a compensation! How could Mc Donald’s waste our time and being so demanding and mean to us! Please apologize to us. We feel awful. This McDonald doesn’t even deserves a visit guys

McDonald's food with good standard, will keep up with outlets outside NTU and have the new menus. My only complaint is that it is always crowded during lunch time, but it shows it's popularity. Remember to ask for more chilli if you need.

Normal mcdonalds but subsidised prices as it is inside university campus. No dedicated seating as seating is open for mcdonalds, the subway, the long jhon silver's, the starbucks and the food court above

Nasi Lemak burger is back and the taste is good. McD is Super popular and there’s always a line so expect waiting time. The people behind the counter work hard and are happy to help. Having eaten here so many times, the error rate isn’t worth mentioning and their diligence is definitely appreciated.
1/6 ordering kisoks down during lunch period. No one manning the physical cashier.
Currently there is no dining in at NTU McDonald canteen. Due to covid-19
The app had a glitch this morning, but staff had good service recovery.
Unable to use the "deals" from the mcdonald app but overall serving speed was relatively quick.

Not that it was bad, but on Sat at 11:45am the ordering kiosks already switched to the lunch menu. For some strange reason we couldn’t find the Happy Meal as a selection, I’m not sure if it’s because it’s on NTU campus? The line moved relatively fast but it still took us 20-25 minutes to get our order as there were tons of people.
Served cold stale choco pie. Asked about it and they say they don't heat it up before serving or smth LOL
Fast friendly service. Standard McDonald's menu.
The French fries here are too dry and not crispy at all. But it's the only option students have here for for late night food.
Worst experience ever! Please do be nice to your customers!
You can get most of the local hawker foods reasonable price. Due to covid, only 2 pax per table, so there is waiting time . Waiting time per order and table est 20mins.

The line is simply always too long here. They have an efficient ordering and collecting system so things move. Avoid peak lunch hours. Staff is nice and keep things moving along as fast as possible. Have occasionally had bad food here though. Especially the fries which is a shame because McDonald’s fries are usually so good. And I believe prices are slightly lower because it’s an educational campus.
Clean and spacious. The kiosk machine was operating with a enough distance during this COVID sensitive time.
The fast food joint serves independant self-serving, order placing booths to customers. Food is as good like any other MacD outlets. Warm, fresh and crazily yummy.

Very fast service despite large number of customers yet the quality of the food is not at all compromised. I would even say this is the best McDonald's food I've ever had quality wise. Six ordering stands are available so service flows very smoothly. Fantastic experience
In a time where burger shops are getting ahead of themselves, trying to be gourmet and all, good old McDonald’s is the best. Honest for what it is. The taste of no pretence is most delicious
Do not order when lots of people is lining especially on Sunday. The front counter 's work slowly. Have to wait for a super long time.

As usual, as great as the brand already is....
• Very good taste of it's food as usual.
• The staff is very friendly.
• Cleanliness is well maintained.
• Situated in a food court kind of environment, in North Spine plaza, NTU.
• Does have self-ticketing machines to order whatever you want.
• Overall a great experience.

Waited my order for 10mins over the counter, my number was called but the crew have no idea where was my order. I ordered to eat in, but they packed it up. So i had to wait for then to find it and put it on the tray....   Had breakfast muffin and wrap each time and the egg has shell... Big breakfast was unavailable on the saturday and have limited options... bad
The standard McDonald's experience within the campus of NTU. Accessible and affordable for everyone.  Only downside is the huge crowds drg peak hours drg school time.
Fast and efficient service. You can order online and wait for your turn to pick up your order. Not many seats available due to safe distancing.
Hiding in NTU, great place to hang out with family during weekends as its always not crowded.
NTU student favourite food but also the most hated outlet because none of mcdonald deals are applicable to NTU outlet. -.-

The staff here keeps getting the orders wrong.
Not sure if they are under staffed or slow.
Some of the staff here are rude too.

The food is okay...it's McDonalds 😂

I have ordered from this McDonald's twice, and both times I was given the wrong food. First, I got a burger instead of McNuggets, and the the second time I was given chicken wings instead of a McChicken. Dissappointed. Just wanted some nugs...

The service staff here are very friendly and food is slightly cheaper than outside. Otherwise there is still a lunch crowd but surprisingly wait times are not unreasonable

Pretty good place
Located at north spine plaza those who visit there don't worry there's alot of food selling there.
Life-saver food shop for students as it opens late at night. Always crowded, sometime they serve the wrong order, make your to check before grabbing your to-go food.
Long queues during peak hours, but very efficient service. Standard McDonald's menu available.
It's mostly the only place in NTU open to eat till midnight and they use that as a leverage to serve NON-FRESH food, mostly buns. On a good side, staff is very nice.
It has the longest operating hours and it's still open at night and on weekends when all other eateries in NTU are closed.
It's MacDonald's, the same one everywhere. Qs can be a bit chaotic during mealtimes, otherwise it's all good. There is no air-conditioning but plenty of seats.
Very good
Would be great if McDonald's app deals are redeemable here
jus aany other macdonald but note that they dont allow the mcdonald app deals
Available at late night when other shops are closed. Prices are usually lower than other McDonald's outlets
bad service and taste. just near to my workplace.
Today's twisty fries and nuggets was excellent, very crispy. 10/10
Bloody 30mins for one apple pie, the brigade is inefficient inside the kitchen, the manager has no assertiveness over the members
Slightly cheaper and less choice compared to other McDonald's restaurants in Singapore and, sadly, the only option for a late dinner in NTU.
Good service and many tables to sit and have the meal.
Taste like regular mcdonald's, price is the same as non institutional outlets

Run by 2 young guys, wasn’t crowded on a Sunday afternoon. We ordered the Prime black pepper steak 🥩 medium well. It’s was a good cut of meat, cooked to the degree I wanted… yumz!! Black pepper sauce was pretty good. It’s comes with 2 side dishes. Overall value for money, $11 per plate and I enjoyed the steak. Easily accessible by private transport and the multi storey carpark is just beside the coffeeshop so no worries about getting caught in the rain.

Ordered their chicken wings with waiting for our dinner to arrive. Their chicken wings were very tasty and crispy. Priced at $1.50 per piece with a minimums order of 2pcs. Their menu looks good and I hope to come by to try more of your dishes soon.

Pretty large portion for the price. Ordered multiple times and quite like the food. Generally prefer their grilled options to their fried options, and some of my favourites are Grilled Dory, Chicken Chop & Fish & Chips. For sides their curly fries, fresh salad and mac & cheese are pretty good imo. Portion for pastas is kinda small, so I wouldn't go for them.
The chef looks young, but their black pepper Sirloin steak at medium rare is really good. Nice cut and cook well to our liking. Will come back for other food items.  Keep up the good food.

Ordered a Half Spring Chicken Set which came with two side dishes of your choice.

Reasonably priced at $5.90 however the Spring Chicken is too over fried as such it is dried and tough.

Sides dishes are acceptable.

Waiting time can be from 20mins onwards during peak hours.

Located in a quiet neighbourhood, this stall can be found in the coffeeshop under a multistorey carpark. The #ChickenChop in #MushroomSauce is average, like its coleslaw but the onion rings is a failure. Might not return again.
$6 for this huge piece of chicken chop
SUPER BAD customer service. Ignore you all the way till you ask them able to take order and is during off peak hours.

Nice hot and spicy. Take mild and try. Add the egg as it helps to lower the spice. Dun try to be superman on your first try.

This shop do help to separate those items that can or should be tried. A different take
Spice level linger so try to go easy. Very solar to the ones I eaten in most part of china when I was oversea.
.

Really oily but the 麻辣was really there. You have to wait for quite some time for your food (we waited 30min~). Pricing is by grams so it’ll be the same price regardless of meat/vegetables. Ngl the price was a bit more $$ compared to other places… Milk tea was a bit too sweet but provides a good relief after the spice👍

6 Jun '22:
Return visit so I could try their mala soup version. I had it medium spiciness and it was excellent. Almost addictive. More la and less ma, which I find a deviation of original mantra of Sichuan cuisine.
Nonetheless, it was excellent meal.

5 Jun '22:
Had a hard time trying to find the place. This hideout had both indoor (air con) and outdoor. Good vibes and cosy environment.
A huge variety to choose from.
Ordered both the less- and medium- spicy levels. The medium spicy level has a good kick and numbness to it.
The must-haves are potato, lotus root, beancurd skin, cuttlefish balls and whole fish. They have other proteins such as chicken and pork but they do not label them.
Ask for the reward card which they give 1 stamp for every $15 spent.
Free parking after 6pm.

I love how they deep fried the potato slices and scrambled the eggs. For someone that cannot really take spice, xiao la was a little too spicy for me… but it was worth it. It was very fragrant instead of just spicy. POTATOES & EGGS are a MUST order.
For this bowl, it was $30.

So i am here quite regularly. The mala is spot on. Small spicy is plenty good enough for me
Today try set lunch where they get random stuff for you. Good bowl of stuff and i fully enjoyed it.
Fav mala in Singapore. Go for the fish, potato, chicken, pork, beef, vege, eggs, potatoes, lotus etc etc. All good. Maggie mee must take.
Also sell ice-cream so you can cool your mouth after.

Second time eating here due to long queues since the start of the semester. Came down once we heard that the opening hours are extended to Saturdays as well(used to be closed on Saturdays).

Soup is nice, Potatoes , fish and luncheon meat etc. are fried separately.

Very clean environment, tissue box one every table. Choice of indoor(air conditioned) or outdoor seating. You will not end up with the mala smell on your clothes even if you sit inside for more than one hour.

Price is higher than most mala hotpot outside, but definitely worth it for the environment, service and quality of food.
Do join their telegram channel for special promotions. There is currently membership for discount and freebies.

Very crowded during school days, lunch/dinner hours. Queue can be very long, only one group will be able to pick the food at a time.
very good mala xiang guo.  luv the scrambled eggs n fried potato. the Thai milk tea is delicious too. a must try for mala lovers

Unique mala experience. Mala collagen soup was unique, tho less spicy that the usual mala stall so do get da la at least if you are a spice lover. Dry mala was good, especially with Maggie noodles inside. Must try the potatos, luncheon meat, lotus root and fish which are deep fried before adding into dry or soup bowl. Eggs are scrambled to perfection and supper yummy!

(15th June '22, ~5.45pm)
It's the best dried mala hotpot I've ever tasted in SG!! The spice is out of this world I'd say! For this 2nd visit, we increased our portion up to Abt $65 for the 2 of us, with the usual stuff we love. Spiciness still remain at small which is just the right amount for us to enjoy.

They offer to separate the fried stuff such as luncheon meat, fish and potato (sliced and fried into chips). You won't regret just DO IT. Add a buncha eggs to get them scrambled and watery down onto your bowl. Also preferred the smaller noodles while the sauce dances intensely ard them. Slurp carefully! The Thai milk tea is a must-have. THICK is the word. Add a little bit of water as it's Abit too sweet for me.

Pretty nice of u guys to include extra ingredients such as fried fish in our pot during our 1st visit. Will be back for more cravings!

They deep dry the potatoes and lotus roots, which makes the dish really good. It smells amazing and I can't wait to dig in from the takeaway box.

HOWEVER, usually good things come with certain level of screwed ups right. That's the case for me. I ordered a mala soup take away and I was given a dry mala instead. When I approached the counter they told me no more soup available. Perhaps they can let me know earlier.

Also during dinner time it is better not to come later than 7pm to avoid the same disappointment and the long waiting hours. Yep, I waited for 1 hour for the take away.

honestly the best mala i’ve had in singapore, and the way they fry the eggs, potatoes, and lotus root is amazing~

overall an excellent spot for a nice lunch/dinner with friends, and i’ll definitely be visiting more too!!

this place is highly raved and recommended by my cousin who studied at ntu! it was my first time having soupy mala xiang guo and i must say that im quite impressed! the scrambled eggs and fried potato/lotus root made the meal a surprisingly unique one, except the fact that it wasn’t numbing at all which a typical mxg should be? hence one star off fr that inconsistency. that aside, everything was fairly good and i’ll probably return again when craving hits!

who knew scrambled eggs and potato crisps would go so well with malatang? this is a bowl that i’ll remember for a while to come; terrible location putting me off but i hope to come back again at some point in the future
mala taste ok, waited one full hour for our food, and we realized that most of our ingredients amount got cut! and some ingredients we took were missing! we paid $30 for one small bowl! unacceptable!

Xiao la is too spicy for me!!!! If i ever go back, i'll totally request for extra extra xiao la, and if it's not possible maybe i'll try their soup version hahaha. But IMHO best best mala xiang guo i've ever tasted!!!! Compulsory topping: EGGS (best cos they scrambled it OMG BEST) and whole fish. I wish it's not too far away from the city cos it takes 1.5 hours to reach NTU sia
Impressive and interesting mala collagen soup! Thai Green Milk Tea is good too (forgot to take picture) Will be back again :)

After watching the review of a food vlogger we decided to try.

They go by weight and it's not the cheapest.  If you want to really get your money's worth, just take all meat, seafood and mushroom. Forget anything green.

None of the food is labelled so, choosing the meat is just a matter of fatty or lean.

They are very responsive on the telegram chat so just check with them for any queries.

Ideally, start your meal no later than 6.30 pm.  The queue gets out of control towards the night. We stepped in at 6pm and we were eating in less than 15 minutes.

The spice level of "low" is equal to "Wei la" outside.

The fried potato, is no different from potato chips, nothing really amazing, maybe potato chips are cheaper.

The fried lotus root was interesting. Since we do not find the fried lotus root chips outside easily, it is worth a return trip. Our nitpick is, they just fry the items without seasoning, no Cajun powder no salt n pepper. (OK maybe the dory had salt)  perhaps my expectation were shaped by LokLok and therefore too high.

I would really have preferred if they deep fried then somehow integrated the mala sauce with the fried items, maybe offer a dip. Maybe I am too influenced by loklok.

The scrambled eggs are just scrambled eggs without any seasoning.

Every other item was typical of a Mala shop. Either you agree with the taste or disagree. I agree with the taste.

The green and brown drink is Thai milk tea. The green one seems to be Thai milk tea with jasmine green tea. They are not really strong brew, but worth the $2.50 price tag. Probably one of the cheapest Thai milk tea.

There is a strange smell on the tray, but small matter, just put it away.

Unlike many other eating places in NTU there is no student price for flashing your student card here.

This place is not worth a detour. It is worth trying if you are in the area or you drive.

A Hot Hideout @ NTU
Yummy yummy mala selling here!  The collagen soup is delicious too! Very different with the mala in other parts of Singapore! Must try! Highly recommended! I wish I could add six stars 👍👍👍
love their scrambled egg and fried potato, mala was not too oily and flavour was really good, would eat again
Really one of my favourite mala tang out there!!!! The only thing is tat BOTH outlet is so far away frm me…

The mala here is definitely one of the best and cheaper ones I have had.

They offer ingredients that one would normally not find in other mala stalls but still manage to blend them seamlessly into the dish. I would highly recommend the eggs, which they serve scrambled on top of the dish. Another unique point would be how they deep-fry certain ingredients (best of which are the potatoes, lotus root, and fish) which add an extra layer of texture and taste. I find the dry version to be the better style of their mala, but this is not to discount the soup version, which is rather flavourful as well. Though do expect to wait around 15 - 25 minutes, which feels rather acceptable to me considering the level of preparation.

The price is based off the weight of the ingredients, irregardless of whether they are meat or vegetable. Compared to other mala stalls, the price here is considerably cheaper and you can expect to spend around S$8 - 10 per person for a filling portion.

The store has a great ambience as well with a cozy indoor setting and also a cool outdoor seating overlooking a part of the campus. Some seats to wait at is also provided along the corridor to the store which is an added bonus.

I end with their service, which is mainly what prompted me to write this review. The staff there have always been friendly and helpful in all my visits. I would like to highlight a recent visit when they unfortunately made a mistake in the order. As we only noticed later when the store was about to close, we were not able to ask for the missing ingredients. However, my friend was contacted by an employee of the store who was very apologetic and offered a discount off our next order. The responsibility and service shown by the staff through this action definitely reinforced the consistency in their service.

All in all, definitely worth the trip into NTU!
11/10 Food, the only place where getting seafood with your mala is actually a smart decision. Winning free ice cream for the party feels pretty good too. Come early / late to avoid the queue!

Beverage stall opened by young entrepreneurs. Worth a support! They accept paynow. They offer rare drinks like butterfly pea but the highlight is the Thai iced milk tea with a hinge of coconut taste. According to them their specialty is their coconut coffee.

Interesting selection of drinks: dark chocolate milk, butterfly pea tea with lemon, rose tea, your classic coffees, etc. Recently opened! Happy to have a bit more variety in this food market. Owner is very friendly!
Best mala restaurant in NTU, and some say jurong. Must try the mala tang
as a non mala eater this place CONVERTED me took me through heaven and hell (from the HOTness) and back down as a loyal worshipper 🙏🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼

Rlly love love love the collagen mala soup here! Makes the spice less painful and the soup way more drinkable! They deep fry their potatos and fish to give that crunch and serve eggs in a fluffy soft scramble on top. Super love!
Definitely get the fish for your choice of meat because they'll fry it really nicely for you! (Potato and lotus root as well) Scrambled egg is very fluffy too :)
Pretty good!!!! Their mala has KICK

Never disappoint you when you pick their Ma lah variant !
Foodie is fresh and yummy !
Loved the scramble eggs and fried lotus root. 中辣 not that spicy
By far one of the best mala I’ve ever had. The crispy potatoes are to die for and the drinks are a perfect pairing for the spicy meal.

Have been here a few times but I feel the need to review my latest visit. We had to wait for almost an hour (see photo attached). There was Raydy-o silence from the restaurant's Instagram despite the numerous tags. And when the food arrived, the ingredients in the soup were barely cooked. One can only wonder how a dish that took close to an hour to prepare could somehow arrive undercooked. Did the bowl take a detour through Antarctica? My friends and I soldiered through because we did not want our stomachs to be held hostage for another 60mins. After the "meal", we let the cashier know about the state of the food. The cashier could only apologise. Having been wronged in time and in taste, I feel the customer service, like the dish, was undercooked.
super nice place, great thai milk tea and delicious broth!!! their potatoes and egg are the highlights for me :)
Love their fried lotus and potatoes! Must try their mala collegen soup with their egg as well!
So hidden place to find ,but after you fined out you will so happy

awesome mala food and thai milk tea.
luv that they fry the lotus root - its a must try!
should really try out their mala tang and topping off with the scrambled egg as well as fried potato & lotus roots!
taste is impeccable!!!! so yummy that the 1h+ queue is definitely worth it

Basically, a Starbucks concept in hawker center but added on with Thai drinks such as coconut Thai milktea, rose tea and butterfly pea and half price compared to cafes! They uses espresso machine to extract their tea, a method called teapresso adapted from UK. Hopefully this will get recognize to bring our local hawker culture to a whole new level, all the best to them! 💪🏻
Friendly service with good soup base.
Love the deep fried potato slices! Decent mala to have
must order the mala soup hot and the potatoes. definitely my go-to place in NTU for mala
Probably the best mala hotpot.
Very good place to enjoy mala on a rainy day with a fried twist to the usual potatoes
potatoes were cooked really nicely and their malatang tastes gud!
v yummy!! love the fried fish and scrambled eggs 😌
Only thai milk tea is left, cafe latte not i. Stock already
interior design looks dope, foods great too!

Came on weekday evening.
No queue. But most table are under reserve.

Service ok. Pro-active but not flexible.

Food Nice. However their bake potato no longer the same I use to taste before. 🙃

Garlic bread soggy — 🫤

Will recommend to make reservation prior to it.
Childhood family restaurant! Back to enjoy a nice dinner. The western menu still relatively the same and taste delicious.

A set meal of Grilled Barramundi with Hollandaise Sauce, Cream of Shiitake Mushroom and Mango Mousse Sliced Cake with Earl Grey Tea fills the hungry belly 😋
If you're a small eater, please bring your family to savor the delicious western meal.

A casual dining restaurant with reasonable pricing. The steak is good and comes with seasonal promotion most of the time. One may top up to a set to make it a complete meal. And there’s a wide range of different types of coffee that you can upgrade, which I personally love the mocha.

The lunch set meal comes with a soup with a garlic bread, a main, a dessert and a cup of coffee/tea, which can all be upgraded at a small cost. Lately there’s also a one for one promotion during weekdays lunch.

With the membership sign up, you may redeemed points which is converted to cash rewards, plus other benefits, such as birthday e-voucher.
Average service as waiters got our orders wrong but the food was amazing as always.

Had the T bone set for 2.. the waiting time was definitely not 30min as stated. It took close to an hr for the meat to be served. Sides were generous and we were honestly already full from them while waiting for the main.
Sides (potatoes & macncheese) were great but the T bone was extremely tough and not tasty at all..

Curly fries was over salty. Mixed lamb n fish presentation was lacklustre, piece of fish was small, overall taste still alright. Beef stew and rice tasted nice. Overall good enough for a quick business lunch.

I was disappointed with the quality served at Jurong Safra branch. Only 3 service crews on that day, beside the slow service, the food quality was bad, steak was tough, lobster was over cooked and not fresh.
These 2 stars was given for the 3 service crews as they are trying their best to serve everyone.
I have pics to contribute as I really have no mood by the time food we're served 😟

The red meat plate are good for affordable price. The entries and the desserts so so (rather close to company' cantine than French basic pâtisseries from street' corner).   For entries and desserts, rather feel like eating ibis budget hotel than novotel for those who know. Mains really worse it however. So overall as it is cheap it's OK for quick lunch or dinner.

Always hearty meals here at the good ol' Jack's Place! Even kid's meals are pretty full sized! The familiar western selections, and that potato with skin topped with a heapful of sour cream, bacon bits and spring onions! We were there to celebrate the boys birthday and service was impeccable, constantly checking if everything was fine! :)

Very bad customer service, eating the main course half way they suddenly serve the desert and clear my plate as the food not finish, ask for a extra chair to put my baby stuff and bag and the staff there keep saying u block the way here and there, I already push the chair very near to my table, I'm there with my family to spend and have our nice dinner, not asking for your staff to treat us like that. Food potion is getting lesser and lesser and price is getting higher and higher. Never think about go back again as there are many other choices out there.

Google should allow zero stars because that's how bad my experience was today. I walked in around 3pm and no one bothered to attend to me. Even though there was only 5 tables occupied while staff was just walking around.

After finally being shown to a table, I asked what was the soup of the day. But the staff did not know and said he will check. Was given a QR code to make my order. But it did not work saying the table was closed. Asked one staff for assistance. Was given an abrupt "wait ah". After awhile, asked another staff, given same response. I was finally then given a new qr code. Still no one told me what the soup of the day was.

15mins have since passed since I walked in. I am frankly very disappointed with how far the service standards of Jack's Place have fallen. I have been going to Jack's Place since Yen Sen Building in Orchard Road. I would have fully understood if it was crowded but it was the middle of the day, there were enough staff around and the restaurant was not even 1/3 full.

After 20mins, my appetite was gone and I left.

Overall a nice place for a family meal with a wide selection of dishes. The chocolate brownie was great but might be a bit too sweet. Had the slipper lobster aglio olio, the aglio olio was spicy and taste good but the lobster (crayfish) was tasteless and dry. Waiter wasn’t rude per se but is listless and unenthusiastic.

Reasonably priced family restaurant with western and local food. Good variety and set meals are value for money. Steak and baked potato is their regular favourites. Grill baramundi in the flavours of the sea is a good seasonal option. New staff Stephy is attentive. Other new service staff does well too.

Their offers are pretty good.
Love their potato with sour cream, chives and bacon bits. Pro tip, you can ask for seconds.

Celebrate family birthday here. Use GE voucher for Safra Jurong West branch. Average customer service as no smiles but service is prompt and businesslike. Food presentation can be improved as it can be better than Collins.

Nice ambience. Food is average. Ordered breaded fish and chips, and the grilled chicken set. Fish is not fresh, the pineapple that comes with the chicken tasted spoilt. If you are looking at value for money, come during lunch for the set lunch menu. Service was ok.

Value for money set western food, kids friendly with kids menu. Place is wheelchair accessible. Also available are premium steaks, lobsters, escargo and wine. For healthy choice, salads are available. Soft music plays in the background, no live band.
Book in advance to minimise waiting time. Food was good although the place was slightly understaffed. Will recommend this outlet if you're a safra member.

Overpriced and under delivered. I asked to take away a $6 soup and $6 chicken wings. The soup came in a small plastic container and it was only half full. And the 4 pc chicken wings was basically 2 wings and 2 drumsticks. If you’re are going to charge so much at least have the quantity to match. Or taste good. If I can get the same food from a coffee shop western shop, why would anyone come and eat here.

Dining ambience is satisfactory and food is so so compared to other Jack's Place outlet.

The reason I gave it a one star review is the service level, questions unanswered by a young female wait staff.

Hope to see some improvement on service level.

Thank you

Jacks Place used to be a great Steak Restaurant in the 90's..till some time in 2000's.(Their outlet in Killiney Rd was very good).Then they stopped serving Pork products in their dishes..& Fillet Mignon Sizzler steak which had Crispy Bacon on it was revamped wth other items. Further..their service attention to customers had waned also..& Red Wine was served chilled..thus ruining its taste. Lastly like most Western food outlets in Singapore  they hardly have any hot vegetarian main dish offerings.. unlike in North America etc (where there are atleast 5-6 items to choose). Overall an average Restaurant wth 5 star prices.

Had Barramundi with Otah & curry sauce under national dy promotion. Fish is fresh and juicy but pity the otah wasnt much thinner then in menu. It comes in set meal if you are willing to top up $6.80 to get a soup and dessert.

Food was average. 4 of us had their steaks..all i have to say is you better have  sharks teeth n jaw to chew that meat. Felt like i was fighting the animal while eating it. Even toigh meat can be prepared to be relatively soft. Simoly tgrowing a piece of meat on the frying pan does not make it a steak.. Just my oppinion. Service and ambionce was nice though.
Had food poisoning after having the the lobster and chicken combo, with the lobster soup. You might want to look into that.
Reasonable price western food and comfortable environment. Will go back there again.

Really disappointed in their red velvet cake. 3 years ago, we ordered a full 500g red velvet cake and we were served a majestic 3 layered red velvet masterpiece. This time we ordered a whole 500g red velvet again but it was 2 layer of red and 1 layer of cream, and the whole red velvet was covered with coconut shavings, horrible try at a new recipe.

Aside from the unfortunate red velvet incident, service and food quality still remains as great! We enjoyed ourselves.
Nice good food but not enough ppl to serve, long waiting time to clear table and serve desserts despite multiple reminders... will go another branch not Safra Jurong
Food was average. Service is slow, but servers were friendly and helpful. Managed to change the potato to more salad.

Almost two years since we last visited this place Service has dropped. Staff were rather unfriendly. Took super long time for the drinks (peach cooler, lychee cooler, longan coolers etc) to be served. Doesn’t make sense for simple drinks to take so long to be served. When it came, the peach cooler was very sweet. The aglio Olio was super super tough. Thankfully, the staff offered to do a replacement upon feedback.

I went there in Valentine and ordered their Valentine special. The food is good and the portion is big for the price. Its worth it. But it a little bit crowded and the service is alittle slow, I think is due to the valentine day.
I waited for 15min before I get a table even through I booked a week earlier.
Taste is average. Service is okay. If not for the lunch menu, then not worth it.

They changed their menu. Beef quality seems to drop.  Latte was diluted.  Service level needs to improve.
Twice i visited and they put me in one of the corner seat and forget about me. When you raised your hand, the waiters and waitresses just never seems to notice you. Pretty sad.

The appetiser is a bit too much for 1 person, maybe they try to match the amount food to the price.. but I rather they reduce the price instead. The main course is alright but the rareness scale is a bit off to the rare side.

Always love a Sunday dinner at this neighbourhood steakhouse 🥩 service is hit & miss depending on who’s serving you (I had a pleasant experience this visit, less the last). Most importantly food is good, so I’ll be back!
There is a lot of add in and option which made the price higher. The food is getting worse than before.

Hi, I would like to commend the jack's place team at Jurong safra outlet for an excellent service provided during my dine. You really have a very impressive team of staff. We found a hair in one of our course meal - aglio olio ordered by my friend. whilst i ordered the chicken cutlet. But the team compensated with both our meals as they saw that there was a piece of chicken cutlet in the aglio olio. Thanks team for making our dining experience here an awesome one. Will definitely recommend coming here.
Quiet dining experience. Food was served quickly, however the drinks did not come with straws and have to request to be given.
Quiet place, not crowded during weekday lunches, good for catch up
Food is served quite quickly. Good service.
Food is nice. Friendly waitress..
Professional service by the staff.
Celebrate Christmas here, the meal is delicious, the ambient is nice, the service is good.. Overall satisfied :D

Maybe because they were understaffed... I went there to dine for mother's day dinner with my mother. I reserved a table but they didn't seem to have my name on the reservation list? All the waiters were too busy to be flagged down. Clearing of plates was done when they happened to walk past the table, just the arm stretched in, take the plates and walk off. No asking " Is it okay if I clear the table". Had 2 items the waiters forgot to bring to us... which took a while for us to get them because the waiters were so hard to flag. In the end, we got some good service from the assistant manager.

Well a variety of delicacies to feast here. Though one may find it pretty expensive compared to other eateries, its worth the price one pays as the dishes are tasty and delightful. Its worth every penny spent. Friendly staff and a cosy atmosphere dwells in the dining area.

went during a Monday rainy evening as trying to avoid the crowds. food is good.  service is fine . was lucky as they were having half price promotion on combo grill . two adult with three children.  enjoyed. bill is about 90 dollar.  without promo should be around 130

Worst e dining experience. Ordered a main course. Waited 40 mins, the waiter come tell me it was not prepare. Multiple wrong food and beverage was serve.

Every food need to ask, then only will serve!
Quiet place serving decent western food at affordable price. Attentive staffs.
Not bad steak was pretty well done ☺️

Food is ok. Prefer the outlet at West Coast (permanently closed) where staff were friendly and the food was better. The water melon juice was diluted. Maybe too much ice. Will try other outlet next time.
Went to LJS NTU at 7:30 and after ordering, the cashier informed us that some of the things we ordered were sold out and they offered to give us some freebies to make up for it. Thanks abang!

1. Very slow service
2. Sometimes closes before the stated time
3. If ordering during non-peak hours, the food can be soggy and not fresh

Highly recommend to wait if you see not more than one person in the queue.

Standard fast food. Part of the Secret Society thats keeping LJS alive. Haha.
Yum yum.

Service kinda mixed up sometime
We know how it's always feel wonderful to be back to where we belong..  Your alma mater.. To see how much has changed over the last twenty years is just amazing..

I ordered dory,and they had problems finding it,I guess... It's been 15 minutes and counting... I see some people have waited 20 minutes...
I think they really need to review practices or they'll be out of business soon
Really nice staff! Food is prepared when asked, excellent service.
service is really slow here and sometimes i order the rice bowl it comes cool..
Very nice, wait 15 min havent get order
Nice..good service.. staff was very polite n friendly
The person say closing soon at 730 pm but it closes at 8 smlj
They pour drink first and wait for food. So I cannot get cool and fresh drinks
Best environment to enjoy the meal
The staff at the counter is very rude and poor service.
Very friendly staff with good service!
hire more ppl during exam weekends!!
